translated: The hook, and so on, of its light rays, is the summoning, and so on, of the vāyus of the nine orifices and the heart center, summoned by the vāyus of the nine orifices and the heart center.

original: dang po mgo bo dang spyi gtsug dang smin dbus dang / mig dang rna ba g-yas dang rna ba g-yon dang sna dang kha dang mgrin pa dang rgyab stod ltag pa dang / phrag pa dang mchan khung dang nu ma dang snying ga dang lte ba dang pho mtshan dang rtags dang bshang sgo dang brla dang pus mo dang byin pa dang rkang pa'i rgyab dang mthe bong dang sor mo ste gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams las bkug nas /
analyzed: dang po mgo bo dang spyi gtsug dang smin dbus dang / mig dang rna ba g-yas dang rna ba g-yon dang sna dang kha dang mgrin pa dang rgyab stod ltag pa dang / phrag pa dang mchan khung dang nu ma dang snying ga dang lte ba dang pho mtshan dang rtags dang bshang sgo dang brla dang pus mo dang byin pa dang rkang pa'i rgyab dang mthe bong dang sor mo ste gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams las bkug nas /
translated: First, having drawn them from the twenty-four places, the head, crown, middle of the brow, eyes, right ear, left ear, nose, mouth, throat, upper back, nape, shoulders, armpits, breasts, heart, navel, genitals, anus, thighs, knees, calves, back of the feet, toes, and thumbs,

original: de'i nang du son pa gnas bcu la gnas su bcug pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: de'i nang du son pa gnas bcu la gnas su bcug pa rnams kyis /
translated: those that have entered there, having been placed in the ten places,

original: gsang ba'i 'khor lo nyid du gong bur byas pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: gsang ba'i 'khor lo nyid du gong bur byas pa rnams kyis /
translated: having been made into a ball in the secret cakra,

original: des sbar ba ni gtum mo 'bar ba'i lcags kyu snying ga'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnams la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: des sbar ba ni gtum mo 'bar ba'i lcags kyu snying ga'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnams la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: those that are ignited are the hook of the blazing candālī that is applied to the wind maṇḍala of the heart, and so on.

original: des na rab tu rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: des na rab tu rgyas par ston te /
translated: Thus, it is extensively explained.

original: ci zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ci zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: What?

original: ci rtags med pa'i go 'phang gi gnas kyi gzhi la goms pas gnas nas /
analyzed: ci rtags med pa'i go 'phang gi gnas kyi gzhi la goms pas gnas nas /
translated: Is it that one abides in the state of the ground of the signless stage through habituation?🔽

original: gzhi la ste rten la gong du sa bon sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi la ste rten la gong du sa bon sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: What? By the repetition of the state of the base of the signless stage, one should apply the seed to the base, that is, to the support.

original: 'og gi gnas su ci la sbyar //
analyzed: 'og gi gnas su ci la sbyar //
translated: What is applied to the lower stage?

original: zhes shugs kyis gsungs ngo //
analyzed: zhes shugs kyis gsungs ngo //
translated: This is stated by implication.

original: de ltar hi ka zhes phyed dang bcas pa'i yi ge ni sgo dgu rnams kyi steng du ste gser gyi sgo la dag par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar hi ka zhes phyed dang bcas pa'i yi ge ni sgo dgu rnams kyi steng du ste gser gyi sgo la dag par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the syllable hi, together with the half, is on the nine doors, and is purified in the golden door.

original: mdzod spu ni smin dbus so //
analyzed: mdzod spu ni smin dbus so //
translated: The ūrṇā is in the middle of the eyebrows.

original: der skra dkar nyams par byed pa nye bar mtshon pa'i sa bon ham dang h'um ste des so //
analyzed: der skra dkar nyams par byed pa nye bar mtshon pa'i sa bon ham dang h'um ste des so //
translated: There, the seed of the illustration of the destruction of gray hair is ham and hūṃ.

original: nang du goms pa'i gnas skabs su mdzod spu'i 'og gi mtshams ji srid par drang ste /
analyzed: nang du goms pa'i gnas skabs su mdzod spu'i 'og gi mtshams ji srid par drang ste /
translated: In the internal repetition stage, it is drawn to the extent of the boundary below the ūrṇā.

original: des steng du mig las 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des steng du mig las 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, it moves above from the eyes.

original: de ltar dbang du byed pa kho na steng du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar dbang du byed pa kho na steng du sbyor ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is the application above, which is the subjugation alone.

original: snying gar slar yang rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su h'um sngon po sbyor ba sbyang bar skra dkar sa bon gyis zhes gsungs pas gsal bar byas te /
analyzed: snying gar slar yang rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su h'um sngon po sbyor ba sbyang bar skra dkar sa bon gyis zhes gsungs pas gsal bar byas te /
translated: Again, in the heart, in the center of the wind mandala, one should visualize a blue hūṃ, the seed of the white hair, in order to purify the union.

original: gzhan du na bug pa'i sa bon gyis zhes gsungs byar 'gyur ro zhes 'doms so //
analyzed: gzhan du na bug pa'i sa bon gyis zhes gsungs byar 'gyur ro zhes 'doms so //
translated: Otherwise, one would say the seed of the orifice.

original: ci ltar goms pa yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar goms pa yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is one to become familiar with this?

original: drag pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: drag pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said: “the fierce one,” and so on.

original: drag pa zhes pa ni 'chi ba'i rgyu'o zhes pas 'tsho ba 'dzin pa rnams kyi sgra skad de /
analyzed: drag pa zhes pa ni 'chi ba'i rgyu'o zhes pas 'tsho ba 'dzin pa rnams kyi sgra skad de /
translated: The fierce one is the cause of death, the sound of those who hold life.

original: des steng du gsang chen por nang gi brjod pas bskul bar zhes sbrel lo //
analyzed: des steng du gsang chen por nang gi brjod pas bskul bar zhes sbrel lo //
translated: By that, one is urged above, in the great secret, by the inner expression.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: sde ba brgyad rnams kyi mtha' ni ha'i sa bon te /
analyzed: sde ba brgyad rnams kyi mtha' ni ha'i sa bon te /
translated: The end of the eight classes is the seed of ha.

original: nang gi goo r'i'i sa bon ai yig gis khyad par du byas pa ni drag pa ste /
analyzed: nang gi goo r'i'i sa bon ai yig gis khyad par du byas pa ni drag pa ste /
translated: The inner seed of gaurī is distinguished by the vowel i, which is the fierce one.

original: yi ge phyed kyi sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge phyed kyi sbyar ba'o //
translated: It is the combination of a half-syllable.

original: drag pa ste ci @278a * //🔽zhig ce na /
analyzed: drag pa ste ci @278a * //🔽zhig ce na /
translated: What is the fierce one?

original: sde pa rnams kyi snga ma dbyangs kyi sde pa gang gi dang po yin pa de ni sde pa snga ma dang po can te ka sde'o //
analyzed: sde pa rnams kyi snga ma dbyangs kyi sde pa gang gi dang po yin pa de ni sde pa snga ma dang po can te ka sde'o //
translated: The first of the first of the schools is the Ka school, which has the first of the schools of the vowels.

original: de'i snga ma ka'i sa bon no //
analyzed: de'i snga ma ka'i sa bon no //
translated: The first of that is the seed of Ka.

original: sgra'i sgras ni 'og gi rlung gis sbar ba'i gtum mo'i sgras so //
analyzed: sgra'i sgras ni 'og gi rlung gis sbar ba'i gtum mo'i sgras so //
translated: The word sound is the sound of the fierce fire ignited by the lower wind.

original: rlung gi sa bon ni yum ste /
analyzed: rlung gi sa bon ni yum ste /
translated: The seed of the wind is the mother.

original: dma' bar ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi 'og gi mthar ro //
analyzed: dma' bar ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi 'og gi mthar ro //
translated: The lower is the end of the lower wind mandala.

original: steng gi mthar yang rlung gi sa bon no //
analyzed: steng gi mthar yang rlung gi sa bon no //
translated: The seed of the wind is also at the upper end.

original: 'di thams cad rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa zhes bsgom pas /
analyzed: 'di thams cad rlung gi dkyil 'khor la gnas pa zhes bsgom pas /
translated: Meditating on all of this as abiding in the wind mandala,

original: gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis bskyod pa'i rlung bkug nas /
analyzed: gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis bskyod pa'i rlung bkug nas /
translated: the winds that move the twenty-four places are drawn in.

original: gsang ba'i 'khor lo las steng du lte ba dang snying gar dang de las steng du mgrin pa dang smin dbus kyi mtshams dang de las kyang gong du 'pho ba'i dus su bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i 'khor lo las steng du lte ba dang snying gar dang de las steng du mgrin pa dang smin dbus kyi mtshams dang de las kyang gong du 'pho ba'i dus su bskul bar bya'o //
translated: From the secret chakra, above that, at the navel and heart, and above that, at the throat and the point between the eyebrows, and above that, at the time of transference, one should be urged.

original: gal te slar yang 'chi ba bcom nas skra dkar la sogs pa yang nyams par 'dod pa de'i tshe 'pho ba ni thabs sgom pa bor nas gzhan sgom zhing skra dkar nyams byed kyi sa bon ham dang h'um yig nag pos 'od zer nag po rnams kyis bdud
analyzed: gal te slar yang 'chi ba bcom nas skra dkar la sogs pa yang nyams par 'dod pa de'i tshe 'pho ba ni thabs sgom pa bor nas gzhan sgom zhing skra dkar nyams byed kyi sa bon ham dang h'um yig nag pos 'od zer nag po rnams kyis bdud
translated: If one wishes to conquer death again and to destroy the white hair, etc., then, having abandoned the meditation on the method of transference, one should meditate on another method.

original: rtsi'i char pas khyab par byas nas mgo bor dang gzhan du yang skra dang spu dkar po nyid bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtsi'i char pas khyab par byas nas mgo bor dang gzhan du yang skra dang spu dkar po nyid bsal bar bya'o //
translated: One should cause the white hair and so forth to disappear by means of black light rays from the black seed syllables ham and hum, which pervade the head and the rest of the body with a rain of nectar.

original: 'di yang nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'di yang nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: This is an illustration.

original: gdams ngag ji lta bar bsgom pa'i dbye ba las gnyer ma dang nad dang 'chi ba nyams par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gdams ngag ji lta bar bsgom pa'i dbye ba las gnyer ma dang nad dang 'chi ba nyams par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: One should cause wrinkles, disease, death, etc. to disappear by meditating on the instructions as they are.

original: 'dir nus pa med pa yang mchog tu bskul bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir nus pa med pa yang mchog tu bskul bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Here, one should exhort the powerless to the supreme.

original: de'i tshe ni sgo dgu rnams kyi mchog ste dam pa gser gyi sgo phye nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni sgo dgu rnams kyi mchog ste dam pa gser gyi sgo phye nas /
translated: At that time, having opened the supreme, the best, the golden door of the nine doors,

original: de'i skad cig la yid 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i skad cig la yid 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the mind will be transferred in an instant.

original: yid nyid ces pa drug pa'i don la dang po'o //
analyzed: yid nyid ces pa drug pa'i don la dang po'o //
translated: The mind itself is the first in the sense of the sixth case.

original: 'pho ba 'di'i phan yon ston pa /
analyzed: 'pho ba 'di'i phan yon ston pa /
translated: This shows the benefit of this transference.

original: lha zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The gods, etc.,

original: lha sku gzugs pa la sogs pa rnams dang / bram ze rnams sdig pa dang bral ba'i mi rnams gsod pa po dang / ma dang pha dang dgra bcom pa gsod pa dang dge 'dun gyi dbyen dang de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa ste /
analyzed: lha sku gzugs pa la sogs pa rnams dang / bram ze rnams sdig pa dang bral ba'i mi rnams gsod pa po dang / ma dang pha dang dgra bcom pa gsod pa dang dge 'dun gyi dbyen dang de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa ste /
translated: The gods, the images, etc., the Brahmins, the killers, the mother, the father, the arhat killers, the schismatic, the one who has shed the blood of the Tathagata with evil intent,

original: mtshams med pa lnga byed pa dang ; ma byin par len pa dang 'dod pa log par spyod pa yang gser gyi sgo'i lam 'dis 'pho ba ni ngan 'gro rnams las grol te /
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga byed pa dang ; ma byin par len pa dang 'dod pa log par spyod pa yang gser gyi sgo'i lam 'dis 'pho ba ni ngan 'gro rnams las grol te /
translated: the one who has committed the five deadly sins, the one who has taken what was not given, the one who has engaged in sexual misconduct, by this path of the golden door, the transference is liberated from the lower realms.

original: des ni ma yin pa kho na'o des ni sngon bag med pa las byas pa'i sdig pas gos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des ni ma yin pa kho na'o des ni sngon bag med pa las byas pa'i sdig pas gos pa ma yin no //
translated: By that, one is not at all defiled by the sin committed by previous heedlessness.

original: mang pos ci bya ste 'khor ba'i skyon nyon mongs pa la @278b sogs pa dang nad dang rgas pa'ang de la ring du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mang pos ci bya ste 'khor ba'i skyon nyon mongs pa la @278b sogs pa dang nad dang rgas pa'ang de la ring du 'gyur te /
translated: What is the use of many? The faults of cyclic existence, the afflictions, etc., and also the disease and aging, are far away from that.

original: bde 'gror skyes pa na byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa mthong bas de rnams rtsad nas 'byin pa'i thabs rjes su bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde 'gror skyes pa na byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa mthong bas de rnams rtsad nas 'byin pa'i thabs rjes su bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When born in the happy realms, by seeing the Bodhisattvas and so forth, one will practice the means of completely eliminating those.

original: ji ltar 'dam du skyes kyang padma mdzes pas shin tu dri ma med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dam du skyes kyang padma mdzes pas shin tu dri ma med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a lotus born in the mud is very pure, beautiful, and stainless,

original: sdig pa rnams kyis dang por sngar mi shes pa la sogs pas gang rnams kyi lus gos pa de rnams kyis zhes pa 'pho bas srid pa bar do la sogs pa rnams su ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sku rang 'dod pas spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdig pa rnams kyis dang por sngar mi shes pa la sogs pas gang rnams kyi lus gos pa de rnams kyis zhes pa 'pho bas srid pa bar do la sogs pa rnams su ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi sku rang 'dod pas spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, those whose bodies are first covered by the stains of misdeeds and so forth, by the transference of consciousness, in the bardo of becoming and so forth, will take on a body of the nature of wisdom, and will act as they wish.

original: 'pho ba yang 'chi ba'i dus la bab pa na bya ste /
analyzed: 'pho ba yang 'chi ba'i dus la bab pa na bya ste /
translated: The transference should be done when the time of death has arrived.

original: dus ma yin par byas na lha gsod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus ma yin par byas na lha gsod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If done at the wrong time, it will be the killing of a god.

original: de'i phyir 'chi ba'i rtags rnams lus la mtshon par bya ba ni rang bzhin du gnas pa'i lus la ste gzhan du na the tshom mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chi ba'i rtags rnams lus la mtshon par bya ba ni rang bzhin du gnas pa'i lus la ste gzhan du na the tshom mo //
translated: Therefore, the signs of death should be shown on the body in its natural state; otherwise, there will be doubt.

original: khams mi mnyam pa las dang nad las dang rab rib la sogs pa'i mthu las dang 'jigs pa dang mya ngan la sogs pa'i nus pa las rnam pa gzhan du snad do //
analyzed: khams mi mnyam pa las dang nad las dang rab rib la sogs pa'i mthu las dang 'jigs pa dang mya ngan la sogs pa'i nus pa las rnam pa gzhan du snad do //
translated: The other kinds of appearances are due to the power of the elements being out of balance, of karma, of disease, of cataracts, etc., and of the force of fear, grief, etc.

original: dbang thang dang 'byung ba dang gnyis ka 'khrugs pa las 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: dbang thang dang 'byung ba dang gnyis ka 'khrugs pa las 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The characteristics of death are of three kinds: due to the power of the elements, due to the power of karma, and due to the power of both.

original: 'chi ltas 'byung ba thob nas de las dbye bas mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chi ltas 'byung ba thob nas de las dbye bas mtshon par bya'o //
translated: When the signs of death have appeared, they should be interpreted according to their class.

original: de la bskal pa 'khrugs pa nang dang phyi ste /
analyzed: de la bskal pa 'khrugs pa nang dang phyi ste /
translated: There are two kinds of elemental disturbances: internal and external.

original: rim pa ji lta bar aa na sha na la sogs pa dang thog 'bab pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta bar aa na sha na la sogs pa dang thog 'bab pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order, they are the disturbances of the elements of the hell beings, etc., and the disturbances of the elements of the gods, etc.

original: de bzhin du 'byung ba 'khrugs pa ni mkhris pa la sogs pa dang me dang chu la sogs pa'i nye bar tshe ba'o //🔽'chi ba'i rtags rnams ni slar yang phyi'i rnams dang nang gi rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'byung ba 'khrugs pa ni mkhris pa la sogs pa dang me dang chu la sogs pa'i nye bar tshe ba'o // 'chi ba'i rtags rnams ni slar yang phyi'i rnams dang nang gi rnams so //
translated: Similarly, there are two kinds of elemental disturbances: those of bile, etc., and those of fire, water, etc.🔽The signs of death are also of two kinds: external and internal.

original: de la phyi'i 'chi ba'i rtags rnams grangs las 'das pa rnams te /
analyzed: de la phyi'i 'chi ba'i rtags rnams grangs las 'das pa rnams te /
translated: The external signs of death are beyond number.

original: de rnams kha cig gis ni lo brgya rnams kyis kyang sus smra bar nus /
analyzed: de rnams kha cig gis ni lo brgya rnams kyis kyang sus smra bar nus /
translated: Some are not able to speak even in a hundred years.

original: gzhan yang phyi'i mtshan nyid tsam las 'chi ba yang dag par nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi'i mtshan nyid tsam las 'chi ba yang dag par nges pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, death is not ascertained only from external signs,

original: phyi rol du blo phyin ci log pas nad la sogs pa las kyang dogs so //
analyzed: phyi rol du blo phyin ci log pas nad la sogs pa las kyang dogs so //
translated: because one is afraid of illness, etc. due to the mind being turned outward.

original: nang gi rnams ni mnyam pa rang bzhin du gnas pas brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi rnams ni mnyam pa rang bzhin du gnas pas brtag par bya'o //
translated: The internal ones should be examined because they are naturally even.

original: de la ni dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams nas nyin gsum du rlung zla ba nas tho rangs dus sbyor gcig gam thun phyed du 'bab ste dus sbyor ram thun phyed gnyis pa nyi mar ro //
analyzed: de la ni dkar po'i tshes gcig nas brtsams nas nyin gsum du rlung zla ba nas tho rangs dus sbyor gcig gam thun phyed du 'bab ste dus sbyor ram thun phyed gnyis pa nyi mar ro //
translated: There, beginning from the first day of the bright fortnight, the wind moves for three days from the moon to the conjunction at dawn, for one conjunction or half a period. The second conjunction or half period is from the sun.

original: de'i rjes su nyin gsum rnams @279a * //
analyzed: de'i rjes su nyin gsum rnams @279a * //
translated: After that, for three days

original: nyi ma nas tho rangs dus sbyor gcig gam thun phyed du ste gnyis pa'i dus sbyor ram thun phyed ni zla ba nas so //
analyzed: nyi ma nas tho rangs dus sbyor gcig gam thun phyed du ste gnyis pa'i dus sbyor ram thun phyed ni zla ba nas so //
translated: from the sun to the dawn conjunction, for one conjunction or half a period. The second conjunction or half period is from the moon.

original: dbugs brgya phrag bco brgyad dus sbyor gcig dang / dbugs phyed dang bcas pa'i brgya phrag bcu gsum thun phyed do zhes sngar bshad zin te /🔽'dod pa gnyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: dbugs brgya phrag bco brgyad dus sbyor gcig dang / dbugs phyed dang bcas pa'i brgya phrag bcu gsum thun phyed do zhes sngar bshad zin te / 'dod pa gnyis kyang ngo //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: de ltar nyin zhag gsum gsum rnams kyis dus sbyor re re 'am thun phyed phyed rnams kyis sna bug dag tu rlung snrel zhi'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyin zhag gsum gsum rnams kyis dus sbyor re re 'am thun phyed phyed rnams kyis sna bug dag tu rlung snrel zhi'i rim pa'o //
translated: Three days and nights are one period. Half a period is one half-period. In the nostrils, the winds move in the sequence of the double-hours.

original: rim pa 'di bzlog pa ni 'chi ba'i rtags su rnam par nges so //
analyzed: rim pa 'di bzlog pa ni 'chi ba'i rtags su rnam par nges so //
translated: The reverse of this sequence is ascertained as a sign of death.

original: zla ba phyed pa gsum phyin ci log pa las zla ba drug rnams kyis 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: zla ba phyed pa gsum phyin ci log pa las zla ba drug rnams kyis 'chi ba'o //
translated: After three half-months in the reverse order, death occurs after six months.

original: zla phyed gnyis kyis mdza' bo rgud pa'o //
analyzed: zla phyed gnyis kyis mdza' bo rgud pa'o //
translated: After two half-months, there is misfortune for friends.

original: zla ba phyed kyi gcig gis nad do //
analyzed: zla ba phyed kyi gcig gis nad do //
translated: After one half-month, there is illness.

original: sna bug dang kha ste lam gsum rnams kyis rgyun nyi ma phyed las pha rol du 'chi'o //
analyzed: sna bug dang kha ste lam gsum rnams kyis rgyun nyi ma phyed las pha rol du 'chi'o //
translated: If the winds move in the three paths—the nostrils and the mouth—beyond the middle of the day, one will die.

original: sna bug dag 'pho ba dang bral bar 'bab na nyin bcu rnams kyis 'pho ba na'o //
analyzed: sna bug dag 'pho ba dang bral bar 'bab na nyin bcu rnams kyis 'pho ba na'o //
translated: If the winds move without changing in the nostrils, death will occur after ten days.

analyzed: sna bug gnyis spangs nas kha nas rgyu na nyin de kho na la'o //

analyzed: dgun zlar ba'i 'pho ba'i dus nas brtsams nas nyin lngar nyi ma'i lam nas rgyun lo bco brgyad rnams kyis so //

analyzed: tha skar can la de ltar rgyun lo bco lnga rnams kyis so //

analyzed: dbyar zla tha chungs la de ltar rgyun lo bcu gnyis rnams kyis so //

analyzed: dbyar zla ra ba la de ltar rgyun lo dgu rnams kyis so //

analyzed: nag pa can gyi la de ltar rgyun lo drug rnams kyis so //

analyzed: mchu can gyi la de ltar rgyun lo gsum rnams kyis so zhes pa thun mong du dus so //

analyzed: dus 'di rgyas can zhes bya ste //

original: gal te khyim der zla ba na //
analyzed: gal te khyim der zla ba na //

analyzed: skyes pa'i skar mar son par 'gyur //

analyzed: rgyas pa'i dus su de shes bya //

analyzed: de la 'chi ba brtag bya ba'o // rgyas pa'i dus su gal te rlung //

analyzed: nyin phyed nyi mar son par 'bab // lo ni bcu bzhi'i grangs rnams kyis //
translated: when the sun has reached the meridian,

analyzed: de tshe 'chi bas mtshon par @279b bya ;

analyzed: nyi ma phyogs dang ri bo drug / rig byed lo yis rim pas 'chi //

analyzed: nyin mtshan gyi bdag nyid rnams so // gnyis pa la 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag gi lhag ma cho lo dang zla ba dang nyin zhag rnams mdor bstan pa tsam gyis /

analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro dang dus kyi 'khor lor gsungs so //

analyzed: rgyas par bstan pa las ni nyin zhag 'dor ba brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: dus sbyor gyi rtsa rnams la shar du skye ba'i dus sbyor gyi rtsal /

analyzed: rtsa gzhan la yang nyin zhag 'dor ba ni 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag dang lhan cig pa kho nas shes par bya'o //

analyzed: de nas rtsa de dor nas rtsa gnyis pa la /

analyzed: rtsa dor na yang dbugs kyi 'khor lo dman pa med do //

analyzed: dbugs kyi 'khor lo yang sman pa med pa kho na'o //

original: rtsa gnyis pa la yang nyin zhag bcu rnams de lta kho na rgyun /
analyzed: rtsa gnyis pa la yang nyin zhag bcu rnams de lta kho na rgyun /

analyzed: mda' dang chu gter dang me'i nyin zhag rnams la der te ;

analyzed: de spangs nas lhag ma'i nyin zhag rnams dang lhan cig gsum pa la zhugs te /

analyzed: nyin zhag bco lnga de ltar rgyu zhing nyin zhag bdun cu lhag pa'i brgya 'dor ro //

analyzed: rgyu ste ; nyin zhag brgyad bcu rtsa gnyis 'dor ro //

analyzed: de spangs nas nyin zhag ma rnams bzung nas lnga pa la ste /

analyzed: nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa lnga rnams de ltar rgyu zhing /

analyzed: nyin zhag lnga bcu rtsa bdun rnams 'dor ro //

analyzed: lhag ma rnams dang lhan cig dgu par zhugs te nyin zhag bcu rnams rgyu zhing nyin zhag bcu rnams 'dor ro //

analyzed: nyin mo bcu gnyis na ni bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad kyis dman pa las so //

analyzed: gang gi tshe dus sbyor gyi rtsa snga ma la rlung zla ba'i lam nas /

analyzed: zla ba sum cu rtsa drug rnams kyis zla ba thog ma'i dang po'i zhag gcig 'bab bo //

analyzed: de ltar rtsa gcig la 'chi ltas kyi nyin zhag gsum rnams dang lhan cig zla drug 'dod ro //

analyzed: lhag ma rnams dang lhan cig gnyis pa la zhugs nas /

analyzed: bdun pa la sogs pa'i zla ba gsum rnams la rim pa ji lta bar nyin zhag bzhi rnams dang lnga rnams dang drug rnams rgyu ste /

analyzed: de ltar nyin zhag drug rnams kyis zla ba gsum 'dor ro //

analyzed: lhag ma rnams dang lhan cig gsum par 'pho ste /

analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i zla ba gsum la nyin zhag bdun dang brgyad dang dgu rnams 'bab bo //

analyzed: de ltar nyin zhag dgu rnams kyis zla ba gsum 'dor ro //

analyzed: lhag ma dang lhan cig bzhi par song nas gsum rnams su de ltar bcu dang bcu gcig dang bcu gnyis rnams 'bab bo //
