original: de ltar nyin zhag bcu gnyis rnams kyis zla gsum 'dor ro //
analyzed: de ltar nyin zhag bcu gnyis rnams kyis zla gsum 'dor ro //
translated: In this way, three months are subtracted by twelve days.

original: lhag ma rnams dang lhan cig lnga par zhugs te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams dang lhan cig lnga par zhugs te /
translated: The remaining days enter the fifth month together with the three days.

original: bcu gsum pa dang bcu bzhi pa dang bco lnga rnams rgyu'o //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa dang bcu bzhi pa dang bco lnga rnams rgyu'o //
translated: In the three months, thirteen, fourteen and fifteen days enter.

original: de ltar nyin zhag bco lnga rnams kyis zla ba gsum 'dor ro //
analyzed: de ltar nyin zhag bco lnga rnams kyis zla ba gsum 'dor ro //
translated: In this way, three months are subtracted by fifteen days.

original: lhag ma dang lhan cig drug par zhugs te gsum rnams la bcu drug dang bcu bdun dang bco brgyad rnams rgyu'o //
analyzed: lhag ma dang lhan cig drug par zhugs te gsum rnams la bcu drug dang bcu bdun dang bco brgyad rnams rgyu'o //
translated: The remaining days enter the sixth month together with the three days. In the three months, sixteen, seventeen and eighteen days enter.

original: de ltar nyin zhag bco brgyad rnams kyis zla ba gsum 'dor ro //
analyzed: de ltar nyin zhag bco brgyad rnams kyis zla ba gsum 'dor ro //
translated: In this way, three months are subtracted by the eighteen days.

original: lhag ma rnams dang lhan cig bdun par song nas gsum rnams su bcu dgu dang nyi shu rtsa gcig rgyu ste /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams dang lhan cig bdun par song nas gsum rnams su bcu dgu dang nyi shu rtsa gcig rgyu ste /
translated: The remaining days, together with seven, go to the third month, where they are added to the nineteen and twenty-one days.

original: de ltar nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa gcig rnams kyis zla ba gsum 'dor ro //
analyzed: de ltar nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa gcig rnams kyis zla ba gsum 'dor ro //
translated: In this way, three months are subtracted by the twenty-one days.

original: @281a * // lhag ma dang mnyam du brgyad par song bas gsum rnams su nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang / nyi shu rtsa gsum dang nyi shu rtsa bzhi rgyu ste /
analyzed: @281a * // lhag ma dang mnyam du brgyad par song bas gsum rnams su nyi shu rtsa gnyis dang / nyi shu rtsa gsum dang nyi shu rtsa bzhi rgyu ste /
translated: The remaining days, together with eight, go to the fourth month, where they are added to the twenty-two, twenty-three, and twenty-four days.

original: de ltar nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis zla ba gsum 'dor ro //
analyzed: de ltar nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams kyis zla ba gsum 'dor ro //
translated: In this way, three months are subtracted by the twenty-four days.

original: lhag ma rnams dang lhan cig dgu bar zhugs nas gsum rnams su nyi shu rtsa lnga dang nyi shu rtsa drug dang nyi shu rtsa bdun rgyu ste /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams dang lhan cig dgu bar zhugs nas gsum rnams su nyi shu rtsa lnga dang nyi shu rtsa drug dang nyi shu rtsa bdun rgyu ste /
translated: The remaining days, together with nine, go to the fifth month, where they are added to the twenty-five, twenty-six, and twenty-seven days.

original: de ltar nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa bdun rnams kyis zla ba gsum 'dor ro //
analyzed: de ltar nyin zhag nyi shu rtsa bdun rnams kyis zla ba gsum 'dor ro //
translated: In this way, three months are subtracted by the twenty-seven days.

original: lhag ma rnams dang lhan cig bcu par song ba gsum rnams su nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang nyid shu rtsa dgu dang sum cu rgyu'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams dang lhan cig bcu par song ba gsum rnams su nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang nyid shu rtsa dgu dang sum cu rgyu'o //
translated: The remaining three, together with the twenty-eighth, twenty-ninth, and thirtieth days, make twenty-eight, twenty-nine, and thirty days, respectively.

original: de ltar nyin zhag sum cu rnams kyis zla gsum 'dor ro //
analyzed: de ltar nyin zhag sum cu rnams kyis zla gsum 'dor ro //
translated: Thus, thirty days are subtracted from three months.

original: lhag ma rnams dang lhan cig bcu gcig par song nas gsum rnams su sum cu rtsa gnyis dang sum cu rtsa gsum rnams rgyu ste /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams dang lhan cig bcu gcig par song nas gsum rnams su sum cu rtsa gnyis dang sum cu rtsa gsum rnams rgyu ste /
translated: The remaining three, together with the thirty-first day, make thirty-two and thirty-three days, respectively.

original: de ltar nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gsum rnams kyis zla ba gsum 'dor ro //
analyzed: de ltar nyin zhag sum cu rtsa gsum rnams kyis zla ba gsum 'dor ro //
translated: Thus, thirty-three days are subtracted from three months.

original: bcu gnyis par zhugs nas thog ma'i rtsa la ma bab pa'i nyin zhag gsum gyis nyin zhag gnyis 'bab po //
analyzed: bcu gnyis par zhugs nas thog ma'i rtsa la ma bab pa'i nyin zhag gsum gyis nyin zhag gnyis 'bab po //
translated: Having entered the twelfth, the first three days of the month fall on two days.

original: lte ba la nyin zhag gcig go zhes pa zla ba'i 'chi ltas so //
analyzed: lte ba la nyin zhag gcig go zhes pa zla ba'i 'chi ltas so //
translated: One day falls on the navel. This is the death sign of the month.

original: 'dir gal te mngal nas skyes pa'i dang por byis pa la sogs pa la nyin zhag gcig gam nyin zhag gnyis la sogs pa rnams 'bab pa de'i tshe lte ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'dir gal te mngal nas skyes pa'i dang por byis pa la sogs pa la nyin zhag gcig gam nyin zhag gnyis la sogs pa rnams 'bab pa de'i tshe lte ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Here, if one day or two days, etc., fall on the first day of the month of a child born from the womb, then, beginning from the navel,

original: lugs las bzlog pas tshe'i nyin zhag rnams 'dor ro zhes shes par bya ste /
analyzed: lugs las bzlog pas tshe'i nyin zhag rnams 'dor ro zhes shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the days and nights of life are subtracted in reverse order.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'chi ltas dag la'o //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'chi ltas dag la'o //
translated: This is the case for the signs of death of the sun and moon.

original: dus tshod kyi skad cig gang la rlung gi 'gro ba gzhan 'jug pa'i dus tshod kyi skad cig de rdzogs pa na 'chi ba ste 'di la the tshom med do //🔽de ltar nyi ma'i 'chi ltas kyis sam zla ba'i 'chi ltas kyis khyim bcu gnyis 'dor ba las rnam par shes pa yang dbugs kyi 'khor lo spangs shing skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyun 'gags pa ni las kyis bskul ba'i srog gi rlung dang lhan cig dri zas bar
analyzed: dus tshod kyi skad cig gang la rlung gi 'gro ba gzhan 'jug pa'i dus tshod kyi skad cig de rdzogs pa na 'chi ba ste 'di la the tshom med do // de ltar nyi ma'i 'chi ltas kyis sam zla ba'i 'chi ltas kyis khyim bcu gnyis 'dor ba las rnam par shes pa yang dbugs kyi 'khor lo spangs shing skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyun 'gags pa ni las kyis bskul ba'i srog gi rlung dang lhan cig dri zas bar
translated: When the moment of time of the entry of another movement of wind is completed, death occurs. There is no doubt about this.

original: med par ram rnam pa gzhan gyis 'gro ba gzhan du 'gro zhing /
analyzed: med par ram rnam pa gzhan gyis 'gro ba gzhan du 'gro zhing /
translated: Thus, when the signs of death of the sun or moon have subtracted twelve houses, consciousness, having abandoned the wheel of breath, and having stopped the continuum of homogeneous character, goes to another destination, either without a body or in another form, together with the life wind impelled by karma.

original: skal pa mi mnyam pa'i rgyun mngon par 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: skal pa mi mnyam pa'i rgyun mngon par 'grub par byed do //
translated: It produces the continuum of a different character.

original: 'chi ba ni skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyun gyis rnam par shes pa dang dbang po dang tshe 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyun gyis rnam par shes pa dang dbang po dang tshe 'gag pa'o //
translated: Death is the cessation of consciousness, faculties, and life by the cause of the continuum of the same fortune.

original: de kho na mtshan rtags nges pa rnams kyis shes nas 'pho ba'i don du rnal 'byor brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na mtshan rtags nges pa rnams kyis shes nas 'pho ba'i don du rnal 'byor brtsam par bya'o //
translated: Having known that by the signs of reality, one should commence the yoga for the purpose of transference.

original: rnal 'byor brjod pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor brjod pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: For the sake of stating the yoga, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: nyon zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Listen, etc. ”

original: @281b rnal 'byor ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dag gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: @281b rnal 'byor ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dag gcig pa nyid de /
translated: Yoga is the identity of emptiness and compassion.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis bsgrub bya'i khyad par las lha'i rnal 'byor gyis so //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis bsgrub bya'i khyad par las lha'i rnal 'byor gyis so //
translated: By the yoga of the deity, which is the special object of attainment by means of that identity,

original: mnyam nyid ni ro gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: mnyam nyid ni ro gcig pa nyid de /
translated: equality is the state of one taste.

original: sems zhes pa khams bco brgyad kyi ngo bo thog mar gsungs pa'i chos rnams thams cad nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: sems zhes pa khams bco brgyad kyi ngo bo thog mar gsungs pa'i chos rnams thams cad nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: Mind is the essence of the eighteen constituents. All phenomena are indicated by the first [word].

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is stated:

original: sngar gyi mtshan nyid thams cad las //
analyzed: sngar gyi mtshan nyid thams cad las //
translated: “All phenomena have the characteristic of the former,🔽”

original: zhes so // mnyam pa nyid 'di'i sgrub par byed pa'i rim pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // mnyam pa nyid 'di'i sgrub par byed pa'i rim pa gsungs pa /
translated: The stage of the establishment of this equality is stated:

original: snying gar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: snying gar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: At the heart, etc.

original: sangs rgyas lnga'i sa bon ni h'um 'od zer dmar po can no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga'i sa bon ni h'um 'od zer dmar po can no //
translated: The seed of the five Buddhas is the red-rayed HŪṀ.

original: de ni des bkug pa'i lha mo'o //
analyzed: de ni des bkug pa'i lha mo'o //
translated: She is the goddess summoned by that.

original: ji srid du gzugs la sogs pa thams cad du stong pa nyid kyi rjes thogs su'o //
analyzed: ji srid du gzugs la sogs pa thams cad du stong pa nyid kyi rjes thogs su'o //
translated: As long as, everywhere, in form, etc.

original: h'um zhes pa ni sa bon gzhan nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: h'um zhes pa ni sa bon gzhan nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: HŪṀ is the indication of another seed.

original: dbugs mi g-yo ba nyid ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: dbugs mi g-yo ba nyid ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How is there immobility of breath?

original: dgang bya zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dgang bya zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: That which is to be filled, etc.

original: h'um sum yum yum kshum sm+r+yum hm+r+yum ym+r+yum kshm+r+yum zhes pa sgo dgu rnams su'o //
analyzed: h'um sum yum yum kshum sm+r+yum hm+r+yum ym+r+yum kshm+r+yum zhes pa sgo dgu rnams su'o //
translated: HŪṀ SUṀ YUṀ YUṀ KṢUṀ ŚRUṀ HAṀ ŚRUṀ YAṀ ŚRUṀ KṢAṀ ŚRUṀ in the nine doors.

original: snying gar ni h'um zhes pa'o //
analyzed: snying gar ni h'um zhes pa'o //
translated: At the heart, HŪṀ.

original: sa bon brgyad rnams ni /
analyzed: sa bon brgyad rnams ni /
translated: The eight seeds

original: h'um sum yum sm+r+yum hm+r+yum ym+r+yum kshm+r+yum zhes pa go cha'i sa bon brgyad rnams so //
analyzed: h'um sum yum sm+r+yum hm+r+yum ym+r+yum kshm+r+yum zhes pa go cha'i sa bon brgyad rnams so //
translated: are HŪṀ SUṀ YUṀ ŚRUṀ HAṀ ŚRUṀ YAṀ ŚRUṀ KṢAṀ ŚRUṀ, the eight seeds of the armor.

original: de rnams spyir btub ni /
analyzed: de rnams spyir btub ni /
translated: Those in general are

original: a'a li zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: a'a li zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ĀLI, etc.

original: ji bzhin zhes pa ji ltar rigs par ro //
analyzed: ji bzhin zhes pa ji ltar rigs par ro //
translated: As is fitting, as is appropriate.

original: sa bon ldan ni sa bon dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sa bon ldan ni sa bon dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Endowed with seeds, endowed with seeds.

original: de dang de'i gnas so //
analyzed: de dang de'i gnas so //
translated: In their respective places.

original: gal te yang sngar kha dog sna tshogs rnams brjod mod /
analyzed: gal te yang sngar kha dog sna tshogs rnams brjod mod /
translated: Even though various colors were mentioned previously,

original: de lta na yang 'dir sa bon rnams thams cad dkar po 'od zer dkar po can rnams so //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'dir sa bon rnams thams cad dkar po 'od zer dkar po can rnams so //
translated: nevertheless, here all the seeds are white, with white light-rays.

original: snying ga'i sa bon mdor bstan pa /🔽chu shing zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: snying ga'i sa bon mdor bstan pa / chu shing zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The seed at the heart is taught in brief:

original: snying gar padma chu shing me tog bzhin cung zad kha bye ba 'og tu kha phyogs pa ste /
analyzed: snying gar padma chu shing me tog bzhin cung zad kha bye ba 'og tu kha phyogs pa ste /
translated: The heart is a lotus like a plantain flower, slightly open, facing downward.

original: de'i dbus su sgong skyes so //
analyzed: de'i dbus su sgong skyes so //
translated: In its center is the egg-born,

original: de yang ye shes rlung la zhon pa h'um ngo //
analyzed: de yang ye shes rlung la zhon pa h'um ngo //
translated: mounted on the wisdom wind, the syllable hūṃ.

original: rnam shes ni yum yum hi ka ces pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes ni yum yum hi ka ces pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the mother, the syllable hi.

original: dngos po ni 'byung bas na ste khams bco brgyad kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni 'byung bas na ste khams bco brgyad kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The thing is the elements, the essence of the eighteen elements.

original: de'i dngos po ni rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni rang bzhin te /
translated: The thing of that is the nature,

original: rang bzhin med pa nyid mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa nyid mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: the naturelessness itself is the equality.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje zung du 'jug pa 'di thams cad bsgom par bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje zung du 'jug pa 'di thams cad bsgom par bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “all of this is to be cultivated” is the union of emptiness and compassion.

original: de las phyi rol te gzhan rnal 'byor rnam shes 'phrog pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de las phyi rol te gzhan rnal 'byor rnam shes 'phrog pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should think that the yogi’s consciousness is outside of that, i.e., elsewhere.

original: phyogs kyi khyim rnams ni steng dang 'og gi gnas rnams so //
analyzed: phyogs kyi khyim rnams ni steng dang 'og gi gnas rnams so //
translated: The “quarters” are the upper and lower places.

original: de rnams su sems par byed do zhes sems te rlung rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams su sems par byed do zhes sems te rlung rnams so //
translated: One should think that the winds are there.

original: de rnams kyi dgang ba dang bum pa can dang zhi byed rnams kyis sdud pas gang @282a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dgang ba dang bum pa can dang zhi byed rnams kyis sdud pas gang @282a * //
translated: They are filled by the inflation and vase-breathing and pacification yogas.

original: lte ba'i 'og tu sor bzhi dor nas rlung gi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: lte ba'i 'og tu sor bzhi dor nas rlung gi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: Four finger-widths below the navel is the wind maṇḍala.

original: de yi sems kyis bzlas pa bya //
analyzed: de yi sems kyis bzlas pa bya //
translated: One should recite with the mind there.

original: zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: zhes 'brel lo //
translated: This is the connection.

original: phyogs gnyis gnas zhes pa 'don pa la yang gnyis dag tu steng du 'og tu zhes 'don te kho na'o //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis gnas zhes pa 'don pa la yang gnyis dag tu steng du 'og tu zhes 'don te kho na'o //
translated: The two places are the two upper and lower recitations.

original: de yi steng rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du dbus su me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de yi steng rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du dbus su me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Above that wind maṇḍala, in the center, is the fire maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du dbus su lte ba la nyi ma rtul lo //
analyzed: de'i steng du dbus su lte ba la nyi ma rtul lo //
translated: Above that, in the center, is the sun at the navel.

original: de ru a'a li'i gtso bo aam sa bon te n'a da'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de ru a'a li'i gtso bo aam sa bon te n'a da'i ngo bo'o //
translated: There is the principal āli, the seed syllable aṃ, which is the nature of nāda.

original: k'a li ldan pa'i sa bon ni h'um ste snying gar ro //
analyzed: k'a li ldan pa'i sa bon ni h'um ste snying gar ro //
translated: The seed endowed with the kāli is hūṃ, which is in the heart.

original: de kho na ni aam gi sa bon te kha dog dmar po'o //
analyzed: de kho na ni aam gi sa bon te kha dog dmar po'o //
translated: That is the seed of aṃ, which is red.

original: sems kyi rgyal po zhon pa'i phyir khyogs dang 'dra bas khyogs te steng du rjes su 'gro ba'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyal po zhon pa'i phyir khyogs dang 'dra bas khyogs te steng du rjes su 'gro ba'i rlung ngo //
translated: Since it is the mount of the king of minds, it is a palanquin, which is the upper wind that moves upward.

original: 'khyer bar byed do zhes pa 'khyer ba kho na 'khyer byed de 'og tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'khyer bar byed do zhes pa 'khyer ba kho na 'khyer byed de 'og tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: That which carries is the carrier, which is the lower wind that moves downward.

original: de dag gis goms par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis goms par bya'o //
translated: One should become familiar with those.

original: de la khyogs kyis bsnun bzhin pa ni snying ga'i h'um gi sa bon 'khor dang bcas pa mgo bo ji srid par 'dren no //
analyzed: de la khyogs kyis bsnun bzhin pa ni snying ga'i h'um gi sa bon 'khor dang bcas pa mgo bo ji srid par 'dren no //
translated: There, while being struck by the palanquin, the seed of hūṃ in the heart together with its retinue is drawn up as far as the head.

original: de'i rjes su khyer byed kyis de nas snying ga ji srid par tshur 'dren no //
analyzed: de'i rjes su khyer byed kyis de nas snying ga ji srid par tshur 'dren no //
translated: After that, the carrier draws it back down to the heart.

original: de ltar k'a sh'i'i me tog bzhin 'dren pa dang tshur 'dren pa ni rnam par shes pa khyer bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar k'a sh'i'i me tog bzhin 'dren pa dang tshur 'dren pa ni rnam par shes pa khyer bar byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, like a kāsī flower, the drawing up and drawing down carries the consciousness.

original: khyogs kyi khyogs ni gyen du bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: khyogs kyi khyogs ni gyen du bskyod pa ste /
translated: The palanquin of the palanquin is the upward movement.

original: du la 'degs pa la'o zhes byings so //
analyzed: du la 'degs pa la'o zhes byings so //
translated: The verbal root is “to lift up.”

original: des khyogs kyi rjes thogs su khyer byed kyang bzlas pas dbang du byas nas rnal 'byor pas bdag nyid kyi lus las phyi rol du yang goms par bya'o //
analyzed: des khyogs kyi rjes thogs su khyer byed kyang bzlas pas dbang du byas nas rnal 'byor pas bdag nyid kyi lus las phyi rol du yang goms par bya'o //
translated: Having brought it under control by repeating the mantra of the carrier after the mantra of the palanquin, the yogi should also practice externally with his own body.

original: ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How? He says:

original: khyogs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyogs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The palanquin, etc.

original: 'degs pa ni khyogs te snying gnas phyi rol du 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: 'degs pa ni khyogs te snying gnas phyi rol du 'dren pa'o //
translated: The palanquin is that which lifts, drawing from the heart to the outside.

original: de kho na mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de kho na mtshan nyid de /
translated: That is the characteristic.

original: des mtshon bya rlung la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: des mtshon bya rlung la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: The one characterized is the wind, etc.

original: khyer ba ni khyer byed de snying ga ji srid par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: khyer ba ni khyer byed de snying ga ji srid par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: The carrier is that which carries, drawing as far as the heart.

original: de kho na mtshan nyid de bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na mtshan nyid de bsam par bya'o //
translated: That is the characteristic. It should be contemplated.

original: de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa rnam g-yeng med par ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar yang dang yang du goms pas /
analyzed: de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa rnam g-yeng med par ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar yang dang yang du goms pas /
translated: Thus, by repeatedly practicing in that way, without distraction in meditative equipoise,

original: khyogs dang khyer byed kyi ting nge 'dzin las mnyam pa nyid du ro gcig pa nyid rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba nyid 'grub 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyogs dang khyer byed kyi ting nge 'dzin las mnyam pa nyid du ro gcig pa nyid rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba nyid 'grub 'gyur te /
translated: the natural arising of the sameness of taste with the samādhi of the palanquin and the carrier is accomplished.

original: rlung dang rnam par shes pa dag gi de kho na nyid ro mnyam pa nyid dang / de bsgom pa rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba 'grub bo //
analyzed: rlung dang rnam par shes pa dag gi de kho na nyid ro mnyam pa nyid dang / de bsgom pa rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba 'grub bo //
translated: The sameness of the reality of wind and consciousness is accomplished by the natural arising of the meditation on that.

original: de ltar gyur pa na yang de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa na yang de nas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: When that has occurred, then, “from that,” etc.

original: sgrub pa po'i lus las phyi rol du gyur pa /
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i lus las phyi rol du gyur pa /
translated: Having become external to the body of the practitioner,

original: rnam par shes pa srid pa bar do la sogs par ram pha rol gyi lus la sprul par 'gyur ro //🔽gzhan gyi @282b sems ni rang gi lus kho na las mi la gzung ba'i rjes su ba'i sems /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa srid pa bar do la sogs par ram pha rol gyi lus la sprul par 'gyur ro // gzhan gyi @282b sems ni rang gi lus kho na las mi la gzung ba'i rjes su ba'i sems /
translated: the consciousness becomes emanated in the intermediate state of existence, etc., or in the body of another.

original: gzhan gyi snying gar bcug nas rjes su sems pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi snying gar bcug nas rjes su sems pa shes par bya'o //
translated: The mind of another is to be known by placing one’s own mind in the heart of another, not in one’s own body.

original: de ltar tshar gcad pa dang rjes su bzung bar nus pa 'di ni bdag nyid chen po'o zhes gzhan la rtogs su gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshar gcad pa dang rjes su bzung bar nus pa 'di ni bdag nyid chen po'o zhes gzhan la rtogs su gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should make others understand that this ability to subjugate and to favor is the greatness of the self.

original: de ltar ni bstan pa la sogs pa la gnod par byed pa yongs su spangs nas phan pa byed pa lhur len par pha rol por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni bstan pa la sogs pa la gnod par byed pa yongs su spangs nas phan pa byed pa lhur len par pha rol por 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, having abandoned the harm of the teaching, etc., one becomes devoted to the benefit of others.

original: 'di thams cad ni seng ge rnam rol du gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni seng ge rnam rol du gsungs te /
translated: All this is taught in the Lion's Play.

original: seng ge'i bzhin du mnan nas /
analyzed: seng ge'i bzhin du mnan nas /
translated: Having pressed down like the face of a lion,

original: 'gro ba gzhan du dang gzhan gyi grong du yang tshar gcod pa la sogs pa dang ji ltar mngon par 'dod par yul nye bar spyod pa rnams kyis dogs pa med par 'dir rol ba'o zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan du dang gzhan gyi grong du yang tshar gcod pa la sogs pa dang ji ltar mngon par 'dod par yul nye bar spyod pa rnams kyis dogs pa med par 'dir rol ba'o zhes byas nas so //
translated: one should play here without fear, with the enjoyments of objects as one wishes, with the subjugation of others, in other places and in other villages.

original: mig dang rna ba dang sna dang kha rnams sor mo rnams kyis 'gog pa ni seng ge rnam par rol pa'i phyag rgya ste des rlung steng dang 'og tu bsdams nas ji skad gsungs pa'i rnal 'byor goms par bya zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba dang sna dang kha rnams sor mo rnams kyis 'gog pa ni seng ge rnam par rol pa'i phyag rgya ste des rlung steng dang 'og tu bsdams nas ji skad gsungs pa'i rnal 'byor goms par bya zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that the blocking of the eyes, ears, nose, and mouth with the fingers is the seal of the Lion's Play. By that, having bound the winds above and below, one should practice the yoga as taught.

original: de lta kho nar bsgom pa la sogs pa rnams kyis sems par byed pa'i gser gyi lam mngon par 'dod pa rdzogs pa'i ched du 'grub po zhes pa nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de lta kho nar bsgom pa la sogs pa rnams kyis sems par byed pa'i gser gyi lam mngon par 'dod pa rdzogs pa'i ched du 'grub po zhes pa nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: Thus, for the sake of accomplishing the desired golden path of meditation, etc., the mind is intent. This is the summary.

original: de nas kyang 'pho ba'i rjes thogs su ye shes kyi gzugs kyi yid kyi rang bzhin gyis lus su gyur nas rang dang gzhan gyi mun pa 'joms pa'i phyir mar mes bzhin du de kho na nyid snang ba'i ngo bo'i sems kyi yul rnams kyis seng ge bzhin
analyzed: de nas kyang 'pho ba'i rjes thogs su ye shes kyi gzugs kyi yid kyi rang bzhin gyis lus su gyur nas rang dang gzhan gyi mun pa 'joms pa'i phyir mar mes bzhin du de kho na nyid snang ba'i ngo bo'i sems kyi yul rnams kyis seng ge bzhin
translated: Then, after transference, having become a mental body of the form of pristine consciousness, like a lamp for the purpose of dispelling one’s own and others’ darkness, the nature of the appearance of thatness, one should play without hesitation, like a lion, with the objects of the mind.

original: du dogs ba med par rnam par rol cing rang dang gzhan la phan pa'i las so //
analyzed: du dogs ba med par rnam par rol cing rang dang gzhan la phan pa'i las so //
translated: One should perform the benefit of oneself and others.

original: 'on 'di thams cad legs par bshad pa kho na ste /
analyzed: 'on 'di thams cad legs par bshad pa kho na ste /
translated: “ All of this is well explained.

original: 'di 'dra ba cha shas kyang blta ba gzhan la yod pa ma yin mod /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba cha shas kyang blta ba gzhan la yod pa ma yin mod /
translated: This is not seen in other systems.

original: 'on kyang de kho na nyid la goms pa dang ldan pa ni de kho na las mngon par 'dod pa thams cad 'grub pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de kho na nyid la goms pa dang ldan pa ni de kho na las mngon par 'dod pa thams cad 'grub pa'i phyir na /
translated: However, since all that is desired is accomplished from thatness alone by one who is familiar with thatness,

original: 'pho ba'i thabs bshad pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'pho ba'i thabs bshad pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: what is the use of explaining the method of transference?”

original: gsungs pa / nyan zhes pa la sogs pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams skye ba gcig la de kho na nyid la lhag par mos pa brtan pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / nyan zhes pa la sogs pa nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs can rnams skye ba gcig la de kho na nyid la lhag par mos pa brtan pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Those of the śrāvaka type and so on do not have firm conviction in thatness in a single lifetime.

original: gang shin tu yun ring bar bsod nams bsags pa /
analyzed: gang shin tu yun ring bar bsod nams bsags pa /
translated: Those who have accumulated merit for a very long time

original: rigs chen po sad pa ni the tshom dang bcas pa'i phyin ci log gi dri mas ma rnyogs pa nyid kyis shel bzhin du nye bar gzhag pa ji lta ba'i sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis kyang gsungs te /🔽spros pa gzhan la @283a * //
analyzed: rigs chen po sad pa ni the tshom dang bcas pa'i phyin ci log gi dri mas ma rnyogs pa nyid kyis shel bzhin du nye bar gzhag pa ji lta ba'i sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis kyang gsungs te / spros pa gzhan la @283a * //
translated: and have awakened to the great lineage, because they are not obscured by the stains of misconception with doubt, like a crystal, they take on the various aspects of whatever is placed in front of them.

original: phan pa'i ched du rtogs nas dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: phan pa'i ched du rtogs nas dor bar bya'o //
translated: For the sake of benefiting others, having realized it, one should abandon conceptual elaborations.

original: 'od kyi ngo bo'i sems kyis kyang stong pa nyid dang snying rje gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor kho na la dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od kyi ngo bo'i sems kyis kyang stong pa nyid dang snying rje gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor kho na la dmigs par bya'o //
translated: One should also focus on the yoga of the nondual union of emptiness and compassion with a mind that has the nature of light.

original: 'dir dang po rang gi snying gar zla ba la gnas pa'i h'um dmar po'i 'od zer gyis bkug pa'i ye shes mkha' 'gro ma yang dag par mchod nas /
analyzed: 'dir dang po rang gi snying gar zla ba la gnas pa'i h'um dmar po'i 'od zer gyis bkug pa'i ye shes mkha' 'gro ma yang dag par mchod nas /
translated: Here, first, having invited the awareness dakini with light rays from the red hūṃ on a moon in one’s heart, she is perfectly offered.

original: ji srid stong pa nyid kyi bar mchod du sna tshogs chu skyes dang zla ba la h'um dkar po las skyes pa'i bdag nyid ye shes mkha' 'gro ma sems dpa'i skyil krung can dkar mo bzhad cing dkar ba dang khros shing nag pa dang sgeg cing dmar ba'i
analyzed: ji srid stong pa nyid kyi bar mchod du sna tshogs chu skyes dang zla ba la h'um dkar po las skyes pa'i bdag nyid ye shes mkha' 'gro ma sems dpa'i skyil krung can dkar mo bzhad cing dkar ba dang khros shing nag pa dang sgeg cing dmar ba'i
translated: Then, as long as emptiness, the various offerings, the lotus and moon, and the white hūṃ are offered, one arises from that as the awareness dakini, white, with the nature of a sattva posture, smiling and white, wrathful and black, and passionate and red.

original: rtsa ba dang g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi zhal gsum pa ;
analyzed: rtsa ba dang g-yas pa dang cig shos kyi zhal gsum pa ;
translated: She has three faces—the principal face and the right and left faces.

original: spyan gsum ma /
analyzed: spyan gsum ma /
translated: She has three eyes.

original: phyag drug ma /
analyzed: phyag drug ma /
translated: She has six arms.

original: g-yas pa rnams kyis rdo rje gdengs pa dang mda' dang lcags kyu 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yas pa rnams kyis rdo rje gdengs pa dang mda' dang lcags kyu 'dzin pa /
translated: The right hands hold a flaying skin, an arrow, and a goad.

original: g-yon pa rnams kyis snying gar sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang dpag bsam gyi 'khri shing dang steng du go gon pa'i gzhu bsnams pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa rnams kyis snying gar sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa dang dpag bsam gyi 'khri shing dang steng du go gon pa'i gzhu bsnams pa /
translated: The left hands hold a heart with a noose and threatening gesture, a wish-fulfilling tree, and a bow drawn upward.

original: skra'i zhags pa chas legs pa /
analyzed: skra'i zhags pa chas legs pa /
translated: The hair is well-arranged.

original: sna tshogs pa'i rin chen po che dang gos kyi rgyan can /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i rin chen po che dang gos kyi rgyan can /
translated: It is adorned with various precious jewels and garments.

original: cod pan nas de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa 'phro ba rnams kyis nam mkha'i khong 'gengs par bltas te steng gi sgor kshum /
analyzed: cod pan nas de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa 'phro ba rnams kyis nam mkha'i khong 'gengs par bltas te steng gi sgor kshum /
translated: The crown protrudes, and one should view the space element filled with emanations of the Tathāgata, and so forth.

original: de'i 'og tu h'um /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu h'um /
translated: Below that, there is hūṃ.

original: smin mtshams kyi bu gar h'um /
analyzed: smin mtshams kyi bu gar h'um /
translated: At the opening of the brow, there is hūṃ.

original: de'i steng du ham /🔽lce'i rtsa bar sum /
analyzed: de'i steng du ham / lce'i rtsa bar sum /
translated: Above that, there is haṃ.🔽At the root of the tongue, there is suṃ.

original: mgrin pa'i bug par smr+yum /
analyzed: mgrin pa'i bug par smr+yum /
translated: At the opening of the throat, there is smṛṃ.

original: mig dag la h'um /🔽rna ba dag la yum ngo //
analyzed: mig dag la h'um / rna ba dag la yum ngo //
translated: At the eyes, there is hūṃ.🔽At the ears, there is yūṃ.

original: sna bug dag la yum /🔽lte ba'i sgor kshm+r+yum /
analyzed: sna bug dag la yum / lte ba'i sgor kshm+r+yum /
translated: At the nostrils, there is yūṃ.🔽At the navel, there is kṣaṃ.

original: btung bar kshm+r+yum /
analyzed: btung bar kshm+r+yum /
translated: At the anus, there is kṣaṃ.

original: thur sel du kshm+r+yum /
analyzed: thur sel du kshm+r+yum /
translated: At the urethra, there is kṣaṃ.

original: sgo dgu rnams su sa bon 'di rnams dkar po ste /
analyzed: sgo dgu rnams su sa bon 'di rnams dkar po ste /
translated: At the nine orifices, these seeds are white.

original: 'od zer 'thug po rnams kyis mtshams med par byas nas nang du mgo bos gnas pa rnams bsam mo //
analyzed: 'od zer 'thug po rnams kyis mtshams med par byas nas nang du mgo bos gnas pa rnams bsam mo //
translated: Having blocked the openings with thick light rays, one should imagine that they are located at the head inside.

original: go cha'i don du phrag pa dag la hm+r+yum snying gar ym+r+yum zhes pa ste sa bon gzhan gnyis de ltar kho na'o //
analyzed: go cha'i don du phrag pa dag la hm+r+yum snying gar ym+r+yum zhes pa ste sa bon gzhan gnyis de ltar kho na'o //
translated: For the armoring, HŪM is on the shoulders, and YŪM is at the heart. The other two seed syllables are just like that.

original: de'i rjes su snying gar kha thur du bltas pa'i chu skyes kyi dbus su thur du phyogs pa'i srog gi rlung gi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su snying gar kha thur du bltas pa'i chu skyes kyi dbus su thur du phyogs pa'i srog gi rlung gi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: After that, in the center of a lotus facing downward at the heart, is the mandala of the wind of life-force facing downward.

original: de'i dbus su rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo h'um /
analyzed: de'i dbus su rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo h'um /
translated: In the center of that is the nature of consciousness, HŪM.

original: steng gi mthar yum /
analyzed: steng gi mthar yum /
translated: At the top of that is YŪM.

original: yum gi dbus su ham ;🔽'og gi mthar yum /
analyzed: yum gi dbus su ham ; 'og gi mthar yum /
translated: In the center of YŪM is HAṂ.🔽At the bottom of that is YŪM.

original: yum gi steng du ka zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yum gi steng du ka zhes pa'o //
translated: Above YŪM is KA.

original: h'um yig la sogs pa rnams 'og tu mgo bstan pa'o //
analyzed: h'um yig la sogs pa rnams 'og tu mgo bstan pa'o //
translated: The HŪM syllable and so on are facing downward.

original: yum yig la sogs pa rnams sngon por bsgoms te /
analyzed: yum yig la sogs pa rnams sngon por bsgoms te /
translated: The YŪM syllable and so on are meditated on as blue.

original: khyad par du skyil krung bcas nas yan lag thams cad drang por byas shing mig sna rtser gtad la /
analyzed: khyad par du skyil krung bcas nas yan lag thams cad drang por byas shing mig sna rtser gtad la /
translated: In particular, after sitting cross-legged, straighten all the limbs and focus the eyes on the tip of the nose.

original: lus thams cad @283b la song pa'i khyab byed kyi rlung bkug ste lto ba'i nang dgang bar bya'o zhes pa dgang bas /
analyzed: lus thams cad @283b la song pa'i khyab byed kyi rlung bkug ste lto ba'i nang dgang bar bya'o zhes pa dgang bas /
translated: Draw up the pervading vāyu that pervades the entire body and fill the abdomen.

original: dug dang gdud pa dang rims la sogs pa zhi ba'i 'bras bu mthong bas ni rab tu zhugs pa /
analyzed: dug dang gdud pa dang rims la sogs pa zhi ba'i 'bras bu mthong bas ni rab tu zhugs pa /
translated: One who has seen the result of pacifying poison, sorcery, and contagious diseases, etc.

original: lte ba kho nas bum par chu mi 'bo bar gnas pa lta bu'i bum pa can bya'o //
analyzed: lte ba kho nas bum par chu mi 'bo bar gnas pa lta bu'i bum pa can bya'o //
translated: One should practice the vase-holding [breath] like a vase that does not leak water from the navel alone.

original: des ni sgo dgu rnams rengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni sgo dgu rnams rengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, the nine orifices are sealed.

original: de'i rjes su dal bus de yang gsang ba'i chu skyes kyi lte ba kho nar ril por byas pa 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dang bral bar bsam par bya'o zhes pa rab tu zhi ba'i mthar thug pas rlung dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su dal bus de yang gsang ba'i chu skyes kyi lte ba kho nar ril por byas pa 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dang bral bar bsam par bya'o zhes pa rab tu zhi ba'i mthar thug pas rlung dbang du byas te /
translated: After that, one should imagine that [the vāyu] is slowly drawn up into the navel of the secret lotus, becoming solid, free from exhalation and inhalation, and finally pacified.

original: des khyogs kyis rab tu sbar ba'i me cher gsal ba /
analyzed: des khyogs kyis rab tu sbar ba'i me cher gsal ba /
translated: The fire that is ignited by the palanquin is very clear.

original: ji skad gsungs pa'i ji ltar 'dod pa'i gtum mo yang dag par sbar bas /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa'i ji ltar 'dod pa'i gtum mo yang dag par sbar bas /
translated: The caṇḍālī that is ignited as one wishes, as it is explained,

original: bsnun bzhin pa'i snying ga'i padma gyen du phyogs par byas nas /
analyzed: bsnun bzhin pa'i snying ga'i padma gyen du phyogs par byas nas /
translated: penetrates the lotus of the heart that faces upward.

original: der son pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor yi ge dang bcas pa steng du phyogs pa /
analyzed: der son pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor yi ge dang bcas pa steng du phyogs pa /
translated: The wind maṇḍala that arrives there, together with the syllable, faces upward.

original: hi dang ka dag steng dang 'og tu gnas pa dang 'og dang steng du gnas par gyur pa dag ces bsgoms te ;
analyzed: hi dang ka dag steng dang 'og tu gnas pa dang 'og dang steng du gnas par gyur pa dag ces bsgoms te ;
translated: The h and kṣa are imagined to be located above and below, and below and above, respectively.

original: man ngag ji lta bar nang gi bzlas pa byed cing bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo ji srid bar drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: man ngag ji lta bar nang gi bzlas pa byed cing bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo ji srid bar drang bar bya'o //
translated: In accordance with the esoteric instructions, one should perform the inner repetition as long as the wheel of great bliss is drawn up.

original: de'i rjes su rlung de kho na 'og tu 'jug pa'i khyer byed kyis sngar bzhin du thams cad 'og tu phyogs shing ka dang hi dag kyang rang gi gnas su slar drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su rlung de kho na 'og tu 'jug pa'i khyer byed kyis sngar bzhin du thams cad 'og tu phyogs shing ka dang hi dag kyang rang gi gnas su slar drang bar bya'o //
translated: After that, by the force of that wind being drawn down, everything is directed downward, as before, and the kṣa and h are again drawn up to their own locations.

original: de ltar yud tsam so so la de lta kho nar 'dren pa dang slar 'dren pa dag gis rnam par shes pa'i bzhon pa srog gi rlung dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de ltar yud tsam so so la de lta kho nar 'dren pa dang slar 'dren pa dag gis rnam par shes pa'i bzhon pa srog gi rlung dbang du byas te /
translated: In this way, by drawing up and drawing down in this way for just a moment, the wind of life, which is the mount of consciousness, is brought under control.

original: dbyung ba de kho nas steng gi sgo phye nas 'pho bar rung ba nyid kyi ched du /
analyzed: dbyung ba de kho nas steng gi sgo phye nas 'pho bar rung ba nyid kyi ched du /
translated: By that very exhalation, the upper door is opened and is suitable for transference.

original: phyi rol du yang de lta kho nar de dag gis dbang du bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du yang de lta kho nar de dag gis dbang du bya'o //
translated: Also, externally, they should be brought under control in just that way.

original: de las de'i rnam par shes pa rang gi 'dod pas 'phos nas bar do'i srid par gnas pa lam 'gro ba gzhan yongs su 'dzin te /
analyzed: de las de'i rnam par shes pa rang gi 'dod pas 'phos nas bar do'i srid par gnas pa lam 'gro ba gzhan yongs su 'dzin te /
translated: From that, his consciousness, having been transferred by his desire, abides in the intermediate state existence, and he takes possession of another who is going on the path.

original: yang na gzhan gyi grong du 'jug go'am /
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyi grong du 'jug go'am /
translated: Or, he enters another’s town.

original: gzhan rnams tshar gcod pa dang rjes su 'dzin pa dag byed do //
analyzed: gzhan rnams tshar gcod pa dang rjes su 'dzin pa dag byed do //
translated: Or, he destroys others and protects others.

original: de la gtum mo'i sa bon gyis thig le las byung ba'i 'od zer dang bcas pa'i 'bar bas a'a li k'a li'i phreng ba dang lhan cig sna g-yas pa nas byung ste /
analyzed: de la gtum mo'i sa bon gyis thig le las byung ba'i 'od zer dang bcas pa'i 'bar bas a'a li k'a li'i phreng ba dang lhan cig sna g-yas pa nas byung ste /
translated: There, the seed of Caṇḍālī, together with the light rays arisen from the drop, blazes, and with the garland of Alikāli, it arises from the right nostril.

original: bsgrub bya'i sna bug g-yon nas zhugs nas snying ga'i chu skyes su song ba'i 'bar ba'i rin po che'i rnam pa can rnam par shes pa la khyab par byas te khyer nas /
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i sna bug g-yon nas zhugs nas snying ga'i chu skyes su song ba'i 'bar ba'i rin po che'i rnam pa can rnam par shes pa la khyab par byas te khyer nas /
translated: Having entered the left nostril of the victim, it goes to the heart lotus, and the blazing jewel-like consciousness pervades it, and having carried it,

original: sna g-yas pa nas byung zhing rang gi @284a * //
analyzed: sna g-yas pa nas byung zhing rang gi @284a * //
translated: it arises from the right nostril and enters one’s own left nostril.

original: g-yon pa nas zhugs te gsang ba'i mer bcug la bsreg cing tshar bcad do //
analyzed: g-yon pa nas zhugs te gsang ba'i mer bcug la bsreg cing tshar bcad do //
translated: Having entered the secret fire, it is burned and destroyed.

original: de'i rjes su de gnod pa byed pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa log pa me dang bral ba la /
analyzed: de'i rjes su de gnod pa byed pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa log pa me dang bral ba la /
translated: After that, the mind of harm, etc. is reversed, and the fire is removed.

original: man ngag ji lta bar gzhom du med pa'i bdud rtsi'i rgyun dkar po rnams kyis dbang bskur las ;
analyzed: man ngag ji lta bar gzhom du med pa'i bdud rtsi'i rgyun dkar po rnams kyis dbang bskur las ;
translated: The consecration with the stream of white nectar, as taught, is invincible.

original: nad la sogs pa rab tu zhi zhing /
analyzed: nad la sogs pa rab tu zhi zhing /
translated: From that, the disease, etc. is completely pacified.

original: ser po rnams kyis yon tan gyi tshogs rgyas la dmar po rnams kyis dbang du byas pa /
analyzed: ser po rnams kyis yon tan gyi tshogs rgyas la dmar po rnams kyis dbang du byas pa /
translated: From the yellow, the mass of qualities increases. From the red, one is brought under control.

original: de lta kho nar bton te /
analyzed: de lta kho nar bton te /
translated: In just that way, one should draw it out.

original: bcug nas snying ga'i chu skyes su gzhug pas rjes thogs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: bcug nas snying ga'i chu skyes su gzhug pas rjes thogs su 'dzin to //
translated: Having inserted it into the heart lotus, one should hold it in place.

original: de las phyung nas rang gi lus la rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: de las phyung nas rang gi lus la rab tu 'jug go //
translated: Having drawn it out from there, one should insert it into one’s own body.

original: 'chi ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i gtum mo'i rnal 'byor goms pa rab tu gyur pa kho na las nges par slu bar byed cing gnyer ma la sogs pa yang ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i gtum mo'i rnal 'byor goms pa rab tu gyur pa kho na las nges par slu bar byed cing gnyer ma la sogs pa yang ste /
translated: Death is certainly deceived by the practice of the caṇḍālī yoga, as explained, and also the wrinkles, etc.

original: de kho na las rlung dbang du gyur pa la sogs pa yon tan rin po che'i phung po bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na las rlung dbang du gyur pa la sogs pa yon tan rin po che'i phung po bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are produced from that alone, because the mass of precious qualities, such as the subjugation of the vital winds, are generated.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu ni sngar rnam par spros so zhes pa man ngag dang bcas pa'i bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu ni sngar rnam par spros so zhes pa man ngag dang bcas pa'i bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The summary meaning is: The aspect is just like this, and was previously elaborated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir spros pa thams cad ldog pas snying rje dang shes rab ro gcig pa nyid goms pa phul du byung ba kho na las tshogs gnyis las skyes pa mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa phun sum tshogs pa shin tu chen po nyid
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir spros pa thams cad ldog pas snying rje dang shes rab ro gcig pa nyid goms pa phul du byung ba kho na las tshogs gnyis las skyes pa mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa phun sum tshogs pa shin tu chen po nyid
translated: Therefore, by the cessation of all elaborations, the cultivation of the oneness of compassion and wisdom is the supreme cause of the great abundance of the two accumulations, which is the supreme excellence of both high status and certain goodness.

original: rnams gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes rtogs pa'i ched du skabs byed pa la zhus pa /
analyzed: rnams gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes rtogs pa'i ched du skabs byed pa la zhus pa /
translated: In order to make this clear, the author of the commentary asks, What is the special wisdom?

original: kye zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kye zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The answer is O! and so forth.

original: ye shes kyi khyad par ci lags pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi khyad par ci lags pa'o //
translated: What is the special wisdom?

original: gsang ba ni dman pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang ba ni dman pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is secret because it is not the domain of the inferior.

original: yul rnams me long la bzhin bzhin du dang bas phal cher mi dge ba mi spyod pa'i phyir dang / 'ga' zhig gi yid kyi rang bzhin gyis lus snang brnyan du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul rnams me long la bzhin bzhin du dang bas phal cher mi dge ba mi spyod pa'i phyir dang / 'ga' zhig gi yid kyi rang bzhin gyis lus snang brnyan du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The minds of humans are mostly not unwholesome, because they are ashamed of their actions, like seeing one's face in a mirror.

original: lha min rnams ni lha'i phun sum tshogs pa rnams la mi bzod pa 'bar ba'i sems so //
analyzed: lha min rnams ni lha'i phun sum tshogs pa rnams la mi bzod pa 'bar ba'i sems so //
translated: The minds of demigods are burning with jealousy toward the gods' excellence.

original: bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal kyis 'khrugs pa nyid kyi phyir yi dags rnams dman pa'i yid can rnams so //
analyzed: bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal kyis 'khrugs pa nyid kyi phyir yi dags rnams dman pa'i yid can rnams so //
translated: The minds of hungry ghosts are inferior, because they are disturbed by the suffering of hunger and so on.

original: dmyal ba ba rnams kyi ni gshin rje'i skyes bu rnams las mi mnyam pa'i sdug bsngal dang 'jigs pas yang dag par non pa'i sems rnams so //
analyzed: dmyal ba ba rnams kyi ni gshin rje'i skyes bu rnams las mi mnyam pa'i sdug bsngal dang 'jigs pas yang dag par non pa'i sems rnams so //
translated: The minds of hell beings are overwhelmed by the suffering and fear of Yama's messengers.

original: dud 'gro rnams kyi ni shin tu brtan pa'i rmongs pa dang ldan pa'i sems so //
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams kyi ni shin tu brtan pa'i rmongs pa dang ldan pa'i sems so //
translated: The minds of animals are very dull.

original: mi rnams kyi ye shes ni ji ltar rigs par dang ba nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par can no //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi ye shes ni ji ltar rigs par dang ba nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par can no //
translated: The minds of humans are clear and so on, as appropriate.

original: rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir phal che bas de rnams mdor bstan nas bstan pa 'jug pa las rnam @284b par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir phal che bas de rnams mdor bstan nas bstan pa 'jug pa las rnam @284b par shes par bya'o //
translated: Since they are by nature, they should be understood in detail from the teaching of the Avatara.

original: 'o na shing rnams sems pa can yin te /
analyzed: 'o na shing rnams sems pa can yin te /
translated: But if trees are sentient,

original: nyal ba'i phyir ro zhes phyogs kyi gos can 'dod pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyal ba'i phyir ro zhes phyogs kyi gos can 'dod pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par ci yin zhe na /
translated: because they sleep, what is the difference between the knowledge of the Jains and the knowledge of the Vaisesikas?

original: ci yang med de /
analyzed: ci yang med de /
translated: There is no difference.

original: shing rnams la sems med pa de kho na'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: shing rnams la sems med pa de kho na'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Because trees are without mind, it is said:

original: sems med ces pa sems pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sems med ces pa sems pa med pa'o //
translated: Without mind means without thought.

original: bstan pa ni 'dir rgyun du gnas pa'i chos dang ldan pa shing sdong la sogs pa ni dus thung dur gnas pa klog la sogs pa gang gi dang po yin pa de ni de skad do //
analyzed: bstan pa ni 'dir rgyun du gnas pa'i chos dang ldan pa shing sdong la sogs pa ni dus thung dur gnas pa klog la sogs pa gang gi dang po yin pa de ni de skad do //
translated: The teaching is this: Those that have the quality of remaining continuously, such as trees and so on, are those that remain for a short time, such as books and so on, and that which is the first of those is so called.

original: ri dang chu klung dang klog la sogs pa bzhin du ljon shing dang 'khri shing la sogs pa la yang sogs pa med pa'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ri dang chu klung dang klog la sogs pa bzhin du ljon shing dang 'khri shing la sogs pa la yang sogs pa med pa'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is the intention that just as mountains, rivers, and books and so on are not included in trees, vines and so on, so too are trees and vines not included in mountains and rivers.

original: sgrub byed nyal ba la sogs pa ni gzhan du shing rta chen po rnams kyis sun phyung zin to zhes pas gyi na'o //
analyzed: sgrub byed nyal ba la sogs pa ni gzhan du shing rta chen po rnams kyis sun phyung zin to zhes pas gyi na'o //
translated: As for the argument that the creator is asleep, etc., it has been refuted elsewhere by the great charioteers.

original: de'i phyir dkyus mnye bar sdud de /
analyzed: de'i phyir dkyus mnye bar sdud de /
translated: Therefore, the author collects the verses in a concise form.

original: lnga yis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lnga yis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five kinds of ignorance, etc.

original: me long ye shes nyid dang khro ba dang / dman pa nyid dang 'jigs pas du ba dang rmongs pa zhes pa rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: me long ye shes nyid dang khro ba dang / dman pa nyid dang 'jigs pas du ba dang rmongs pa zhes pa rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The five kinds are mirror-wisdom, anger, inferiority, fear, and delusion.

original: phal cher khyad par ni /
analyzed: phal cher khyad par ni /
translated: The difference is mostly

original: ji ltar rigs par khyad par gzhan rnams nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par khyad par gzhan rnams nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: as indicated by the other differences as appropriate.

original: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i shes pa can 'khor ba pa lha la sogs pa 'di rnams ni glen pa nyid mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di lta bu'i shes pa can 'khor ba pa lha la sogs pa 'di rnams ni glen pa nyid mi shes pa ste /
translated: These beings in cyclic existence, gods, etc., who have such kinds of consciousness, are fools, i.e., ignorant.

original: ma rig pa nyid kyis yang dag pa ma yin pa sgro btags pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pas ngan par sems pa'i phyir glen pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: ma rig pa nyid kyis yang dag pa ma yin pa sgro btags pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pas ngan par sems pa'i phyir glen pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: Because of ignorance, they are fools, i.e., their minds are evil, due to false imputations of attachment, etc.

original: de nyid kyis khyab pas lus kyis nyes par spyad pa spyod pa'i phyir khebs pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyis khyab pas lus kyis nyes par spyad pa spyod pa'i phyir khebs pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: and because they are covered by the obscurations, they are covered.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba'i don gyi de kho na nyid smra bar mi nus pa'i phyir lkugs pa rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba'i don gyi de kho na nyid smra bar mi nus pa'i phyir lkugs pa rnams kyang ngo //
translated: And because they are unable to speak about the reality of the meaning of suchness, they are dumb.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byis pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byis pa'o //
translated: And for that very reason, they are childish.

original: bsam pa ngan pa sems shing bya ba ngan pa byed pa smra ba ngan pa smra ba'i ngang tshul can ni byis pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bsam pa ngan pa sems shing bya ba ngan pa byed pa smra ba ngan pa smra ba'i ngang tshul can ni byis pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that they are childish because they have a bad disposition, thinking bad thoughts and doing bad deeds.

original: de rnams kyi byis pa'i shes pa ni 'di 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi byis pa'i shes pa ni 'di 'dra ba ste /
translated: Their childish consciousness is like this.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs ni khams gsum par so sor snang ba'i yod pa dang med pa dang gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa'i phyogs so sor spong ba las /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs ni khams gsum par so sor snang ba'i yod pa dang med pa dang gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa'i phyogs so sor spong ba las /
translated: The antidote to that is the specific reality of non-nature, which is the abandonment of the individual positions of existence, non-existence, both, and neither, which appear individually in the three realms.

original: de kho na nyid kyi bye brag rang bzhin med pa ni /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi bye brag rang bzhin med pa ni /
translated: The specific reality of non-nature is as follows:

original: shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa'i dgra 'chos pa dang ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa las skyob pas na bstan bcos las te /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa'i dgra 'chos pa dang ngan 'gro'i 'jigs pa las skyob pas na bstan bcos las te /
translated: Because it illuminates the inseparability of wisdom and method, and because it protects from the enemies of the afflictions and from the fears of the lower realms, it is from the treatise.

original: rgyud rnam pa gsum bsdus pa rdzogs pa snying po'i don rab tu gsal bar byed pas na /
analyzed: rgyud rnam pa gsum bsdus pa rdzogs pa snying po'i don rab tu gsal bar byed pas na /
translated: Because it illuminates the meaning of the essence of the perfection of the three aspects of the tantra,🔽it is superior to other tantras.

original: rgyud gzhan rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa zhes pas khyad par las te dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud 'di @285a * //🔽las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa zhes pas khyad par las te dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud 'di @285a * // las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood from this very glorious Heruka Tantra.

original: 'di las kyang rgyud 'di'i bdag nyid chen po nyid gsal bar byed cing gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di las kyang rgyud 'di'i bdag nyid chen po nyid gsal bar byed cing gsungs pa /
translated: Also, from this, it illuminates and teaches the greatness of this tantra.

original: skye ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The line beginning born and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das mar me mdzad tshun chad du sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir bskal pa shin tu mang po rnams la rgyud ma lus pa'i snying po rgyud sde rin po che 'di dag kho nas bshad kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mar me mdzad tshun chad du sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir bskal pa shin tu mang po rnams la rgyud ma lus pa'i snying po rgyud sde rin po che 'di dag kho nas bshad kyi /
translated: From the time of Dipankara up to this buddha field, for many eons, the essence of all the tantras was explained by only these precious tantras.

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gzhan rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gzhan rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Not so the other perfect Buddhas.

original: de'i phyir bdag gis 'dir bshad pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis bskul ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gis 'dir bshad pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis bskul ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the nondual knowledge explained here is the one that impels me.

original: kye thar pa 'dod pa rnal 'byor gyi bstan bcos 'di kho na la mkhas pa shes pa dang ldan pa shin tu bar 'gyur ro //🔽'byung ba mo'i bdag po la sogs pa bshad pa bla na med pa'i de kho na nyid las phyir phyogs pa'i bstan bcos rgyud la sogs pa'i sgra bkod pa rnams la ni yin no //
analyzed: kye thar pa 'dod pa rnal 'byor gyi bstan bcos 'di kho na la mkhas pa shes pa dang ldan pa shin tu bar 'gyur ro // 'byung ba mo'i bdag po la sogs pa bshad pa bla na med pa'i de kho na nyid las phyir phyogs pa'i bstan bcos rgyud la sogs pa'i sgra bkod pa rnams la ni yin no //
translated: O you who desire liberation, you should become very learned in this treatise of yoga alone, endowed with knowledge.🔽But it is not so for the treatises such as the Tantra that are set forth by the lords of the elements and so on, who are averse to the unexcelled reality.

original: de rnams ni gar gyi gnas kyi sa gzhi la mngon par gsar du tshig bkod pa rnams kyis 'thad pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyis na de la mos pa rnams rangs pa tsam gyis yid chags par byed pa'i phyir mtshungs shing drang ba rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams ni gar gyi gnas kyi sa gzhi la mngon par gsar du tshig bkod pa rnams kyis 'thad pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyis na de la mos pa rnams rangs pa tsam gyis yid chags par byed pa'i phyir mtshungs shing drang ba rnams so //
translated: Those treatises are just like the words newly arranged on the stage of the dance, which are devoid of logic and which captivate the minds of the devotees merely by their novelty.

original: des na 'di kho na las chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pas yang dag pa'i yul bstan pa'i ched du dang grol ba'i ched du rnal 'byor la 'bad pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'di kho na las chos thams cad kyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pas yang dag pa'i yul bstan pa'i ched du dang grol ba'i ched du rnal 'byor la 'bad pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since the nature of all phenomena is known just from this, in order to teach the object of reality and in order to be liberated, one should accomplish the practice of yoga.

original: don 'di kho na snying po las te shin tu mchog bskyed pa'i rim pa las snying po drang bar bya ba mchog phul du byung ba'i rnal 'byor bshad do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: don 'di kho na snying po las te shin tu mchog bskyed pa'i rim pa las snying po drang bar bya ba mchog phul du byung ba'i rnal 'byor bshad do zhes pa'o //
translated: Just this meaning is explained in the Essence of the Essence, the essence of the creation stage, the supreme, excellent yoga, which is to be extracted.

original: dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The glorious Heruka Galpo Tantra

original: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma sum cu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma sum cu gcig pa'o /
translated: The thirty-first flower from the Bouquet of Instructions

original: // / bskyed pa'i rim pa ni sngags dang sngags kyi sku can gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir dang / zhi ba la sogs pa bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag rnams kyang sngags kyi bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi phyir sngags rgyas par ston pa gsungs pa nyon zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: // / bskyed pa'i rim pa ni sngags dang sngags kyi sku can gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir dang / zhi ba la sogs pa bskyed pa'i rim pa'i yan lag rnams kyang sngags kyi bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi phyir sngags rgyas par ston pa gsungs pa nyon zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The creation stage is the nature of mantra and the mantra body, and the branches of the creation stage such as pacification are also to be accomplished by mantra. Therefore, listen to the teaching of the extensive mantra.

original: rdo rje la mchog tu gyur ba'i 'od byed 'di'i yin pa zhe'am rdo rje dang 'dra ba'i 'od 'di'i yin pa zhes pa rdo rje 'od de /
analyzed: rdo rje la mchog tu gyur ba'i 'od byed 'di'i yin pa zhe'am rdo rje dang 'dra ba'i 'od 'di'i yin pa zhes pa rdo rje 'od de /
translated: This is the light of the vajra, which is supreme, or this is the light like the vajra, which is the vajra light.

original: rdo rje snying po'o //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po'o //
translated: The vajra essence.

original: sngags rnams kyis gdul bya'i yid mgu bar byed pa'i phyir rgyal po khyed nyon cig pa'o //
analyzed: sngags rnams kyis gdul bya'i yid mgu bar byed pa'i phyir rgyal po khyed nyon cig pa'o //
translated: The mantras delight the minds of the disciples, therefore, O King, listen!

original: sngags rnams ni rang gi ngo bo rtogs par byed pa'i tshig rnams so //
analyzed: sngags rnams ni rang gi ngo bo rtogs par byed pa'i tshig rnams so //
translated: The mantras are the words that cause the realization of their own nature.

original: de cis rang gi brjod bya rtogs par byed pa sngags yin @285b zhe na ;
analyzed: de cis rang gi brjod bya rtogs par byed pa sngags yin @285b zhe na ;
translated: If it is asked, By what are the mantras that cause the realization of their own objects?

original: bden no // de skad du yang gsungs pa /🔽ngag kun sngags su brjod par bya //
analyzed: bden no // de skad du yang gsungs pa / ngag kun sngags su brjod par bya //
translated: It is said, Yes, it is so.🔽It is also said, All speech is said to be mantra.

original: zhes so // sngags kyi tha snyad du bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes so // sngags kyi tha snyad du bya ba ni /
translated: The term mantra is used

original: gsang ba'i de kho na nyid 'chad pa mdor bsdus pa /🔽sbas pa'i don can la /
analyzed: gsang ba'i de kho na nyid 'chad pa mdor bsdus pa / sbas pa'i don can la /
translated: in the concise explanation of the secret tattva.🔽It is a term coined by the great charioteers, who blessed it with the thought,

original: shing rta chen po rnams kho nas tshogs grub par gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs nas brdar byas pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: shing rta chen po rnams kho nas tshogs grub par gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs nas brdar byas pa'i tshig go //
translated: May the assembly be accomplished!

original: gang dang gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang dang gang gsungs pa /
translated: Whatever is said,

original: sngags dang sngags zhes rab bshad pa //
analyzed: sngags dang sngags zhes rab bshad pa //
translated: The mantra is explained as mantra

original: de kho na nyid bskul ba'i skad //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bskul ba'i skad //
translated: because it is the language of the invocation of reality.

original: ces so // bskul ba rtogs par byed par bshad //
analyzed: ces so // bskul ba rtogs par byed par bshad //
translated: It is explained as invocation because it is the cause of the invocation of the mind of the Bhagavat.

original: ji ltar lus la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo aom yig la sogs pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar lus la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo aom yig la sogs pa rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as the nature of the body, etc. is to be understood by the syllable om, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i ched du thugs bskul ba'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i ched du thugs bskul ba'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: For the purpose of invoking the mind of the Bhagavat for the sake of his blessing, it is said:

original: aom zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: aom zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: om, etc.

original: dang por thams cad aom yig ni zhi ba gsal bar byed pa la ste /
analyzed: dang por thams cad aom yig ni zhi ba gsal bar byed pa la ste /
translated: First, om is for all things, for the sake of the illumination of peace.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi snying po zhi ba chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gsal bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi snying po zhi ba chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gsal bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the essence of Vairocana, the illumination of the samadhi of great peace.

original: khros pa'i las la yang rang dang gzhan gyi zhi ba la mkhas pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khros pa'i las la yang rang dang gzhan gyi zhi ba la mkhas pa'i rnal 'byor ba'i rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even in the case of wrathful action, it is for the sake of the yoga of the expert in the peace of self and other.

original: badzra ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: badzra ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: Vajra is the wisdom of the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion.

original: de'i rang bzhin can ni mu mtha' med par 'chi ba dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir aa mri ta ste khu ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin can ni mu mtha' med par 'chi ba dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir aa mri ta ste khu ba'o //
translated: The nature of that is immortality, because it is free from death.

original: bdud rtsi khu ba zhes bshad de //

analyzed: nam gyi gung thun la glang po che'i rgyal po'i gzugs su nges par bstan pas lha mo sgyu 'phrul chen mo'i lhums su zhugs so zhes pa 'bab pa'o //
translated: he entered the womb of Mahāmāyādevī in the form of an elephant king at midnight.

original: de nas zla ba bcu rnams 'das pa dang / lha mo las lu mbi n'i'i tshal du mtshan mo'i gung thun la bltams te /
analyzed: de nas zla ba bcu rnams 'das pa dang / lha mo las lu mbi n'i'i tshal du mtshan mo'i gung thun la bltams te /
translated: Then, after ten months had passed, at midnight in the Lumbini Grove, he was born from the right side of his mother.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa'i 'od dang snang ba chen pos gsal par byas shing /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa'i 'od dang snang ba chen pos gsal par byas shing /
translated: The world systems were illuminated by the great light and radiance of the Bodhisattva.

original: sa gzhi yang rnam par 'gyur ba drug tu g-yos //
analyzed: sa gzhi yang rnam par 'gyur ba drug tu g-yos //
translated: The earth shook in six ways.

original: lha rnams kyis kyang bar snang las rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gos dang gdugs dang rnga yab dang me tog dang tsandan la sogs pa rnams kyis gtor ro //
analyzed: lha rnams kyis kyang bar snang las rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gos dang gdugs dang rnga yab dang me tog dang tsandan la sogs pa rnams kyis gtor ro //
translated: The gods scattered various garments, parasols, yak-tail fans, flowers, sandalwood, and so forth from the sky.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang mngal gyi dri mas ma gos pa nor bu bzhin @289a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang mngal gyi dri mas ma gos pa nor bu bzhin @289a * //
translated: The Bodhisattva was born in a pure body, like a jewel,

original: du dang ba'i sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan par 'khrungs so zhes pa skye ba rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: du dang ba'i sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan par 'khrungs so zhes pa skye ba rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being and the eighty minor marks of excellence. This is the purity of birth.

original: de nas gzhon nu'o rol rtsed nye bar bstan nas grags 'dzin ma dangs skyong ma la sogs pa bud med stong phrag drug cu'i btsun mo'i 'khor du zhugs nas /
analyzed: de nas gzhon nu'o rol rtsed nye bar bstan nas grags 'dzin ma dangs skyong ma la sogs pa bud med stong phrag drug cu'i btsun mo'i 'khor du zhugs nas /
translated: Then, having shown the games of youth, he entered the harem of sixty thousand women, including Gopā, Yaśodharā, and so forth.

original: 'di skyes bu min pas rab tu byung ngo zhes smod pa yongs su spang ba'i ched du lha mo grags 'dzin ma dang lhan cig yongs su rgyu ba mdzad do //
analyzed: 'di skyes bu min pas rab tu byung ngo zhes smod pa yongs su spang ba'i ched du lha mo grags 'dzin ma dang lhan cig yongs su rgyu ba mdzad do //
translated: In order to completely abandon the criticism, “He is not a man, but a renunciate,” he went for a walk with the goddess Yaśodharā.

original: de nas brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa lha rnams kyis spro bar byas pa /
analyzed: de nas brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa lha rnams kyis spro bar byas pa /
translated: Then Indra, Brahmā, and so on, the gods, encouraged him.

original: 'dun pa dang lhan cig rta'i rgyal po bsngags ldan la chibs te /
analyzed: 'dun pa dang lhan cig rta'i rgyal po bsngags ldan la chibs te /
translated: Together with Chunda, he mounted the king of horses, Kaṇṭhaka.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyis rjes su 'brang bzhin pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gos dang me tog la sogs pa bus mo nub tsam la gshegs shing /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyis rjes su 'brang bzhin pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gos dang me tog la sogs pa bus mo nub tsam la gshegs shing /
translated: The gods of the desire realm and the form realm followed him, and he went to a distance of about a league, with the gods blowing conch shells and cymbals, and with various garments, flowers, and so on.

original: dpag tshad bcu gnyis rnams su gshegs so zhes pa khab nas 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: dpag tshad bcu gnyis rnams su gshegs so zhes pa khab nas 'byung ba ste /
translated: He went twelve leagues, it is said.

original: gsal ba ni rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba ni rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: “Clearly” means “well known.”

original: de nas 'dun pa dang bsngags ldan dag bskur nas dbu skra rnams gris bregs te brgya byin la gnang zhing na bza' ngur smrig rnams bsnams te dge slong du gyur pas /
analyzed: de nas 'dun pa dang bsngags ldan dag bskur nas dbu skra rnams gris bregs te brgya byin la gnang zhing na bza' ngur smrig rnams bsnams te dge slong du gyur pas /
translated: Then, having sent away Channa and Kanthaka, he cut off his hair with a sword and gave it to Indra. He took up the saffron robes and became a monk.

original: chu bo nee ra nydza na'i 'gram du dbugs pa dbyung ba dang dbugs rngub pa bkag pa las mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis til gcig re tsam gsol ba'i dka' thub lo drug spyad de /
analyzed: chu bo nee ra nydza na'i 'gram du dbugs pa dbyung ba dang dbugs rngub pa bkag pa las mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis til gcig re tsam gsol ba'i dka' thub lo drug spyad de /
translated: On the banks of the Nairañjanā River, he practiced austerities for six years, subsisting on a single sesame seed or a single myrobalan fruit, and so forth, by means of the concentration of immobility, in which he stopped the exhalation and inhalation of breath.

original: 'di ni byang chub kyi ched du ba'i lam ma yin no zhes ji ltar bde par dbugs phyung nas sbrang dang 'o thug yongs su gsol te /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub kyi ched du ba'i lam ma yin no zhes ji ltar bde par dbugs phyung nas sbrang dang 'o thug yongs su gsol te /
translated: He thought, “This is not the path to enlightenment,” and he took some milk and honey.

original: bzhugs pa tsam gyis brag ri chen po zhig pa'i rjes thogs su lha rnams kyis nye bar bstan pa'i lam nas /
analyzed: bzhugs pa tsam gyis brag ri chen po zhig pa'i rjes thogs su lha rnams kyis nye bar bstan pa'i lam nas /
translated: He sat down, and immediately after a great rock mountain collapsed, he saw the path that the gods had pointed out.

original: klu'i rgyal po nag pos bstod bzhin byang chub kyi ched du gzigs mo chen pos gshegs te /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po nag pos bstod bzhin byang chub kyi ched du gzigs mo chen pos gshegs te /
translated: The nāga king Kālika praised him and he went to see the Bodhi tree for the sake of enlightenment.

original: rdo rje gdan gyi sa gzhi la 'dzegs nas byang chub shing gi rtsa bar /
analyzed: rdo rje gdan gyi sa gzhi la 'dzegs nas byang chub shing gi rtsa bar /
translated: He climbed to the site of the Vajra Seat and sat at the foot of the Bodhi tree.

original: ku sha gser gyi kha dog can ras bal ltar reg bya 'jam pa rnams la bzhugs shing /
analyzed: ku sha gser gyi kha dog can ras bal ltar reg bya 'jam pa rnams la bzhugs shing /
translated: He ascended the ground of Bodhgaya and sat on a seat of kuśa grass with the color of gold and soft to the touch like cotton at the foot of the Bodhi tree.

original: 'byung po bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug gi 'khor can 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug gi bdud byams pa'i mtshon gyis btul te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: 'byung po bye ba phrag sum cu rtsa drug gi 'khor can 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang phyug gi bdud byams pa'i mtshon gyis btul te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: He subdued the demon lord of the desire realm with the weapon of love, surrounded by a retinue of 3.6 million spirits, and fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: tshangs pas gsol ba btab @289b pa w'a r'a na s'i ru gshegs te /
analyzed: tshangs pas gsol ba btab @289b pa w'a r'a na s'i ru gshegs te /
translated: At the request of Brahma, he went to Varanasi

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis lan gsum gsum du bzlas pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ro //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis lan gsum gsum du bzlas pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ro //
translated: and turned the wheel of dharma, which has three turnings and twelve aspects.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i gnas su gshegs nas chos bstan te brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i lha rnams rjes su 'brang bzhin pa grong khyer gsal ldan du babs nas /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i gnas su gshegs nas chos bstan te brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa'i lha rnams rjes su 'brang bzhin pa grong khyer gsal ldan du babs nas /
translated: Then, having gone to the abode of the Thirty-three Gods and taught the Dharma, he descended to the city of Kapilavastu, followed by Indra, Brahma, and so forth, the gods who enjoy the desire realm and the form realm.

original: mnyan yod du cho 'phrul chen po rab tu bstan te /
analyzed: mnyan yod du cho 'phrul chen po rab tu bstan te /
translated: In Shravasti, he displayed great miracles.

original: gzhan mu stegs byed rnams tshad mas tshar bcad cing /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs byed rnams tshad mas tshar bcad cing /
translated: He defeated the other tirthikas with valid cognition.

original: ser skya'i gzhi'i nags su seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang dbyig gi snying po dang / gzhon nu dang 'gegs kyi bdag po dang dbang po dang zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan dang gza' dang rgyu skar dang dpal mo dang rnam thos sras dang yul 'khor srung dang 'phags skyes po dang mig mi bzang dang sa dang me dag gshin rje dang
analyzed: ser skya'i gzhi'i nags su seng ge dang 'phrog byed dang dbyig gi snying po dang / gzhon nu dang 'gegs kyi bdag po dang dbang po dang zla ba dang nyi ma dang sgra gcan dang gza' dang rgyu skar dang dpal mo dang rnam thos sras dang yul 'khor srung dang 'phags skyes po dang mig mi bzang dang sa dang me dag gshin rje dang
translated: In the forest of Kapilavastu, he subdued the lion, Rahula, Vasu-garbha, Kumara, the lord of obstacles, Indra, the moon, the sun, Rahu, the planets, the stars, Shri, Vaishravana, Dhritarashtra, Virudhaka, Virupaksha, the earth, fire, and Yama.

original: chu lha la sogs pa'i lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang srin po dang dri za dang lha ma yin dang nam mkha' lding dang mi 'am ci brgya stong phrag du ma rnams mya ngan las 'das pa dang / so sor ldan pa'i chos bstan pas btul lo //
analyzed: chu lha la sogs pa'i lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang srin po dang dri za dang lha ma yin dang nam mkha' lding dang mi 'am ci brgya stong phrag du ma rnams mya ngan las 'das pa dang / so sor ldan pa'i chos bstan pas btul lo //
translated: He subdued the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, rākṣasas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, and kinnaras, such as Varuṇa, through the Dharma teachings of nirvāṇa and individual liberation.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'i gdul bya'i gnas rnams su nye bar byon nas /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'i gdul bya'i gnas rnams su nye bar byon nas /
translated: Having approached such places of disciples,

original: thabs rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyis skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can gyi phung po dpag tu med pa rnams theg pa gsum rnams la btul nas /
analyzed: thabs rnam pa sna tshogs pa rnams kyis skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can gyi phung po dpag tu med pa rnams theg pa gsum rnams la btul nas /
translated: he subdued immeasurable multitudes of sentient beings according to their fortune with various methods in the three vehicles.

original: bde 'gro'i 'bras bu dang thar pa'i byang chub tu yang rab tu bkod do //
