analyzed: bde 'gro'i 'bras bu dang thar pa'i byang chub tu yang rab tu bkod do //
translated: He also established them in the results of happy rebirths and in the enlightenment of liberation.

original: theg pa chen po la rung ba shes rab rno ba rnams kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po la rung ba shes rab rno ba rnams kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: For those who are suitable for the Mahāyāna, who have sharp wisdom,

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis dngos grub thams cad kyi dbang phyug nyid nye bar ston cing /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis dngos grub thams cad kyi dbang phyug nyid nye bar ston cing /
translated: he demonstrates the state of being the lord of all powers through forms such as Vajradhara.

original: rdo rje theg pa bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje theg pa bstan to //
translated: He taught the Vajrayāna.

original: de la yang mi 'jug pa dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa 'jig rten gsum gyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa la sogs pas gdul bya'i ched du 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i sku ru gsal bar gyur to //
analyzed: de la yang mi 'jug pa dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa 'jig rten gsum gyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor du gzhug pa la sogs pas gdul bya'i ched du 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i sku ru gsal bar gyur to //
translated: For those who did not enter that, he manifested the form of Trailokyavijaya, in order to tame the disciples such as Maheśvara, by causing them to enter the maṇḍala of the three worlds, and so forth.

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa'i brtag pa rnams su yang dngos grub chen po'i lhag pa'i bdag po nyid bla na med pa nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba la sogs pa'i brtag pa rnams su yang dngos grub chen po'i lhag pa'i bdag po nyid bla na med pa nye bar bstan to //
translated: In the treatises on taming beings and so forth, he also taught the unsurpassed nature of being the lord of the supreme siddhis.

original: sh'akya thub pa'i skus ni w'a r'a na s'i ru 'phags pa byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan nas da lta de rgyal tshab nyid du bsgrags so //🔽rgyal po'i @290a * //
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa'i skus ni w'a r'a na s'i ru 'phags pa byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan nas da lta de rgyal tshab nyid du bsgrags so // rgyal po'i @290a * //
translated: With the form of Śākyamuni, he prophesied the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of the noble Maitreya in Vārāṇasī, and now he is proclaimed as the regent.

original: khab tu bya rgod phung po la 'dzegs te /
analyzed: khab tu bya rgod phung po la 'dzegs te /
translated: In Rājagṛha, he ascended Vulture Peak,

original: kun dga' bo ma ga dha'i sa gzhi ni dga' bar 'os pa'i zhes gsungs nas /
analyzed: kun dga' bo ma ga dha'i sa gzhi ni dga' bar 'os pa'i zhes gsungs nas /
translated: and after saying, “Ānanda, the ground of Magadha is worthy of joy,”🔽he taught the perfection of wisdom.

original: yangs pa can du yang kun dga' po de bzhin gshegs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams bsten pa ste /
analyzed: yangs pa can du yang kun dga' po de bzhin gshegs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnams bsten pa ste /
translated: In Vaishali, Ananda, the Tathagata said three times, “I rely on the four bases of miraculous powers.

original: bzhed na bskal pa 'am bskal pa'i lhag mar gnas so zhes lan gsum bka' stsal te /
analyzed: bzhed na bskal pa 'am bskal pa'i lhag mar gnas so zhes lan gsum bka' stsal te /
translated: If I wish, I can remain for an eon or the remainder of an eon.”

original: gang kun dga' bo cad mi smra bar dgongs nas /
analyzed: gang kun dga' bo cad mi smra bar dgongs nas /
translated: When Ananda remained silent,

original: mdo sde la rton pas thams cad 'byung bar bya'i gang zag la rton pas ni ma yin no zhes bslabs te /
analyzed: mdo sde la rton pas thams cad 'byung bar bya'i gang zag la rton pas ni ma yin no zhes bslabs te /
translated: he taught, “Since you rely on the sutras, everything will appear, but not if you rely on the person.”

original: grong khyer ku sha can du rgyal po chen po bzhi rnams dang brgya byin la bstan pa gtad nas /
analyzed: grong khyer ku sha can du rgyal po chen po bzhi rnams dang brgya byin la bstan pa gtad nas /
translated: In the city of Kusinagara, he entrusted the teachings to the four great kings and Indra.

original: sems can rnams kyi don gyi ched du rdo rje lha bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sku gdung rnams til tsam du bzhag te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don gyi ched du rdo rje lha bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sku gdung rnams til tsam du bzhag te /
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, he placed his relics the size of sesame seeds in the vajra-son-like samadhi.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs pas mi g-yo ba'i zhi ba lcogs nas 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs pas mi g-yo ba'i zhi ba lcogs nas 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: Since he entered the fourth dhyana samadhi, he attained unshakable peace and passed into parinirvana in this world system.

original: 'tsham pa med pa'i khams gsum pa gzhan rnams su slar yang dpag tu med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa sna tshogs pa'i sprul pa'i tshogs rab 'byam rnams kyis rgyun mi chad par skye ba la sogs pa ston cing /
analyzed: 'tsham pa med pa'i khams gsum pa gzhan rnams su slar yang dpag tu med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa sna tshogs pa'i sprul pa'i tshogs rab 'byam rnams kyis rgyun mi chad par skye ba la sogs pa ston cing /
translated: In other realms of the three realms that are not suitable, he continuously displays birth and so forth through various emanations that are infinite and inconceivable.

original: lus 'dzin rnams la phan pa'i bya ba rnams kyis chos kyi rgyal srid mu mtha' med pas mchog tu rol cing da dung yang yod la /🔽bskal pa dpag tu med pa rab 'byam du chos kyi skur slar yang 'di dang gzhan du yang gnas par 'gyur ro zhes pa thams cad la dgongs nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: lus 'dzin rnams la phan pa'i bya ba rnams kyis chos kyi rgyal srid mu mtha' med pas mchog tu rol cing da dung yang yod la / bskal pa dpag tu med pa rab 'byam du chos kyi skur slar yang 'di dang gzhan du yang gnas par 'gyur ro zhes pa thams cad la dgongs nas gsungs pa /
translated: He is the supreme enjoyer of the endless kingdom of Dharma through the activities that benefit those who hold bodies.🔽He will also remain in the dharmakāya for infinite, vast eons in this and other realms.

original: 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: With the intention to teach all of this, he said, “It is like this…” and so on.

original: 'di lta sogs kyis te rnam 'phrul gyi las rnams kyis rab tu 'jug ces snga ma dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: 'di lta sogs kyis te rnam 'phrul gyi las rnams kyis rab tu 'jug ces snga ma dang 'brel lo //
translated: “Like this” and so on refer to the activities of his emanations, which are “engaged” as explained above.

original: mchog ni dad po'o //
analyzed: mchog ni dad po'o //
translated: “Supreme” refers to the Buddha.

original: 'o na rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi rjes thogs su las rnams yod pa'i phyir dang po yod do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi rjes thogs su las rnams yod pa'i phyir dang po yod do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that since karma exists immediately after the causal state, the first moment exists, that is not so.

original: dpag tu med cing thog ma med pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi las rnams kyang thog ma med pas so //
analyzed: dpag tu med cing thog ma med pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi las rnams kyang thog ma med pas so //
translated: Because the karma of the buddhas, who are immeasurable and beginningless, is also beginningless.

original: chos kyi sku la ltos pas ni shin tu yang ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku la ltos pas ni shin tu yang ste /
translated: And it is very much so in dependence on the dharmakāya.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: kun zhes pa ste sangs rgyas kun rnams kyi bdag nyid la ste chos nyid la gang rnams sdom pa ste /
analyzed: kun zhes pa ste sangs rgyas kun rnams kyi bdag nyid la ste chos nyid la gang rnams sdom pa ste /
translated: “All” means in the nature of all buddhas, in reality, those who are included

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyis nang du 'dus pa de rnams ni de skad do //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid kyis nang du 'dus pa de rnams ni de skad do //
translated: in the nature of that are so called.

original: de rnams kyi spro ba dang sdud pa dag kyang de kho @290b na'i'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi spro ba dang sdud pa dag kyang de kho @290b na'i'o //
translated: Their emanations and retractions are just that.

original: gang mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyud du gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyud du gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Tantra of Realization:

original: chos kyi sku yi phrin las 'di //
analyzed: chos kyi sku yi phrin las 'di //
translated: This activity of the dharmakāya

original: rnam pa nyi shu bdun du bzhed //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu bdun du bzhed //
translated: Is asserted to be twenty-sevenfold.

original: ces so // de yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ro mnyam par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ces so // de yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ro mnyam par gyur pa'o //
translated: And that is equal in taste to the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de yang dngos po dang dngos med du sgro btags pa dag dang bral pa kho na dang sprul pa nus pa ste /
analyzed: de yang dngos po dang dngos med du sgro btags pa dag dang bral pa kho na dang sprul pa nus pa ste /
translated: It is free from the superimposition of things and nonthings and is the power of manifestation.🔽

original: rmongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rmongs pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is only free from the superimpositions of entity and non-entity, and is the power of emanation, not delusion.

original: de dag kho na ni rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kho na ni rmongs pa ste /
translated: Those are delusion.

original: de phyir de yongs su ste bag chags dang bcas pa dor bya ste /
analyzed: de phyir de yongs su ste bag chags dang bcas pa dor bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is to be completely, that is, together with the imprints, abandoned,

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang dkyil 'khor bsgom pas so //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa dang dkyil 'khor bsgom pas so //
translated: by the perfection stage and the meditation of the mandala.

original: de yang sngar rgyas pa dang bcas par gsungs zin cing /
analyzed: de yang sngar rgyas pa dang bcas par gsungs zin cing /
translated: Moreover, that has already been stated in detail.

original: sdud pa gsungs pa'i ched du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sdud pa gsungs pa'i ched du bka' stsal pa /
translated: In order to summarize that, it is stated:

original: bung ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bung ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The bee, etc.

original: mi mnyam pa'i bde ba len cing kun nas 'dzin no zhes pas a'a li ste khu ba'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i bde ba len cing kun nas 'dzin no zhes pas a'a li ste khu ba'o //
translated: It takes and completely holds the unequalled bliss, thus it is āli, which is semen.

original: 'khrul pa 'bral par byed do zhes pa bum pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa 'bral par byed do zhes pa bum pa'o //
translated: It causes the separation from delusion, thus it is the vase.

original: ci ltar 'khrul pa 'dor bar byed ce na gang gi phyir de rdo rje 'jigs byed bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: ci ltar 'khrul pa 'dor bar byed ce na gang gi phyir de rdo rje 'jigs byed bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: How does it abandon delusion? Because it is the Bhagavān Vajrabhairava.

original: khu ba'i rnam pa bcom ldan 'das 'gyur //
analyzed: khu ba'i rnam pa bcom ldan 'das 'gyur //
translated: The form of semen is the Bhagavān.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: rdo rje ni stong pa nyid dang ye shes ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje ni stong pa nyid dang ye shes ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The vajra is the oneness of emptiness and intuition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽E is the non-arisen dissolving into the syllable A.

original: ae ste aa yig ma skyes pa la thim mo zhes pa a'a li'o zhes kyang gsung ngo //
analyzed: ae ste aa yig ma skyes pa la thim mo zhes pa a'a li'o zhes kyang gsung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is also called A-li.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'jigs byed de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'jigs byed de /
translated: Therefore, it is a fearful [vajra],

original: byis pa rnams skrag pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa rnams skrag pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of fear for the childish.

original: gang 'phags pa sgra gcan 'dzin gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang 'phags pa sgra gcan 'dzin gyis gsungs pa /
translated: As the noble Rāhula said:

original: byis pa rnams la 'jigs ston ma //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la 'jigs ston ma //
translated: It shows fear to the childish.

original: zhes so // rgyas par bstan te /
analyzed: zhes so // rgyas par bstan te /
translated: It is taught extensively:

original: a'a li zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: a'a li zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: A-li, etc.

original: bde pa mur thug par byed 'brel par byed do zhes pa nam mkha'i mtha' klas pa ste /
analyzed: bde pa mur thug par byed 'brel par byed do zhes pa nam mkha'i mtha' klas pa ste /
translated: It makes bliss reach its limit, and it makes it connected, to the end of space.

original: aa ti aa de 'ching ba la skad kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: aa ti aa de 'ching ba la skad kyi dbyings so //
translated: A-ti is the verbal root for binding.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: chos kyi dbyings ni de bzhin nyid yin la de gang gi rang gi rang bzhin de kho na nyid du yin pa ste chos can gyis chos nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni de bzhin nyid yin la de gang gi rang gi rang bzhin de kho na nyid du yin pa ste chos can gyis chos nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The dharma-dhātu is thusness, and that is the intrinsic nature of that reality, because the characterized phenomenon illustrates the characterized phenomenon.

original: yang na chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin de las skyes pa zhes 'brel lo ;
analyzed: yang na chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin de las skyes pa zhes 'brel lo ;
translated: Or else, it is related that they are born from the nature of the Reality realm.

original: / mtha' dag ni rgyu ba dang bcas pa'i mi rgyu ba rnams so //
analyzed: / mtha' dag ni rgyu ba dang bcas pa'i mi rgyu ba rnams so //
translated: All means the mobile and immobile.

original: sdig pa la shin tu spyod do zhes rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa la shin tu spyod do zhes rgyu ba'o //
translated: It is mobile in that it is very active in sin.

original: mi spyod do zhes pa mi rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: mi spyod do zhes pa mi rgyu ba ste /
translated: It is immobile in that it is not active.

original: 'khor ba can gyi lus can rnams so //
analyzed: 'khor ba can gyi lus can rnams so //
translated: It is the embodied beings who are in cyclic existence.

original: gsang bar byas na gsang pa shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi de kho na nyid 'dzin par byed do @291a * //
analyzed: gsang bar byas na gsang pa shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi de kho na nyid 'dzin par byed do @291a * //
translated: If it is kept secret, it holds the reality which is the nature of wisdom and means.

original: zhes pa 'dzin te /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dzin te /
translated: It holds,

original: skyes zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: skyes zhes 'brel lo //
translated: it is related that it is born.🔽The Buddhas and Bodhisattvas also are born from the Reality realm itself, in order to perform benefit for others, without attachment.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang mngon par ma zhen par gzhan gyi don bya ba'i ched du chos kyi dbyings kho na las skye ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang mngon par ma zhen par gzhan gyi don bya ba'i ched du chos kyi dbyings kho na las skye ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gsangs ba nges 'dzin zhes 'don pa la yang don 'di ltar ro //
analyzed: gsangs ba nges 'dzin zhes 'don pa la yang don 'di ltar ro //
translated: In the reading of the Sanskrit text, “it holds the secret,” the meaning is the same.

original: de ltar de kho na nyid mi shes pa'i lus can rnams dang de kho na nyid shes pa rnams kyang byang chub kyi sems kho na las skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar de kho na nyid mi shes pa'i lus can rnams dang de kho na nyid shes pa rnams kyang byang chub kyi sems kho na las skye'o //
translated: Thus, those embodied beings who do not know reality and those who do know reality are born from the awakening mind alone.

original: des kyang skyes zin pa rnams phung po la sogs pa rnams bdud rtsis dga' bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: des kyang skyes zin pa rnams phung po la sogs pa rnams bdud rtsis dga' bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Also, those who are born are delighted by the nectar of the aggregates and so forth, because of their pervasiveness.

original: thams cad pa ste khyab par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad pa ste khyab par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They are all-pervading, because of their pervasiveness.

original: dbang po ste bde ba skyed pa'i dor lhag pa'i bdag po nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po ste bde ba skyed pa'i dor lhag pa'i bdag po nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: They are lords, because they are the dominant condition for the generation of pleasure.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir de thams cad de rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis su son pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir de thams cad de rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis su son pa'o //
translated: Because that is so, therefore, all of that is present in the seventy-two thousand channels.

original: lte ba'i chu skyes kyi rtsa ba'i dbus su ji ltar sbyor ba de ltar goms par bya'o zhes lhag ma'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i chu skyes kyi rtsa ba'i dbus su ji ltar sbyor ba de ltar goms par bya'o zhes lhag ma'o //
translated: One should practice in the center of the navel lotus channel wheel just as it is joined.

original: de'i tshe ci ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe ci ltar bya zhe na /
translated: What should one do at that time?

original: 'jigs byed rdo rje dang sgra zhes pa yang dag sdud pa ste /
analyzed: 'jigs byed rdo rje dang sgra zhes pa yang dag sdud pa ste /
translated: The vajra of Bhairava and sound are the perfect compilers.

original: de dang ro gcig tu gyur pas so //
analyzed: de dang ro gcig tu gyur pas so //
translated: Because they become of one taste with that.

original: de yang gang las she na /
analyzed: de yang gang las she na /
translated: Moreover, from what?

original: rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du gtum mo gsum rnams gang yang rung bas sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du gtum mo gsum rnams gang yang rung bas sbyor ba ste /
translated: In the perfect maṇḍala, the three caṇḍālīs are any of the three.

original: de kho na phyag rgya yin zhing de goms pa las so //
analyzed: de kho na phyag rgya yin zhing de goms pa las so //
translated: That is the mudra, and from the practice of that,🔽how?

original: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: rlung dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rlung dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “wind” and so on.

original: rlung ni rlung nyid do //
analyzed: rlung ni rlung nyid do //
translated: “Wind” is the wind itself.

original: me ni me'o //
analyzed: me ni me'o //
translated: “Fire” is fire.

original: bdun nyid ni de kho na nyid du chos dang chos can dag tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: bdun nyid ni de kho na nyid du chos dang chos can dag tha mi dad pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Since the seven are nondifferent in reality,

original: khams bdun pa khu ba ste de'o //
analyzed: khams bdun pa khu ba ste de'o //
translated: the seven constituents are semen.

original: rdo rje ma ni rdo rje phag mo'i //
analyzed: rdo rje ma ni rdo rje phag mo'i //
translated: “Vajrī” is Vajravārāhī.

original: de'i sa bon rdul des so //
analyzed: de'i sa bon rdul des so //
translated: Her seed is the rajas.

original: thig le ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor gnas pa'i khams bdun pa'o //
analyzed: thig le ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor gnas pa'i khams bdun pa'o //
translated: The drop is the seven constituents located in the great-bliss chakra.

original: sgra tsam ni lte bar gnas pa'i rdul gyi ri mo'o //
analyzed: sgra tsam ni lte bar gnas pa'i rdul gyi ri mo'o //
translated: The mere sound is the line of rajas located in the navel.

original: de dag gi yang dag mnan pa ni phan tshun ro mnyam pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar gyur na byang chub sems te rgyun gyis char 'bebs te /
analyzed: de dag gi yang dag mnan pa ni phan tshun ro mnyam pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar gyur na byang chub sems te rgyun gyis char 'bebs te /
translated: When they are completely pressed together, they become the bodhicitta, which rains down with the stream.

original: skye gnas kyi padmar ro ;
analyzed: skye gnas kyi padmar ro ;
translated: The taste is in the lotus of the birth-place.

original: / bshad pa gzhan ni bcu bar bshad zin to //
analyzed: / bshad pa gzhan ni bcu bar bshad zin to //
translated: The other explanation is explained in the tenth chapter.

original: gang gi phyir gsungs pa /🔽dbyangs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsungs pa / dbyangs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, why is it said?

original: dbyangs rnams kyi sngon ma aa yig dang por ma'i mngal du skye ba'i sa bon ni gang rdul gyi dbus su gnas pa na bu rgyud kyi skye /
analyzed: dbyangs rnams kyi sngon ma aa yig dang por ma'i mngal du skye ba'i sa bon ni gang rdul gyi dbus su gnas pa na bu rgyud kyi skye /
translated: The first of the vowels, the seed of birth in the womb of a mother, which is in the middle of the dust, is the seed of the son.

original: de gang du yin pa de'i ste lte ba'i chu @291b skyes kyi dbus su'o //
analyzed: de gang du yin pa de'i ste lte ba'i chu @291b skyes kyi dbus su'o //
translated: Where is that? In the middle of the navel lotus.

original: de la kam bde ba kun nas myong ngo zhes pa k'a li'o //
analyzed: de la kam bde ba kun nas myong ngo zhes pa k'a li'o //
translated: There, ka is the experience of bliss.

original: skye gnas kyi chu skyes 'dis rgyas par byed do zhes pa me tog ste rdul lo //
analyzed: skye gnas kyi chu skyes 'dis rgyas par byed do zhes pa me tog ste rdul lo //
translated: This birth-lotus expands, the flower is the dust.

original: rang gi gnas su drangs nas byang chub kyi sems 'tshed par byed do zhes pa rgyal po ste des khyad par du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi gnas su drangs nas byang chub kyi sems 'tshed par byed do zhes pa rgyal po ste des khyad par du byas pa'o //
translated: Having drawn it to its own place, it cooks the bodhicitta, the king, distinguished by that.

original: me tog khyad par du len no zhes pa me tog lus can khu ba'i khams so //
analyzed: me tog khyad par du len no zhes pa me tog lus can khu ba'i khams so //
translated: The flower takes on a distinction, the flower-bodied element of semen.

original: des khyad par du byas pa'i rdo rje can ni sems kyi rdo rje ste de gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: des khyad par du byas pa'i rdo rje can ni sems kyi rdo rje ste de gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The one who is distinguished by that, the vajra-holder, is the vajra of mind; that is to be grasped.

original: ji ltar skye ba 'dzin pa'i gnas skabs su sems kyi rdo rje sgra gcan ni zla ba kho na la 'jug ste /
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba 'dzin pa'i gnas skabs su sems kyi rdo rje sgra gcan ni zla ba kho na la 'jug ste /
translated: Just as, in the state of taking birth, the vajra of mind, Rāhu, enters only the moon,

original: 'od zer bsil ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od zer bsil ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the coolness of the light rays.

original: zla ba ni nyi ma la zhugs pa na nyi ma bzung ngo zhes pa phyi rol gyi bzhin du nye bar sgrogs pa de ltar dbus mi'i gnas skabs su yang ngo //
analyzed: zla ba ni nyi ma la zhugs pa na nyi ma bzung ngo zhes pa phyi rol gyi bzhin du nye bar sgrogs pa de ltar dbus mi'i gnas skabs su yang ngo //
translated: When the moon enters the sun, it is said that the sun is grasped, just as it is proclaimed externally. In the same way, in the state of the central person.

original: 'di yang rlung la sogs pa'i sgom pa'i rim par sngar rgyas par byas so zhes pas ma spros so //
analyzed: 'di yang rlung la sogs pa'i sgom pa'i rim par sngar rgyas par byas so zhes pas ma spros so //
translated: This has also been elaborated on previously in the stage of meditation on the winds, and so forth, so it is not elaborated on here.

original: sems skye ba yang zla ba dang nyi ma dag la brten nas so zhes zhar las byung ba ston pa /
analyzed: sems skye ba yang zla ba dang nyi ma dag la brten nas so zhes zhar las byung ba ston pa /
translated: The arising of the mind also depends on the moon and sun. This is taught as a digression:

original: 'khor zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The “wheel” and so forth.

original: thams cad ni yongs su ma dag pa rnams dang yongs su dag pa rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad ni yongs su ma dag pa rnams dang yongs su dag pa rnams so //
translated: All refers to the impure and the completely pure.

original: gnyis ka'i rten can skye ba na yang rdul ma dang khu ba pha ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i rten can skye ba na yang rdul ma dang khu ba pha ste /
translated: When birth is based on both, the ovum is the mother and the semen is the father.

original: de'i sgo nas padma dang rdo rje dag dang bud med dang skyes pa dag ma dang pha dag go zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o zhes pa ji ltar rigs par go bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas padma dang rdo rje dag dang bud med dang skyes pa dag ma dang pha dag go zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o zhes pa ji ltar rigs par go bar bya'o //
translated: In that case, the lotus and the vajra, the woman and the man, the mother and the father, are established in that way, as is appropriate.

original: 'dir ni ma'i zhes pa rdul te khu ba'i bdag nyid pha nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni ma'i zhes pa rdul te khu ba'i bdag nyid pha nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: Here, the mother is the ovum, and the father is indicated by the semen.

original: sa kun du ste 'gro ba'i dbye ba rnams su'o //
analyzed: sa kun du ste 'gro ba'i dbye ba rnams su'o //
translated: Everywhere means in the various divisions of the world.

original: ye shes ni bde ba nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni bde ba nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: Wisdom is the experience of bliss.

original: de kho na ni chu ste gdung ba zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na ni chu ste gdung ba zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the water, because it alleviates the heat.

original: de phal che bar brten pa'i phyir dang shes rab la sogs pa dang sbyor ba'i phyir rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: de phal che bar brten pa'i phyir dang shes rab la sogs pa dang sbyor ba'i phyir rgya mtsho'o //
translated: It is the ocean, because it is based on the majority of that, and because it is applied to wisdom and so on.

original: 'di ni ma dang pha yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di ni ma dang pha yang ngo //
translated: This is the mother and the father.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi rgya mtsho la rab tu shes par bya zhing bsod nams nye bar bsags pa rnams kyis blta bar bya'o zhes pas shes rab ste rin po che'i bye brag rnams yin pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi rgya mtsho la rab tu shes par bya zhing bsod nams nye bar bsags pa rnams kyis blta bar bya'o zhes pas shes rab ste rin po che'i bye brag rnams yin pa /
translated: Thus, the ocean of the external should be known and seen by those who have accumulated merit.

original: de ltar 'dir stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i ye shes rin po che ni yongs su dag pa rnams kyis te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i ye shes rin po che ni yongs su dag pa rnams kyis te /
translated: Thus, here, the jewel of the wisdom of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion is for those who are pure.

original: gzhan rnams kyis ni chu srin la sogs pa bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyis ni chu srin la sogs pa bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: Others, like the crocodile, etc., are passion, etc.

original: thabs zhes pa thabs khu ba ste rdul shes rab nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: thabs zhes pa thabs khu ba ste rdul shes rab nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: The method is the semen, the fluid, and wisdom is the nectar, the essence.

original: phan tshun @292a * //
analyzed: phan tshun @292a * //
translated: They are mutually

original: 'dres pa de gnyis kyi 'dam du rnam par shes pa'i sa bon myu gu zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa de gnyis kyi 'dam du rnam par shes pa'i sa bon myu gu zhes pa'o //
translated: mixed. The seed of consciousness in that mud is the sprout.

original: gang 'phags pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang 'phags pas gsungs pa /
translated: As the Ārya said:

original: rnam shes srid pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: rnam shes srid pa'i sa bon no //
translated: Consciousness is the seed of existence.

original: zhes so // des yang sbrang rtsi rdul dang bdud rtsi khu ba ste /
analyzed: zhes so // des yang sbrang rtsi rdul dang bdud rtsi khu ba ste /
translated: Also, the honey is the essence, and the nectar is the fluid.

original: de dag gi gnas skye gnas kyi padma'i lte ba rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi gnas skye gnas kyi padma'i lte ba rgyas par byed do //
translated: It causes the lotus of the womb to open.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa'i ltar rdul dang khu ba dag gi 'ang rnam pa bsgyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa'i ltar rdul dang khu ba dag gi 'ang rnam pa bsgyur te /
translated: Because the consciousness transforms the semen and blood,

original: mer mer po la sogs pa gong nas gong du 'phel ba'i bdag nyid dang 'grib pa'i ngo bo ni yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mer mer po la sogs pa gong nas gong du 'phel ba'i bdag nyid dang 'grib pa'i ngo bo ni yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par du 'gyur te /
translated: the nature of the embryo and so on increases and decreases, and it becomes the nature of a transformation.

original: gang las 'di rnam par bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang las 'di rnam par bsgyur ba'o //
translated: From that, it is transformed.

original: me tog chu mtha' ni me tog dang chu dag ste rdul dang khu ba dag mtha' ru byed mtha' mar byed pa ste /
analyzed: me tog chu mtha' ni me tog dang chu dag ste rdul dang khu ba dag mtha' ru byed mtha' mar byed pa ste /
translated: The end of flower and water is the end of flower and water, which is the end of semen and blood.

original: sho ni mtha'i las la byings so //
analyzed: sho ni mtha'i las la byings so //
translated: The root is used for the end.

original: gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: gsungs pa yang /
translated: It is also said:

original: 'og tu khu ba zad 'gro ste //
analyzed: 'og tu khu ba zad 'gro ste //
translated: Below, the semen is exhausted.

original: lus can thams cad 'chi ba na'o //
analyzed: lus can thams cad 'chi ba na'o //
translated: At the death of all embodied beings.

original: steng du ma yi rdul sgra gcan //🔽rnam shes bsam pa'i mtshan nyid la //
analyzed: steng du ma yi rdul sgra gcan // rnam shes bsam pa'i mtshan nyid la //
translated: Above, the blood of the mother is Rāhu.

original: zhes so // bsam pa ni /
analyzed: zhes so // bsam pa ni /
translated: The consciousness is characterized by intention.🔽Intention is

original: mngon par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa ste /
translated: what is desired.

original: de las ji lta bar yul du byas pa'i 'gro ba'i bye brag tu'o //
analyzed: de las ji lta bar yul du byas pa'i 'gro ba'i bye brag tu'o //
translated: From that, in whatever way, the particular beings are made into objects.

original: skabs su bab pa gsung ba'i ched du 'brel par byed de /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa gsung ba'i ched du 'brel par byed de /
translated: In the present context, the connection is made for the purpose of speaking.

original: gnyis dag gi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis dag gi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The two, etc.

original: de ltar nyi ma dang zla ba dag skyes pa'i 'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyi ma dang zla ba dag skyes pa'i 'o //
translated: Thus, the Sun and Moon are born.

original: cho ga ni lha'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: cho ga ni lha'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The rite is the nature of the deity.

original: dang por te sngon du'o //
analyzed: dang por te sngon du'o //
translated: First, means previously.

original: reg pa las ni rdo rje dang padma dag go //
analyzed: reg pa las ni rdo rje dang padma dag go //
translated: From contact, the vajra and lotus.

original: du ba'i zhes pa du ba'i bzhin du rlangs pa 'thul ba'i phyir rlung ngo //
analyzed: du ba'i zhes pa du ba'i bzhin du rlangs pa 'thul ba'i phyir rlung ngo //
translated: The wind is like smoke, because it is exhaled like smoke.

original: gzugs ni sra ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs ni sra ba nyid do //
translated: Form is solidity.

original: ye shes rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa me la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa me la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The consecration by the vajra of wisdom is fire, etc.

original: cha rnams dang lhan cig 'jug go zhes pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor khu ba'o //
analyzed: cha rnams dang lhan cig 'jug go zhes pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor khu ba'o //
translated: The parts enter together, the moon maṇḍala is semen.

original: slar yang ni bya ba'i khyad par du brjod do //
analyzed: slar yang ni bya ba'i khyad par du brjod do //
translated: Again, the particular action is stated.

original: dbyibs ni yang dag par gnas pa ste sdud pa'o //
analyzed: dbyibs ni yang dag par gnas pa ste sdud pa'o //
translated: Shape is the perfect abiding, the gathering.

original: zad pa ni skems pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa ni skems pa'o //
translated: Exhaustion is drying up.

original: rtag tu ste rgyun gyi dbugs su byed rab tu rgyu bar byed ces rtag tu dbugs te /
analyzed: rtag tu ste rgyun gyi dbugs su byed rab tu rgyu bar byed ces rtag tu dbugs te /
translated: Always means that the breath is continuous.

original: aa na srog byed la byings so //
analyzed: aa na srog byed la byings so //
translated: Ana means life, and the verbal root means to move.

original: dbang po'i ngo bo ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i ngo bo ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The nature of the sense organ is to grasp.

original: 'dis ni sa'i khams ni rtsub pa nyid dang sra pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dis ni sa'i khams ni rtsub pa nyid dang sra pa nyid de /
translated: This passage explains that the earth element is roughness and hardness,

original: 'dzin pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i las can no //
translated: and its function is to grasp.

original: chu'i khams ni gsher ba nyid dang brlan pa nyid de sdud pa'i las can no //
analyzed: chu'i khams ni gsher ba nyid dang brlan pa nyid de sdud pa'i las can no //
translated: The water element is fluidity and moisture, and its function is to gather.

original: me ni dro ba nyid de 'tshed pa dang skems pa'i las can no //
analyzed: me ni dro ba nyid de 'tshed pa dang skems pa'i las can no //
translated: Fire is heat, and its function is to burn and dry.

original: rlung ni yang pa nyid de @292b g-yo bar byed pa nyid dang rab tu rgyu ba'i las can no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rlung ni yang pa nyid de @292b g-yo bar byed pa nyid dang rab tu rgyu ba'i las can no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Wind is lightness, and its function is to move and flow.

original: h'um zhes nga rgyal dang bcas par nang gi brjod pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa can ni khams bzhi rnams byin gyis rlob par byed do //
analyzed: h'um zhes nga rgyal dang bcas par nang gi brjod pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa can ni khams bzhi rnams byin gyis rlob par byed do //
translated: Hum is the consciousness that has the aspect of internal expression, and it is endowed with pride. It is the one that blesses the four elements.

original: lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba na ni brjod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba na ni brjod pa med pa'o //
translated: When coemergence is experienced, there is no expression.

original: de ltar rdzogs pa ni lus kyi bar gyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de ltar rdzogs pa ni lus kyi bar gyi gnas skabs so //
translated: Thus, the completion is the state up to the body.

original: 'di rnams so sor lha'i bdag nyid du 'thad pa dang bcas pa sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di rnams so sor lha'i bdag nyid du 'thad pa dang bcas pa sngar bshad zin to //
translated: It has been explained earlier that each of these is reasonable as having the nature of a deity.

original: 'di thams cad kyang stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyang stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: And all of this is the Blessed One, Vajradhara, by virtue of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: des na de kho na rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed pas lha mo rnams kyis dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: des na de kho na rang gi ngo bo gsal bar byed pas lha mo rnams kyis dga' bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, he is delighted by the goddesses, who illuminate that reality, his own nature.

original: badzra h'um zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: badzra h'um zhes pa la sogs pas so //
translated: With “vajra hūṃ” and so forth.

original: rdo rje ni ste snying rje dang shes rab ro gcig pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni ste snying rje dang shes rab ro gcig pa'o //
translated: Vajra is the single taste of compassion and wisdom.

original: legs par te snying rje chen pos gzhan gyi don bya ba la dga' ba 'di yin pa zhes pa legs par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: legs par te snying rje chen pos gzhan gyi don bya ba la dga' ba 'di yin pa zhes pa legs par dga' ba'o //
translated: He is delighted, since he is delighted in the performance of the welfare of others by means of great compassion.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi ngor rab tu 'byung ba'i dang tshul nyid kyi phyir gtso bo'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi ngor rab tu 'byung ba'i dang tshul nyid kyi phyir gtso bo'o //
translated: He is the chief, since he is the very nature of the appearance for the sake of the welfare of others.

original: sha dang lha dang shes rab dang chos dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: sha dang lha dang shes rab dang chos dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis gzigs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: He is seen by means of the eyes of flesh, of the gods, of wisdom, of Dharma, and of a buddha.

original: 'gyur med ni mtha' med du gyur pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'gyur med ni mtha' med du gyur pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Immutable is due to the absence of an end.

original: dngos po ni bde ba chen po gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po ni bde ba chen po gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: Entity is the nondual great bliss.

original: rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Nature is suchness.

original: de dag gis stong pa rnams la ni chos rnams thams cad la'o //
analyzed: de dag gis stong pa rnams la ni chos rnams thams cad la'o //
translated: Those who are empty of those are all phenomena.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs rnams kyis rnam par rol par mdzad do zhes pa'am rol du 'jug go zhes pa stong pa rnam par rol pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs rnams kyis rnam par rol par mdzad do zhes pa'am rol du 'jug go zhes pa stong pa rnam par rol pa'o //
translated: They play with the various manifestations of magical emanations, or they cause to play, which is the play of emptiness.

original: de khyod de dngos po dang dngos med dag gis rnam par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de khyod de dngos po dang dngos med dag gis rnam par spangs pa'o //
translated: You are free from those entities and nonentities.

original: snying po ni de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: snying po ni de kho na nyid de /
translated: The essence is reality.

original: de khyad par gyis khyod lta bu rnams kyis mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: de khyad par gyis khyod lta bu rnams kyis mkhyen pa'o //
translated: You know that by means of the distinctions.

original: yi ge rnams te rjod byed rnams bcom nas /
analyzed: yi ge rnams te rjod byed rnams bcom nas /
translated: Having destroyed the syllables, which are the expressions,

original: de bcom pa las brjod par bya ba thams cad brjod par byar med pa nyid du 'gro ba ma lus pa rnam par bsams shing nges par dpyad de khyod kyis so //
analyzed: de bcom pa las brjod par bya ba thams cad brjod par byar med pa nyid du 'gro ba ma lus pa rnam par bsams shing nges par dpyad de khyod kyis so //
translated: from the destruction of those, all that is to be expressed becomes inexpressible. Having contemplated and ascertained that in its entirety, you.

original: gnyis gnyis 'khyud pa ni shes rab dang thams snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis gnyis 'khyud pa ni shes rab dang thams snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: The embrace of the two is the union of wisdom and means.

original: des rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: des rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: By that yoga, which is meditative concentration,

original: des chu ni byang chub sems so //
analyzed: des chu ni byang chub sems so //
translated: the water, which is the bodhicitta,

original: de kho na bya ba ste /
analyzed: de kho na bya ba ste /
translated: is the activity of reality.

original: de phul du byung bar yod do zhes pa de'i 'bras bu can gyi chos stong pa nyid do //🔽dngos po dang dngos med la @293a * //
analyzed: de phul du byung bar yod do zhes pa de'i 'bras bu can gyi chos stong pa nyid do // dngos po dang dngos med la @293a * //
translated: That is the result, which is emptiness.

original: sogs pa gnyis nyid dang bral ba'i ngo bo gnyis med pa kho na ni gnyis med do //
analyzed: sogs pa gnyis nyid dang bral ba'i ngo bo gnyis med pa kho na ni gnyis med do //
translated: The nature of the nondual is the absence of duality, which is the absence of the two, such as entity and nonentity.

original: lhag ma med pa lhag par rtogs nas sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma med pa lhag par rtogs nas sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa thob pa'o //
translated: Having realized the absence of remainder, one is liberated from all obscurations and attains the perfection of one’s own purpose.

original: bde ba phyin ci log pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba phyin ci log pa ste /
translated: The bliss is the opposite of that.

original: des 'khor bar phan pa dang mi phan pa mngon par mi shes pa nyid kyis rnam par rmongs pa rnams thar pa khyad par du bya ste /
analyzed: des 'khor bar phan pa dang mi phan pa mngon par mi shes pa nyid kyis rnam par rmongs pa rnams thar pa khyad par du bya ste /
translated: By that, those who are confused because they do not understand the benefit and harm in samsara are distinguished for liberation.

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa des tha snyad mdzad do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa des tha snyad mdzad do //
translated: The perfection of the purpose of others is designated by that.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis rnal 'byor ma rnams dang sngags rnams rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i chog rnams kyis khyod kyi gar mdzad do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis rnal 'byor ma rnams dang sngags rnams rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i chog rnams kyis khyod kyi gar mdzad do //
translated: You dance with the yoginīs and mantras, with the various rites, by the nature of emptiness.

original: lnga po rnams kyang ste /🔽sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i rang bzhin spyan ma dang m'a ma k'i dang gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma dang rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma rnams ni lhag par rtogs pa'i gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: lnga po rnams kyang ste / sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i rang bzhin spyan ma dang m'a ma k'i dang gos dkar mo dang sgrol ma dang rdo rje dbyings kyi dbang phyug ma rnams ni lhag par rtogs pa'i gnyis su med pa'i de kho na nyid de /
translated: The five are also🔽Vajra Nairātmyā, Locanā, Māmakī, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, Tārā, and Vajradhātvīśvarī, who have the nature of earth, water, fire, wind, and space, respectively.

original: des nye bar mtshon pa rnams te /
analyzed: des nye bar mtshon pa rnams te /
translated: They are characterized by the nondual reality of realization.

original: de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo rtogs pa rnams so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo rtogs pa rnams so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: They are the ones who have realized the nature of reality.

original: sgyu ma rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i ngo bos sems can rnams khyed kyis smin par mdzad do //
analyzed: sgyu ma rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i ngo bos sems can rnams khyed kyis smin par mdzad do //
translated: You ripen sentient beings with the various forms of illusion.

original: rdo rje stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i legs par brkyang zhing lhag par rtogs par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i legs par brkyang zhing lhag par rtogs par bya ba ste /
translated: The vajra is the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion, which is to be fully realized.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The essence of the perfect fulfillment of one's own and others' goals.

original: des bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos sems can rnams chos ston pa la sogs pa rnams kyis rmongs pa dang bral bar khyod kyis mdzad do //
analyzed: des bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos sems can rnams chos ston pa la sogs pa rnams kyis rmongs pa dang bral bar khyod kyis mdzad do //
translated: Since it holds the individual characteristics of pleasure, pain, etc., you, O Dharma, have made sentient beings free from confusion by means of the teachings, etc.

original: de ltar bstod nas rab tu dang ba lhag pos gzhan rnams la yang smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar bstod nas rab tu dang ba lhag pos gzhan rnams la yang smras pa /
translated: Having thus praised, he says to others with even greater clarity:

original: de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dpag tu med pa'i legs pa'i snying po'i chos rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis thar pa bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshol cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa dpag tu med pa'i legs pa'i snying po'i chos rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis thar pa bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshol cig ces pa'o //
translated: Thus, O yoginis, bow to the Blessed One, the Dharma, the essence of inconceivable, immeasurable goodness, and liberation.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni bde ba chen po'i sku nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das bstod do //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni bde ba chen po'i sku nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das bstod do //
translated: Here, in the first verse, he praises the Blessed One by means of the body of great bliss.

original: gnyis pas ni chos kyi sku nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni chos kyi sku nyid kyis so //
translated: In the second, by means of the Dharma body.

original: gsum pa la sogs pa rnams kyis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gsum pa la sogs pa rnams kyis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku nyid kyis so //
translated: In the third and following verses, by means of the enjoyment body.

original: sgyu ma'i zhes pa la sogs pas sprul pa'i sku nyid kyis te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i zhes pa la sogs pas sprul pa'i sku nyid kyis te /
translated: By illusory and so on, it is the very Emanation Body.

original: ji ltar rigs par gzhan gyi don nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par gzhan gyi don nyid kyis so //
translated: As is appropriate, it is by the very benefit of others.

original: lhag ma phyed kyis spro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma phyed kyis spro bar byed pa'o //
translated: The remaining half is to delight.

original: bstod pa'i dgos pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: bstod pa'i dgos pa gsungs pa /
translated: The purpose of the praise is stated:

original: 'dis zhes pa la sogs pa @293b ste ;
analyzed: 'dis zhes pa la sogs pa @293b ste ;
translated: By this and so on.

original: 'di'i don goms pa las so //🔽rgyal ba rnams thams cad de rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams gang gi bdag nyid las skyes pa yin pa de ni de skad de /
analyzed: 'di'i don goms pa las so // rgyal ba rnams thams cad de rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams gang gi bdag nyid las skyes pa yin pa de ni de skad de /
translated: The meaning of this is by cultivation.

original: rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The Victorious Ones are all of them, Vairochana and so on, who are born from the very nature of that, which is thus called Vajrasattva.

original: 'di kho na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces pa'o //🔽dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: 'di kho na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces pa'o // dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: This very one is all the Tathagatas because of being the very nature of all the Tathagatas.🔽 The Commentary on the Glorious Compendium of Practice

original: man ngag gi snye mar sne ma sum cu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: man ngag gi snye mar sne ma sum cu gsum pa'o /
translated: The thirty-third flower from the Bouquet of Instructions

original: // /'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi cho ga rjes su sgrub pa'i ched du bgegs nye bar gzhom pa'i ched du gtor ma'i cho ga la nges par sbyor ba gsungs pa nyon zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: // /'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi cho ga rjes su sgrub pa'i ched du bgegs nye bar gzhom pa'i ched du gtor ma'i cho ga la nges par sbyor ba gsungs pa nyon zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to accomplish the rite of mundane and supramundane powers, and in order to destroy the obstructors, he declares the application to the rite of the sacrificial cake: Listen to the rite of the sacrificial cake, etc.

original: dri dmar po ni gur gum mo //🔽sogs pas zhabs bsil lo //
analyzed: dri dmar po ni gur gum mo // sogs pas zhabs bsil lo //
translated: Red odor is saffron.🔽Etc. refers to the foot-washing.

original: sogs pas btsong dang sgog skya la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pas btsong dang sgog skya la sogs pa'o //
translated: Etc. refers to garlic, onions, etc.

original: chang ni dga' byed 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: chang ni dga' byed 'dod pa ste /
translated: Wine is the desired delight,

original: dga' bar nus pa mchog go zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dga' bar nus pa mchog go zhes pa'i don to //
translated: meaning that it is the supreme ability to delight.

original: chu ni zhabs bsil lo //🔽yang dag par sbyang ba ni ji ltar rigs par bdud rtsi lnga'i ril bu btab pas sam /
analyzed: chu ni zhabs bsil lo // yang dag par sbyang ba ni ji ltar rigs par bdud rtsi lnga'i ril bu btab pas sam /
translated: Water is the foot-washing.

original: bdud rtsi lnga'i ngo bor bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga'i ngo bor bsgoms pas so //
translated: Purification means that one should imagine that the sacrificial cake is anointed with the pill of the five ambrosias, or that it is the essence of the five ambrosias.

original: dang yig las ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dang yig las ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'o //
translated: The word also means that one should abide in the meditative concentration of the Knowledge Ḍākinī.

original: cho ga nam rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: cho ga nam rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: The rite is taught in other tantras,

original: de 'di'i 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'di'i 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and will be explained here.

original: padma'i snod kyi gtor ma'o //
analyzed: padma'i snod kyi gtor ma'o //
translated: The sacrificial cake is in a lotus vessel.

original: de nyid kyi lha'i de kho na nyid de de'i khyad par rnams kyis te kha dog lnga'i 'od zer sbu gu'i ngo bo can rnams kyis sam de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnams kyis yid kyis bkug nas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi lha'i de kho na nyid de de'i khyad par rnams kyis te kha dog lnga'i 'od zer sbu gu'i ngo bo can rnams kyis sam de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnams kyis yid kyis bkug nas /
translated: The reality of that deity, by its distinctions, that is, by the nature of the light rays of five colors, or by the five Tathagatas, having been drawn in by the mind,

original: bdag po'i lha la sogs pa rnams thams cad tshim par bya'o zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i lha la sogs pa rnams thams cad tshim par bya'o zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: all the deities, the lord deity and so forth, should be satisfied.🔽How?

original: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:🔽The lord of beings, the liberator, the supreme, the many, the child,

original: ye shes zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: the hooks of the five intuitions,🔽the five intuitions, the five gnoses,🔽the five Tathagatas, the five hooks.

original: skye dgu'i bdag po ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag po ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The lord of beings is Akshobhya.

original: sgrol ba ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: sgrol ba ni rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: The liberator is Vairochana.

original: rab mchog ni rin chen dbang po'o //
analyzed: rab mchog ni rin chen dbang po'o //
translated: The supreme is Ratnasambhava.

original: mang po ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: mang po ni snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: The many is Amitabha.

original: byis pa ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: The child is Amoghasiddhi.

original: 'di rnams lcags kyu bzhin du mngon par 'dod pa'i don nye ba ru byed pa'i phyir lcags kyu rnams so //
analyzed: 'di rnams lcags kyu bzhin du mngon par 'dod pa'i don nye ba ru byed pa'i phyir lcags kyu rnams so //
translated: These are hooks because they bring the desired object near, like a hook.

original: ye shes lnga rnams ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: ye shes lnga rnams ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The five intuitions are the very pure intuition and so forth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di rnams don chen po bya ba nus pa'i phyir ye shes chen po'o //🔽rnam pa @294a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di rnams don chen po bya ba nus pa'i phyir ye shes chen po'o // rnam pa @294a * //
translated: Therefore, these are great intuition, because they are able to perform the great aim.

original: de lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa lnga nyid du mos pa rnams ni sgron ma lnga rnams dang lcags kyu lnga rnams so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa lnga nyid du mos pa rnams ni sgron ma lnga rnams dang lcags kyu lnga rnams so //
translated: The five lamps and the five hooks are the five Tathagatas themselves, who are the nature of such intuition, and who are imagined.

original: de rnams kyi dbye ba ni sgom pa'i bye brag nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbye ba ni sgom pa'i bye brag nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: Their division is indicated by the differences in meditation.

original: bdud rtsi lnga'i sa bon gyi yi ge rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga'i sa bon gyi yi ge rnams kyang ngo //
translated: The seed-syllables of the five nectars are also [indicated].

original: rgan po la sogs pa'i sor mo rnams skye dgu'i bdag po la sogs pa'i ming can du gzhan du gsungs pa rnams 'dir yang ngo zhes kha cig ste /
analyzed: rgan po la sogs pa'i sor mo rnams skye dgu'i bdag po la sogs pa'i ming can du gzhan du gsungs pa rnams 'dir yang ngo zhes kha cig ste /
translated: Some say that the fingers of the old man, etc., which are said elsewhere to be named Prajapati, etc., are also [indicated here].

original: de ni 'byor pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'byor pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not correct.

original: las rnams kun la ni zhi ba la sogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: las rnams kun la ni zhi ba la sogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: In all actions, in pacifying, etc.

original: rtag tu ni brtan pa de rgyun gyis 'byung ba zhes pa'i don to ;
analyzed: rtag tu ni brtan pa de rgyun gyis 'byung ba zhes pa'i don to ;
translated: Always means constantly, with continuity, that is the meaning.

original: / rnal 'byor ma kun zhes pa lha //
analyzed: / rnal 'byor ma kun zhes pa lha //
translated: All yoginis, the deity,

original: zhes nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: zhes nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: is indicated.

original: dam tshig can rnams dang bdag nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: dam tshig can rnams dang bdag nyid kyang ngo //
translated: and the self also, in the presence of those who have the commitments.

original: tshim par bya ste lcags kyu la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: tshim par bya ste lcags kyu la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: One should satisfy them with the hook, etc.

original: ma yin pa ste 'dod pa de rnams la kun nas chags par 'gyur ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ma yin pa ste 'dod pa de rnams la kun nas chags par 'gyur ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: One should not be attached to those objects of desire.

original: 'dis ni nang gi gtor ma mtshon to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nang gi gtor ma mtshon to //
translated: This indicates the inner oblation.

original: longs spyad par bya bas na longs spyod de /
analyzed: longs spyad par bya bas na longs spyod de /
translated: Enjoyment is that which is to be enjoyed.

original: phun sum tshogs pa'i bye brag tshim par byed pa'i bsod nams las skyes pa mthong ba'i chos kyi 'am brgyud pa'i'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa'i bye brag tshim par byed pa'i bsod nams las skyes pa mthong ba'i chos kyi 'am brgyud pa'i'o //
translated: It is the merit born of the satisfaction of the particular perfection, either in this life or in the next.

original: des rang nyid la mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: des rang nyid la mi sbyor ro //
translated: One should not apply it to oneself.🔽One should give it to others alone.

original: gzhan rnams kho na la de gtang bar bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kho na la de gtang bar bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the idea.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, he says,

original: sems can zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽aom zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: sems can zhes pa la sogs pa'o // aom zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa gsungs pa /
translated: sentient beings, etc.🔽Om, etc.

original: bcu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The extensive explanation is stated: ten, etc.

original: de'i ste zla ba'i steng du aom a'a: h'um gi sa bon rnams a'a li k'a li yongs su gyur pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i ste zla ba'i steng du aom a'a: h'um gi sa bon rnams a'a li k'a li yongs su gyur pa rnams so //
translated: On that, i.e., on the moon, are the seed syllables Om, Ah, and Hum, which are the complete transformation of the vowels and consonants.

original: gsal ba ni shel bzhin du shin tu gsal bzhin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gsal ba ni shel bzhin du shin tu gsal bzhin pa nyid do //
translated: Clear means that they are very clear, like crystal.

original: sbar ba ni kha tv'am ga rdo rjes so //
analyzed: sbar ba ni kha tv'am ga rdo rjes so //
translated: Blazing means with the vajra khaṭvāṅga.

original: gdungs pa ni 'og gi mes so //
analyzed: gdungs pa ni 'og gi mes so //
translated: Melting means with the fire below.

original: de las te shel gyi gzugs las bar ma chad du thams cad de zla ba dang a'a li dang k'a li dang yi ge gsum las 'od zer spro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las te shel gyi gzugs las bar ma chad du thams cad de zla ba dang a'a li dang k'a li dang yi ge gsum las 'od zer spro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: From that, i.e., from the crystal form, without interruption, all means the moon, the vowels and consonants, and the three syllables, the emission of light rays, and so forth.

original: de'i ste shel gyi ngo bo'i dbus nas byung ba'i bdud rtsi dkyil 'khor pa dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po mchod yon la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bar myang du gzhug go //
analyzed: de'i ste shel gyi ngo bo'i dbus nas byung ba'i bdud rtsi dkyil 'khor pa dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po mchod yon la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bar myang du gzhug go //
translated: From that, i.e., from the center of the essence of the crystal, the nectar, together with the maṇḍala, is offered to the maṇḍala lord, preceded by the libation, and so forth.

original: ni tsa yis nges par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ni tsa yis nges par bstan pa'o //
translated: Ni is taught by ca.

original: de nas bar ma chad du lhag ma bdud rtsi dang mchod yon la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyis phyogs skyong @294b la sogs pa rnams tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bar ma chad du lhag ma bdud rtsi dang mchod yon la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyis phyogs skyong @294b la sogs pa rnams tshim par bya'o //
translated: Then, without a break, the rest of the things, the nectar, the water for the feet, and so on, should satisfy the direction protectors, and so on.

original: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How? It is said:

original: g-yon zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The left, and so on.”

original: dgug pa'i phyag rgyas rgyas par ston te /
analyzed: dgug pa'i phyag rgyas rgyas par ston te /
translated: The mudra of summoning is taught extensively.

original: mnan zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mnan zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Pressing down,” and so on.

original: gyen zhes pa gyen du'o //
analyzed: gyen zhes pa gyen du'o //
translated: “Upward” means upward.

original: phat ces pa'i sngags brjod cing dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: phat ces pa'i sngags brjod cing dgug par bya'o //
translated: The mantra “phaṭ” should be uttered and the summoning should be done.

original: mchod nas zhes pa phyi yis yang dag par mchod nas so //
analyzed: mchod nas zhes pa phyi yis yang dag par mchod nas so //
translated: “Having worshipped” means having worshipped externally.

original: mchod pa'i bdag nyid ces pa nang gi mchod pa dang ldan pa 'di'i bdag nyid yin pa zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: mchod pa'i bdag nyid ces pa nang gi mchod pa dang ldan pa 'di'i bdag nyid yin pa zhes byas nas so //
translated: “Having the nature of worship” means having the nature of inner worship.

original: chu zhes pa chu la'o //
analyzed: chu zhes pa chu la'o //
translated: “In the water” means in the water.

original: phal che bar 'dir lha rnams nye bar byed do zhes pa nag po'i phyogs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phal che bar 'dir lha rnams nye bar byed do zhes pa nag po'i phyogs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Mostly here the gods approach,” and so on.

original: shing gcig ces pa la sogs pa gtor ma spyin pa'i gnas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: shing gcig ces pa la sogs pa gtor ma spyin pa'i gnas gsungs pa'o //
translated: “The single tree,” and so on, teaches the place for giving the bali offering.

original: nag po drag po ni dbang po'o //
analyzed: nag po drag po ni dbang po'o //
translated: The fierce is Indra.

original: drag po chen po ni lus ngan no //
analyzed: drag po chen po ni lus ngan no //
translated: The great fierce is Kubera.

original: lha mo ni lhas byin te chu lha'o //
analyzed: lha mo ni lhas byin te chu lha'o //
translated: The goddess is Devī, i.e., Varuṇa.

original: nag po ni gshin rje'o //
analyzed: nag po ni gshin rje'o //
translated: The black is Yama.

original: thod pa can ni dbang phyug chen po'o //
analyzed: thod pa can ni dbang phyug chen po'o //
translated: The skull-bearer is Maheśvara.

original: mi sdug pa ni me lha'o //
analyzed: mi sdug pa ni me lha'o //
translated: The ugly is Agni.

original: dga' las 'das ni bden bral lo //
analyzed: dga' las 'das ni bden bral lo //
translated: The beyond-joy is Nirṛti.

original: log 'dren ni rlung lha'o //
analyzed: log 'dren ni rlung lha'o //
translated: The misleader is Vāyu.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma dang tshangs pa dang thags pa zangs ris dang sa'i lha rnams 'dir ma gsungs pa rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa rnams kyang shes par bya ste 'khor dang bcas pa yang ngo //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma dang tshangs pa dang thags pa zangs ris dang sa'i lha rnams 'dir ma gsungs pa rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa rnams kyang shes par bya ste 'khor dang bcas pa yang ngo //
translated: The moon, the sun, Brahmā, Viṣṇu, and the earth-gods, although not mentioned here, are to be understood as being included, along with their retinues, as mentioned in other tantras.

original: de la dbang po'i khyab 'jug go //
analyzed: de la dbang po'i khyab 'jug go //
translated: Among them, Indra is Viṣṇu.

original: drag po chen po'i log 'dren no //
analyzed: drag po chen po'i log 'dren no //
translated: The great fierce is the misleader.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma dag gi gza' dang rgyu skar la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma dag gi gza' dang rgyu skar la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The moon and sun have planets, stars, etc.

original: sa'i klu rnams so //
analyzed: sa'i klu rnams so //
translated: The earth has nāgas.

original: phyogs bcu rnams su yang de dang de'i phyogs kyi dbang po'i 'khor sems can dpag tu med pa rnams so //
analyzed: phyogs bcu rnams su yang de dang de'i phyogs kyi dbang po'i 'khor sems can dpag tu med pa rnams so //
translated: In the ten directions, there are countless sentient beings in the retinue of each directional lord.🔽 🔽The ten directions means the four cardinal directions, the four intermediate directions, above, and below.

original: mkha' 'gro ma lnga rnams ni ye shes mkha' 'gro ma dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dang drag mo dang ro langs ma dang gtum mo rnams so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma lnga rnams ni ye shes mkha' 'gro ma dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma dang drag mo dang ro langs ma dang gtum mo rnams so //
translated: The five dakinis are the Gnosis Dakini, the Vajra Dakini, the Fierce One, the Zombie, and the Fierce Woman.

original: chen po shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la sogs pa rnams gang rnams kyi de kho na nyid yin pa de rnams ni de skad do //
analyzed: chen po shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la sogs pa rnams gang rnams kyi de kho na nyid yin pa de rnams ni de skad do //
translated: The great ones are the Gnosis of the Dharmadhatu, etc., which are the realities of those [dakinis].

original: de rnams kyi las rnams thams cad gdul bya'i bsam pa dang rjes su mthun par rnal 'byor pas sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi las rnams thams cad gdul bya'i bsam pa dang rjes su mthun par rnal 'byor pas sgrub par byed do //
translated: The yogi/ni accomplishes all their actions in accordance with the inclinations of those to be trained.

original: rnal 'byor dkyil 'khor du ni snying po'i 'phar mar ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dkyil 'khor du ni snying po'i 'phar mar ro //
translated: In the mandala of the yogi/ni, [they are accomplished] in the heart.

original: rgyal mo che rnams ni seng ge mo dang stag mo dang ce spyang mo dang 'ug pa mo rnams so //
analyzed: rgyal mo che rnams ni seng ge mo dang stag mo dang ce spyang mo dang 'ug pa mo rnams so //
translated: The great queens are the Lioness, the Tigress, the Jackal, and the Owl.

original: rdo rje dbang phyug ma rnams ni mkha' 'gro ma dang gsal byed ma dang 'ji ba byed ma dang ka mpo @295a * //🔽dzi rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje dbang phyug ma rnams ni mkha' 'gro ma dang gsal byed ma dang 'ji ba byed ma dang ka mpo @295a * //🔽dzi rnams so //
translated: The Vajradharas are the Dakini, the Illuminator, the Earth-maker, and the Kumbha.

original: gtso bo rnams ni phyogs skyong nag po drag po la sogs pa rnams so zhes pa rim pa'o //
analyzed: gtso bo rnams ni phyogs skyong nag po drag po la sogs pa rnams so zhes pa rim pa'o //
translated: The principal ones are the black directional guardians, Rudra, and so on.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor du mkha' 'gro ma lnga rnams ni rdo rje snyems ma dang spyan ma dang m'a ma k'i dang dkar mo dang sgrol ma rnams te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor du mkha' 'gro ma lnga rnams ni rdo rje snyems ma dang spyan ma dang m'a ma k'i dang dkar mo dang sgrol ma rnams te /
translated: In the mandala of Vajrasattva, the five dakinis are Vajragarvi, Locana, Mamaki, Pandara, and Tara.

original: de rnams dang de nyid chen po rnams kyang ste /
analyzed: de rnams dang de nyid chen po rnams kyang ste /
translated: They and the great realities are

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Vajrasattva and so on.

original: rnal 'byor dkyil 'khor du ste rim pa gnyis par rgyal mo che rnams ni rdo rje drag mo la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dkyil 'khor du ste rim pa gnyis par rgyal mo che rnams ni rdo rje drag mo la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: In the yoga mandala, the great heroines are Vajravetali and so on.

original: rdo rje dbang mo rnams ni me tog ma la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje dbang mo rnams ni me tog ma la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The vajra goddesses are Pushpe and so on.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po'i dkyil 'khor du ni mkha' 'gro ma lnga rnams ni rdo rje phag mo dang mkha' 'gro ma dang l'a ma dang dum skyes ma dang gzugs can ma rnams so //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po'i dkyil 'khor du ni mkha' 'gro ma lnga rnams ni rdo rje phag mo dang mkha' 'gro ma dang l'a ma dang dum skyes ma dang gzugs can ma rnams so //
translated: In the mandala of the king of knowledge, the five dakinis are Vajravarahi, Dakini, Lami, Gauri, and Rupini.

original: de rnams kyi de nyid chen po ni bde mchog go //
analyzed: de rnams kyi de nyid chen po ni bde mchog go //
translated: Their great reality is Heruka.

original: rnal 'byor ni thod pa'i dum bu la sogs pa rnams kyis te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni thod pa'i dum bu la sogs pa rnams kyis te /
translated: The yogas are those of Kapalin, etc.

original: de'i dkyil 'khor ni thugs dang gsung dang sku'i 'khor lo rnams te /
analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor ni thugs dang gsung dang sku'i 'khor lo rnams te /
translated: His mandalas are those of mind, speech, and body.

original: de rnams su rgyal mo che rnams ni rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams su rgyal mo che rnams ni rab tu gtum mo la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: In them, the great heroines are Prachaṇḍā, etc.

original: rdo rje dbang phyug ma rnams ni khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje dbang phyug ma rnams ni khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The Vajradākinīs are Kākāsyā, etc.

original: he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor du ni mkha' 'gro ma lnga rnams bdag med ma dang goo r'i la sogs pa rnams so ;
analyzed: he ru ka'i dkyil 'khor du ni mkha' 'gro ma lnga rnams bdag med ma dang goo r'i la sogs pa rnams so ;
translated: In the mandala of Heruka, the five dakinis are Nairātmyā, Gaurī, etc.

original: / de rnams kho na gang gi de nyid chen po yin pa de ni de nyid chen po ste /
analyzed: / de rnams kho na gang gi de nyid chen po yin pa de ni de nyid chen po ste /
translated: They are the great reality of that, so it is the great reality.

original: kye'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: kye'i rdo rje'o //
translated: It is Hevajra.

original: sbyor ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams te /
translated: The mandalas of union are the mandalas of pacification, etc.

original: de rnams su rgyal mo chen mo rnams ni pukka s'i la sogs pa bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams su rgyal mo chen mo rnams ni pukka s'i la sogs pa bzhi rnams so //
translated: In them, the great heroines are the four beginning with Pukkasī.

original: rdo rje dbang mo rnams ni rta gdong ma la sogs pa rnams so zhes pa don rnam pa bzhir gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbang mo rnams ni rta gdong ma la sogs pa rnams so zhes pa don rnam pa bzhir gnas pa'o //
translated: Thus, the meaning is established in four ways.

original: lha rnams thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku /
analyzed: lha rnams thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku /
translated: All the deities are the body of the Tathagata,

original: chen po'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chen po'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: and should be known as the nature of the Great Seal.

original: gang las skyon 'dod chags la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba ni skyon med de stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te de byung ba rnams so //🔽'di zhes pa 'dis so //
analyzed: gang las skyon 'dod chags la sogs pa las nges par 'byung ba ni skyon med de stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te de byung ba rnams so // 'di zhes pa 'dis so //
translated: The faultless ones are those who have emerged from the faultless, i.e., the samadhi of the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion, from which there is deliverance from desire, etc.🔽By this, i.e., by the samadhi of the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion,

original: rdo rje dbang phyug ma ni ye shes mkha' 'gro ma 'am rdo rje snyems ma'am rdo rje phag mo 'am bdag med ma'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbang phyug ma ni ye shes mkha' 'gro ma 'am rdo rje snyems ma'am rdo rje phag mo 'am bdag med ma'o //
translated: the Vajra Queen is the Knowledge Dakini, or Vajragarva, or Vajravarahi, or Nairatmya.

original: de'i bka' ni aom ka kka zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bka' ni aom ka kka zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Her command is Om kakaca, etc.

original: des thams cad de ye shes @295b kyi lha'i 'khor lo kun nas tshur spyon cig ste /
analyzed: des thams cad de ye shes @295b kyi lha'i 'khor lo kun nas tshur spyon cig ste /
translated: By that, all, i.e., the entire circle of the Knowledge Deity, come here.

original: thams cad nas dam tshig gi 'khor lo dang lhan cig ro mnyam par gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad nas dam tshig gi 'khor lo dang lhan cig ro mnyam par gyur cig pa'o //
translated: All together, i.e., together with the Commitment Circle, become of one taste.

original: de'i rjes su bdud rtsir bsams nas /
analyzed: de'i rjes su bdud rtsir bsams nas /
translated: After that, one should imagine it as nectar.

original: ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i 'khor lo tshim pa'i rjes thogs su /
analyzed: ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i 'khor lo tshim pa'i rjes thogs su /
translated: After the satisfaction of the wheel of the Gnosis Ḍākinīs,

original: aom ti shtha zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyis lha rnams kyi zhal bdud rtsis dgang bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom ti shtha zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyis lha rnams kyi zhal bdud rtsis dgang bar bya'o //
translated: one should fill the mouths of the deities with the nectar by means of the mantra “Oṃ tiṣṭha vajra” and so forth.

original: rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor ma'i lha de rnams kyang gang zhi ba la sogs pa'i las sam bsod nams mngon par 'dod pa de mdzad par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor ma'i lha de rnams kyang gang zhi ba la sogs pa'i las sam bsod nams mngon par 'dod pa de mdzad par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate that those deities of the yogin and yoginī also perform whatever action is desired, such as pacification, and so forth.

original: kha cig tu tshig gis las la sogs pa la zhes 'don te /
analyzed: kha cig tu tshig gis las la sogs pa la zhes 'don te /
translated: Some editions read “in the action and so forth of the words.”

original: de'i tshe bdud rtsi ste myos byed kyis kha bkang nas gtor la bi ka'i rnam pas de 'phangs par bya'o zhes gsung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe bdud rtsi ste myos byed kyis kha bkang nas gtor la bi ka'i rnam pas de 'phangs par bya'o zhes gsung ngo //
translated: At that time, one should offer the nectar, that is, the intoxicant, filling the mouth, and one should cast it with the form of a bee, it is said.

original: rkang pa'i las te gar ni rdo rje'i rkang pas bya'o zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: rkang pa'i las te gar ni rdo rje'i rkang pas bya'o zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that the action of the feet, that is, dancing, should be done with the vajra feet.

original: de las thams cad 'grub bo /
analyzed: de las thams cad 'grub bo /
translated: All actions are accomplished from that.

original: ha cig bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa las bsam pas ni de'i tha ma la ba'i kha dog 'phrog go //
analyzed: ha cig bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa las bsam pas ni de'i tha ma la ba'i kha dog 'phrog go //
translated: By imagining the five nectars and so forth, one should steal the color of the moon at the end of that.

original: ho yig gis tha mal pa'i dri 'joms so //
analyzed: ho yig gis tha mal pa'i dri 'joms so //
translated: The syllable HO destroys the smell of ordinariness.

original: hr'i: yig gis tha mal pa'i nus pa 'joms so //
analyzed: hr'i: yig gis tha mal pa'i nus pa 'joms so //
translated: The syllable HRĪḤ destroys the potency of ordinariness.

original: bya ba rnam pa gsum yang yi ge gsum po rnams brjod nas rim pa ji lta bar snang ba mtha' yas dang rnam par snang mdzad dang mi bskyod pa ste lha gsum gyi ngo bor bsgoms pa rnams kyis bltas par byas pa'i gtor ma la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba rnam pa gsum yang yi ge gsum po rnams brjod nas rim pa ji lta bar snang ba mtha' yas dang rnam par snang mdzad dang mi bskyod pa ste lha gsum gyi ngo bor bsgoms pa rnams kyis bltas par byas pa'i gtor ma la 'gyur ro //
translated: The three actions are also done by the three syllables, and the three deities, Amitābha, Vairocana, and Akṣobhya, respectively, who are visualized in the form of the three deities.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: padma zhes pa'o //
analyzed: padma zhes pa'o //
translated: “lotus” is the name.

original: padma'i dbang phyug ni 'od dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: padma'i dbang phyug ni 'od dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: The lord of the lotus is Amitābha.

original: gser mdog ni gtor ma la gzugs mchog byed pa'o //
analyzed: gser mdog ni gtor ma la gzugs mchog byed pa'o //
translated: The golden color is the best form for the bali.

original: legs par rnam snang mdzad ni dkar po ste /
analyzed: legs par rnam snang mdzad ni dkar po ste /
translated: The excellent Vairocana is white.

original: dri'i chu bskyod par bya ba ma yin gnod bya ma yin pa dri dam pa'o //
analyzed: dri'i chu bskyod par bya ba ma yin gnod bya ma yin pa dri dam pa'o //
translated: The pure smell is not to be disturbed by the water, not to be harmed, the excellent smell.
