original: rdo rje dbang phyug ni mi bskyod pa nag po rdo rje'i phyag can no //
analyzed: rdo rje dbang phyug ni mi bskyod pa nag po rdo rje'i phyag can no //
translated: The lord of the vajra is Akṣobhya, black, with a vajra in his hand.

original: myang ba ni ro'i bye brag go //
analyzed: myang ba ni ro'i bye brag go //
translated: The taste is a particular flavor.

original: gsum rnams kyis te gser gyi mdog la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gsum rnams kyis te gser gyi mdog la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: The three, i.e., the golden-colored and so on.

original: de ltar bdud rtsir byas pa'i myos byed dam tshig can rnams la sbyin pa'i tshigs su bcas pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar bdud rtsir byas pa'i myos byed dam tshig can rnams la sbyin pa'i tshigs su bcas pa gsungs pa /
translated: Having thus made the intoxicant into nectar, the verse is stated to give it to the vow-holders.

original: ltos zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ltos zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The verse begins with “Look!”

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di rnams don dam par dngos po'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyis dag pa rnams ltos te tshad mas yongs su mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos 'di rnams don dam par dngos po'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyis dag pa rnams ltos te tshad mas yongs su mthong ba'o //
translated: Look at these phenomena, form and so on, which are pure by the emptiness of the intrinsic reality of things in the ultimate, and see them with valid cognition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir med pa kun nas bsgom pa yang ring du dor cig / dngos po dang dngos po med par sgro 'dogs @296a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir med pa kun nas bsgom pa yang ring du dor cig / dngos po dang dngos po med par sgro 'dogs @296a * //
translated: Therefore, also cast far away the meditation on complete non-existence.

original: pa dag ni gcig dang bral ba las gzhan pa dang bral ba bya sla ba kho na'o //
analyzed: pa dag ni gcig dang bral ba las gzhan pa dang bral ba bya sla ba kho na'o //
translated: The superimpositions of existence and non-existence are easily removed by the removal of the one, i.e., existence, and the other, i.e., non-existence.

original: de ltar sgro 'dogs 'dogs pa mtha' dag stong pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gcig tu zos pa ste bram ze la sogs pa tha dad pa'i kun du rtog pa snang ba med par byas pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar sgro 'dogs 'dogs pa mtha' dag stong pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gcig tu zos pa ste bram ze la sogs pa tha dad pa'i kun du rtog pa snang ba med par byas pa rnams so //
translated: Thus, all superimpositions are consumed into one nature by emptiness, and the appearances of the various discriminations, such as the brahmin, are made to disappear.

original: de'i phyir rigs dang rigs ma yin pa dang bgrod bya dang bgrod min dang bza' bya dang bza' min dang btung bya dang btung min la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal nas 'thung cig ces dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs dang rigs ma yin pa dang bgrod bya dang bgrod min dang bza' bya dang bza' min dang btung bya dang btung min la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bsal nas 'thung cig ces dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, having removed the conceptualization of what is proper and improper, what is to be traversed and not to be traversed, what is to be eaten and not to be eaten, what is to be drunk and not to be drunk, etc., drink!

original: de lta sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should give.

original: bya ba ni sbyin pa po dang len pa pos kyang ngo //
analyzed: bya ba ni sbyin pa po dang len pa pos kyang ngo //
translated: The action is that of the giver and the receiver.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: g-yon zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: g-yon zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The left, etc.

original: rtse mo rnams ni sor mo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rtse mo rnams ni sor mo rnams kyi'o //
translated: The tips are the fingers.

original: 'jug pa ni tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The entry is into the mandala of the assembly.

original: bde gshegs chos ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: bde gshegs chos ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The Sugata's Dharma is thusness.

original: mchod yon ni mchod pa ste /
analyzed: mchod yon ni mchod pa ste /
translated: The libation is the worship.

original: de mchod par rung ba khams gsum na yang cung zad yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de mchod par rung ba khams gsum na yang cung zad yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not suitable for worship anywhere in the three realms.

original: sgrub pa kho na de la mchod pa dam pa'o zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa kho na de la mchod pa dam pa'o zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: The practice alone is the highest worship of that.

original: de ni thams cad du 'dod chags kyi dri ma dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de ni thams cad du 'dod chags kyi dri ma dang bral ba ste /
translated: That is free from the stain of passion everywhere.

original: bde ba kun nas tshor ba ni 'khor ba'i gtso bo'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: bde ba kun nas tshor ba ni 'khor ba'i gtso bo'i rgyu ste /
translated: The feeling of all bliss is the principal cause of cyclic existence.

original: de'i yang rgyu 'dod chags so //
analyzed: de'i yang rgyu 'dod chags so //
translated: And the cause of that is passion.🔽By the purification of passion, the collection of cyclic existence together with its members is purified.

original: 'dod chags rnam par dag pas 'khor ba yan lag dang bcas pa'i tshogs pa rnam par dag par byed do zhes dgongs pas 'dod chags tsam dang bral ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags rnam par dag pas 'khor ba yan lag dang bcas pa'i tshogs pa rnam par dag par byed do zhes dgongs pas 'dod chags tsam dang bral ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus, thinking that, he said, “free from mere passion.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa spangs pa'o //
translated: For that very reason, he said, “having abandoned attachment to subject and object.”

original: de ltar rab tu dang ba'i gzhan dbang gis de la gus pas phyag 'tshol cig ste /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu dang ba'i gzhan dbang gis de la gus pas phyag 'tshol cig ste /
translated: Thus, with devotion to that through the power of faith, bow down to him.

original: sems kyi de kho na nyid dang ro gcig pa brten pa nyid ni phyag dam pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi de kho na nyid dang ro gcig pa brten pa nyid ni phyag dam pa'o //
translated: The homage is the very support of being of one taste with the reality of mind.

original: de sgrub pas kun du chags pa med pa las 'dzin pa la sogs pa la mngon par ma zhes par blang ngo zhes pa ma dan  blang ngo zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de sgrub pas kun du chags pa med pa las 'dzin pa la sogs pa la mngon par ma zhes par blang ngo zhes pa ma dan  blang ngo zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: By accomplishing that, one should take up the vow of non-attachment, etc., without attachment to grasping, etc.

original: de ltar dam tshig la sogs pa thams cad la brten pa la sogs pa ni spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar dam tshig la sogs pa thams cad la brten pa la sogs pa ni spyod pa ste /
translated: Thus, the support, etc., of all vows, etc., is the practice.

original: yang dag yongs su dag pa nyid kyis gtsang pa gtsang sbra'o //
analyzed: yang dag yongs su dag pa nyid kyis gtsang pa gtsang sbra'o //
translated: Pure, because of being pure and completely pure.

original: lhag par mos bzhin pa'i bshad pa'i de kho na nyid kyang dngos po thams cad rnam par dag par byed do //
analyzed: lhag par mos bzhin pa'i bshad pa'i de kho na nyid kyang dngos po thams cad rnam par dag par byed do //
translated: The reality of the explanation, which is to be believed, also purifies all things.

original: brjod bya ste ma dan  byin nas so //
analyzed: brjod bya ste ma dan  byin nas so //
translated: The thing to be expressed is the mantra.

original: de 'dir 'thung zhing bar skabs su bkra shis kyi glu blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de 'dir 'thung zhing bar skabs su bkra shis kyi glu blang bar bya'o //
translated: Having given that, one should drink it and in between one should sing the song of auspiciousness.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: @296b phyag 'tshal zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: @296b phyag 'tshal zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Homage to Vajrasattva, etc.

original: dngos po ni skye ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po ni skye ba ste /
translated: The thing is birth.

original: don dam par de las rnam par grol ba rdo rje sems dpa' la'o //
analyzed: don dam par de las rnam par grol ba rdo rje sems dpa' la'o //
translated: In reality, one is liberated from that, to Vajrasattva.

original: kun rdzob tu ni don du ma gnyer ba dang don du gnyer bas 'gro ba rnams su 'gro bar byed do zhes pa yan lag rnams te /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni don du ma gnyer ba dang don du gnyer bas 'gro ba rnams su 'gro bar byed do zhes pa yan lag rnams te /
translated: Conventionally, one goes to the worlds of those who do not strive for the goal and those who do strive for the goal.

original: sems can rnams so //
analyzed: sems can rnams so //
translated: The limbs are the sentient beings.

original: de'i don du legs par yongs su dag pa nyid kyis 'dis sems can gyi don 'byung bar byed do zhes pa gang gis yan lag ste bskyed pa yin pa'i don du ma gnyer mgon byas yan lag legs bskyed pa de la'o //
analyzed: de'i don du legs par yongs su dag pa nyid kyis 'dis sems can gyi don 'byung bar byed do zhes pa gang gis yan lag ste bskyed pa yin pa'i don du ma gnyer mgon byas yan lag legs bskyed pa de la'o //
translated: For that purpose, by means of the purity of the limbs, he will bring about the welfare of sentient beings.

original: shes rab dang thabs 'khyud pa'i sbyor ba sgyu ma ste rnam pa sna tshogs sprul pa'i ngo bos rnam par brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs 'khyud pa'i sbyor ba sgyu ma ste rnam pa sna tshogs sprul pa'i ngo bos rnam par brgyan pa'o //
translated: The union of wisdom and means is the illusion, which is adorned with the nature of the emanation of various forms.

original: h'um h'um h'um zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs ro gcig pa'o //
analyzed: h'um h'um h'um zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs ro gcig pa'o //
translated: Hum hum hum is the oneness of body, speech, and mind.

original: glu'i rjes thogs su dril bu dkrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: glu'i rjes thogs su dril bu dkrol bar bya'o //
translated: After the song, one should ring the bell.

original: de'i rjes su rdo rje thal mo snying gar bzung nas byed du gzhug ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su rdo rje thal mo snying gar bzung nas byed du gzhug ste /
translated: After that, one should have the disciple hold the vajra-palms at the heart and say:

original: sbyin bdag dang bdag nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: sbyin bdag dang bdag nyid kyang ngo //
translated: “The patron and I.”

original: 'jug bzhin pa la ste dbugs ma phyin pa dmyal ba la sogs pa la rjes su brtse bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jug bzhin pa la ste dbugs ma phyin pa dmyal ba la sogs pa la rjes su brtse bar bya'o //
translated: One should have compassion for those who are entering, who are not at peace, and for those in the hells and so forth.

original: rnal 'byor ni shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni shes rab dang thabs dbyer med pa nyid de /
translated: Yoga is the indivisibility of wisdom and means.

original: de kho na sgrib pa gnyis kyi dgra bo 'chos pa'i phyir dang sems can skyob pa'i phyir bstan bcos so //
analyzed: de kho na sgrib pa gnyis kyi dgra bo 'chos pa'i phyir dang sems can skyob pa'i phyir bstan bcos so //
translated: The treatise is taught for the sake of the enemy of the two obscurations, and for the sake of protecting sentient beings.

original: de'i bya ba thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: de'i bya ba thos pa dang bsam pa la sogs pa'o ;
translated: Its activity is hearing, reflection, and so on.🔽Arisen from that, having the cause of that, the subsequent compassion is like that.

original: / de las byung ba ste de'i rgyu can gyi rjes su brtse bar ji ltar 'gyur ba ltar ro zhes pa'i smon lam dam tshig can rnams dang lha rnams kyang gtor mas yang dag par tshim nas so //
analyzed: / de las byung ba ste de'i rgyu can gyi rjes su brtse bar ji ltar 'gyur ba ltar ro zhes pa'i smon lam dam tshig can rnams dang lha rnams kyang gtor mas yang dag par tshim nas so //
translated: Having satisfied the vow-holders and the gods with the bali,

original: smon lam gyi rjes thogs su de dag gshegs su gsol ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: smon lam gyi rjes thogs su de dag gshegs su gsol ba'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: after the aspiration, for the sake of requesting them to depart, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: vajra and so on.

original: g-yon pa ni lag par ro //
analyzed: g-yon pa ni lag par ro //
translated: The left is the hand.

original: sa gzhi la ni dkyil 'khor gyi'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi la ni dkyil 'khor gyi'o //
translated: The ground is the maṇḍala.

original: 'di ni 'dir cho ga'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir cho ga'i rim pa ste /
translated: This is the sequence of the rite here.

original: dang por ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i gzugs kyi mdun du gzhong pa la sogs pa'i snod chen po rnams su zan dang sran ma sha dang nya dang sha dang btsong dang sgog skya dang chang dang chu dang 'o ma la sogs pa dang / me tog la sogs pa rnams dang ldan pa bla re la sogs pas brgyan pa /
analyzed: dang por ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i gzugs kyi mdun du gzhong pa la sogs pa'i snod chen po rnams su zan dang sran ma sha dang nya dang sha dang btsong dang sgog skya dang chang dang chu dang 'o ma la sogs pa dang / me tog la sogs pa rnams dang ldan pa bla re la sogs pas brgyan pa /
translated: First, in front of the form of the dakini of Timeless Awareness, in a large vessel such as a basin, arrange food such as barley, beans, meat, fish, meat, onions, garlic, beer, water, milk, and so forth, as well as flowers and so forth, and adorn it with canopies and so forth.

original: rol mo la sogs pa mdun du byas pa'am /
analyzed: rol mo la sogs pa mdun du byas pa'am /
translated: In front of that, set out musical instruments and so forth,

original: zan dang chu la sogs pa tsam yang rung /
analyzed: zan dang chu la sogs pa tsam yang rung /
translated: or just food, water, and so forth.

original: ji ltar rnyed pa bzhag ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rnyed pa bzhag ste /
translated: Whatever you have found, set it out.

original: bza' ba dang btung ba dag sbyang bar @297a * //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba dag sbyang bar @297a * //
translated: Purify the food and drink.

original: bya'o ; / de la yam las skyes pa'i rlung gi steng du ram las skyes pa'i me la /
analyzed: bya'o ; / de la yam las skyes pa'i rlung gi steng du ram las skyes pa'i me la /
translated: On wind that arises from yāṃ, on fire that arises from raṃ,

original: a'a: yig las skyes pa'i chu skyes kyi snod dkar po yi ge gsum las skyes pa'i mgo bo gsum gyi thab la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: a'a: yig las skyes pa'i chu skyes kyi snod dkar po yi ge gsum las skyes pa'i mgo bo gsum gyi thab la gnas pa'o //
translated: in a white vessel of the lotus born from the syllable āḥ, in a hearth with three heads born from the three syllables,

original: der bza' ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: der bza' ba la sogs pa /
translated: place the food and so forth.

original: h'um bum aam hr'im kham /
analyzed: h'um bum aam hr'im kham /
translated: Hum, vase, aṃ, hrīḥ, khaṃ.

original: bhr'um h'um hr'i: tr'am yig las skyes shing de rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i bdud rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga'i ngo bor grub la /
analyzed: bhr'um h'um hr'i: tr'am yig las skyes shing de rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i bdud rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga'i ngo bor grub la /
translated: The five ambrosias and the five lamps are created from the syllables bhrūṃ, hūṃ, hriḥ, traṃ, and aṃ, and they are consecrated by those syllables.

original: ha ho hr'i: yig bsams pa rnams kyis rim pa ji lta bar tha mal pa'i kha dog dang dri dang nus pa phrogs shing /
analyzed: ha ho hr'i: yig bsams pa rnams kyis rim pa ji lta bar tha mal pa'i kha dog dang dri dang nus pa phrogs shing /
translated: The syllables ha, ho, and hriḥ, which are imagined, steal the ordinary color, smell, and potency, respectively.

original: rlung gis sbar ba'i me 'bar bas gdungs pas zhu ba'i yi ge la sogs pa shar ma thag pa'i nyi ma'i mdog can khu ba'i ngo bo lbu ba can te /
analyzed: rlung gis sbar ba'i me 'bar bas gdungs pas zhu ba'i yi ge la sogs pa shar ma thag pa'i nyi ma'i mdog can khu ba'i ngo bo lbu ba can te /
translated: The fire, which is ignited by the wind, burns the syllables that have melted by being heated. They are the nature of semen, which has the color of the newly risen sun and is foamy.

original: de'i rlangs pa yongs su gyur pa'i h'um yig las skyes pa'i rdo rje kha tv'am ga 'bar ba zhu nas der lan gsum du lhung bas bdud rtsi'i dngos por nye bar song shing /
analyzed: de'i rlangs pa yongs su gyur pa'i h'um yig las skyes pa'i rdo rje kha tv'am ga 'bar ba zhu nas der lan gsum du lhung bas bdud rtsi'i dngos por nye bar song shing /
translated: The vapor of that completely transforms into the syllable hūṃ, which gives rise to a blazing vajra-khaṭvāṅga. It melts and falls into the skull three times, becoming the nature of ambrosia.

original: shel gyi rnam pa shin tu gsal bzhin par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: shel gyi rnam pa shin tu gsal bzhin par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: It should be meditated on as being extremely clear, like a crystal.

original: de nas de nyid du 'gro ba la rnam par rgyu ba'i 'od zer gyis 'di'i gzugs sangs rgyas rnams la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de nyid du 'gro ba la rnam par rgyu ba'i 'od zer gyis 'di'i gzugs sangs rgyas rnams la bstan par bya'o //
translated: Then, with light rays moving in that very place, this form should be shown to the buddhas.🔽Then, above that, on a moon arisen from A, are the letters of the Alikāli mantra, which transform into A, Ali, Kali, and Hum, stacked one above the other.

original: de nas de'i steng du aom las skyes pa'i zla ba la gnas pa'i a'a li k'a li yongs su gyur pa'i aom a'a: h'um gi yi ge rim pas steng nas steng du gnas pa rnams las 'phros pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis phyogs bcur bzhugs pa'i rdo rje 'dzin🔽pa la sogs pa rnams bskul te /
analyzed: de nas de'i steng du aom las skyes pa'i zla ba la gnas pa'i a'a li k'a li yongs su gyur pa'i aom a'a: h'um gi yi ge rim pas steng nas steng du gnas pa rnams las 'phros pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis phyogs bcur bzhugs pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams bskul te /
translated: Light rays emanate from those letters and invoke Vajradhara and so forth from the ten directions.

original: de rnams las bdud rtsi dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa na gnas pa mtha' dag kyang mar me 'pho ba'i tshul gyis bkug nas de la gzhug par bya'o //🔽de nas yi ge gsum dang zla ba dag de nyid du thim par bltas shing /
analyzed: de rnams las bdud rtsi dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa na gnas pa mtha' dag kyang mar me 'pho ba'i tshul gyis bkug nas de la gzhug par bya'o // de nas yi ge gsum dang zla ba dag de nyid du thim par bltas shing /
translated: From them, all the nectar and so forth that exists in the oceans and so forth is summoned in the manner of a transference of light rays and is caused to enter.🔽Then, the three letters and the moon dissolve into that.

original: yi ge gsum gyis lan gsum du byin gyis brlab pa zhes pas bdud rtsi bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: yi ge gsum gyis lan gsum du byin gyis brlab pa zhes pas bdud rtsi bsgrubs nas /
translated: Looking at that, one should accomplish the nectar with the three letters and the triple blessing.

original: mdun du tsandan gyis byas pa'i chos 'byung gru gsum pa'i dbus su gur gum gyis mandala gru bzhi pa khru'i tshad byas te /
analyzed: mdun du tsandan gyis byas pa'i chos 'byung gru gsum pa'i dbus su gur gum gyis mandala gru bzhi pa khru'i tshad byas te /
translated: In front of oneself, in the center of a triangular source of phenomena made of sandalwood, one should make a square mandala with saffron, the size of a cubit.

original: de'i dbus su thig bzhi'i sbyor bas re mig dgu bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su thig bzhi'i sbyor bas re mig dgu bya'o //
translated: In its center, one should make nine squares by applying four lines.

original: der re mig dbus mar lha bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid can ye shes mkha' 'gro ma sngar ji lta bu dam tshig sems dpa'i ngo bo yud kyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: der re mig dbus mar lha bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid can ye shes mkha' 'gro ma sngar ji lta bu dam tshig sems dpa'i ngo bo yud kyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: There, in the center square, one should meditate in an instant on the thirteen-deity mandala of the awareness dakini, just as before, in the nature of the pledge beings.

original: shar la sogs pa'i re mig rnams su rang rang gi sa bon dang mtshan ma yongs su gyur pas dbang po la @297b sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i re mig rnams su rang rang gi sa bon dang mtshan ma yongs su gyur pas dbang po la @297b sogs pa rnams so //
translated: In the squares of the east, etc., are Indra, etc., formed from their seed syllables and emblems.

original: de la dbang po'i sa bon dzum ngo //
analyzed: de la dbang po'i sa bon dzum ngo //
translated: There, the seed syllable of Indra is jūṃ.

original: nye dbang gi h'um ngo //
analyzed: nye dbang gi h'um ngo //
translated: The seed syllable of Upendra is hūṃ.

original: lus ngan gyi bheem mo //
analyzed: lus ngan gyi bheem mo //
translated: The seed syllable of Kubera is bheṃ.

original: log 'dren gyi sho'o //🔽chu lha'i bam mo //
analyzed: log 'dren gyi sho'o // chu lha'i bam mo //
translated: The seed syllable of Rāhu is śo.🔽The seed syllable of Varuṇa is vaṃ.

original: gshin rje'i k'am ngo //
analyzed: gshin rje'i k'am ngo //
translated: The seed syllable of Yama is kṣaṃ.

original: dbang ldan gyi a'a:'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi a'a:'o //
translated: The seed syllable of Īśāna is āḥ.

original: me'i ram mo //🔽bden bral gyi yum ngo /
analyzed: me'i ram mo // bden bral gyi yum ngo /
translated: The seed syllable of Agni is raṃ.🔽The seed syllable of Nirṛti is yūṃ.

original: rlung lha'i yam ngo //
analyzed: rlung lha'i yam ngo //
translated: The seed syllable of Vāyu is yaṃ.

original: nyi ma'i a'a:'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i a'a:'o //
translated: The seed syllable of Sūrya is āḥ.

original: zla ba'i aam ngo //
analyzed: zla ba'i aam ngo //
translated: The syllable AṂ is the moon.

original: tshangs pa'i aom mo //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i aom mo //
translated: The syllable OṂ is Brahmā.

original: thags bzangs ris kyi beem mo //
analyzed: thags bzangs ris kyi beem mo //
translated: The syllable BEṂ is Vaisravaṇa.

original: sa'i lam ngo //
analyzed: sa'i lam ngo //
translated: The syllable LAṂ is the earth.

original: de nas rang gi snying ga'i 'od zer rnams kyis bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid can ye shes mkha' 'gro ma dang dbang po la sogs pa rnams dang sems can thams cad kyang bkug nas nam mkhar blta'o //
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying ga'i 'od zer rnams kyis bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid can ye shes mkha' 'gro ma dang dbang po la sogs pa rnams dang sems can thams cad kyang bkug nas nam mkhar blta'o //
translated: Then, having summoned all the sentient beings, the knowledge ḍākinīs, and Indra and so forth, who are the nature of the thirteen syllables, with the light rays from one’s heart, one should look into the sky.

original: de la / sa srung dkar po la zhon pa //
analyzed: de la / sa srung dkar po la zhon pa //
translated: There, the white Pṛthivī is mounted on an elephant.

original: rdo rje can ser mig stong pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje can ser mig stong pa'o //
translated: The vajra holder is yellow with a thousand eyes.

original: nag po 'khor lo dbyug to dung //
analyzed: nag po 'khor lo dbyug to dung //
translated: The black [Yama] holds a wheel, club, and conch.

original: koo stu bha 'dzin mkha' lding gnas //
analyzed: koo stu bha 'dzin mkha' lding gnas //
translated: Vaiśravaṇa holds a mongoose and is mounted on a garuḍa.

original: me lha dmar po smin ma dang // ral thod sma ra 'bar zhing 'khrug / tshon po rang gnas mi 'jigs dang // bgrang phreng ril ba dbyu gu 'dzin //
analyzed: me lha dmar po smin ma dang // ral thod sma ra 'bar zhing 'khrug / tshon po rang gnas mi 'jigs dang // bgrang phreng ril ba dbyu gu 'dzin //
translated: The red Agni has eyebrows, beard, and hair blazing and bristling, is corpulent, holds a boon-granting [hand], a lotus, a rosary, a water jar, and a staff.

original: dus nag ma he'i gdan can te //
analyzed: dus nag ma he'i gdan can te //
translated: Kālarātri is mounted on a buffalo.

original: g-yas brkyang zla bo'i rkang stabs can //
analyzed: g-yas brkyang zla bo'i rkang stabs can //
translated: She has a right leg extended and a left leg drawn up.

original: skra ni gyen du 'bar zhing khros //
analyzed: skra ni gyen du 'bar zhing khros //
translated: Her hair is bristling and blazing upward.

original: lag par dbyug pa sdigs mdzub 'dzin //
analyzed: lag par dbyug pa sdigs mdzub 'dzin //
translated: She holds a club and a threatening forefinger.

original: de 'dra'i bden bral ro la gnas //
analyzed: de 'dra'i bden bral ro la gnas //
translated: He is in such a way in the abode of the god of wealth.

original: gcer bu mi rus kyis brgyan pa //
analyzed: gcer bu mi rus kyis brgyan pa //
translated: He is naked, adorned with human bone ornaments,

original: zhal ni mche ba gtsigs pa can //
analyzed: zhal ni mche ba gtsigs pa can //
translated: his face is with bared fangs,

original: gri gug thod pa dag 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gri gug thod pa dag 'dzin pa'o //
translated: and he holds a flaying knife and skull cup.

original: chu srin lha ni chu lha dkar //
analyzed: chu srin lha ni chu lha dkar //
translated: The water-born god is white Varuṇa,

original: gdengs ka bdun can sprul zhags 'dzin //
analyzed: gdengs ka bdun can sprul zhags 'dzin //
translated: having seven hoods, holding a snake noose.

original: ae ne ya ser la gnas pa //
analyzed: ae ne ya ser la gnas pa //
translated: He is in the abode of the yellow Enayasa.

original: rlung lha ljang gu rlung ras can //
analyzed: rlung lha ljang gu rlung ras can //
translated: The wind god is green Pavana, holding a wind flag.

original: mi la gnod sbyin sbom po ser //
analyzed: mi la gnod sbyin sbom po ser //
translated: In the human abode is the fat yakṣa, yellow Kubera,

original: na ku la b'i dza p'u ra 'dzin //
analyzed: na ku la b'i dza p'u ra 'dzin //
translated: holding a mongoose and a water jar.

original: byi bar glang chen gdong can dkar //
analyzed: byi bar glang chen gdong can dkar //
translated: In the rat abode is the white elephant-faced Gaṇeśa,

original: la phug dbyug la du phreng 'dzin //
analyzed: la phug dbyug la du phreng 'dzin //
translated: holding a modaka and a club.

original: dbang ldan khyu mchog la zhon dkar //🔽ral pa'i thor tshugs rus rgyan 'dzin //
analyzed: dbang ldan khyu mchog la zhon dkar // ral pa'i thor tshugs rus rgyan 'dzin //
translated: In the northeast is the white bull-riding Śiva,🔽with matted hair and bone ornaments,

original: rtse gsum pas mtshan kha tv'am ga / cad te 'us brel ba'i phyag can no //
analyzed: rtse gsum pas mtshan kha tv'am ga / cad te 'us brel ba'i phyag can no //
translated: holding a trident and khaṭvāṅga.

original: rta yi shing rtar nyi ma dmar //
analyzed: rta yi shing rtar nyi ma dmar //
translated: In the chariot of the horse is the red sun,

original: bzod dka'i 'od can mtsho skyes 'dzin //
analyzed: bzod dka'i 'od can mtsho skyes 'dzin //
translated: having unbearable rays, holding a lotus.

original: de'i g-yon zla ba 'khor lor son //
analyzed: de'i g-yon zla ba 'khor lor son //
translated: To his left is the moon, mounted on a wheel,

original: 'od dkar ku mud bgrang phreng 'dzin //
analyzed: 'od dkar ku mud bgrang phreng 'dzin //
translated: white-rayed, holding a rosary.

original: dad par mes po ser padma //
analyzed: dad par mes po ser padma //
translated: Faith is yellow Grandfather Lotus.

original: mi 'jigs bgrang phreng dbyug pa can //
analyzed: mi 'jigs bgrang phreng dbyug pa can //
translated: Fearlessness is the rosary and club.

original: thags bzangs ris ni shing rtar gnas //
analyzed: thags bzangs ris ni shing rtar gnas //
translated: Excellent Thread is in a chariot.

original: nag por la gri ldan par 'gyur //🔽de g-yon sa @298a * //
analyzed: nag por la gri ldan par 'gyur // de g-yon sa @298a * //
translated: Black is the sword.

original: yi lha mo ser //
analyzed: yi lha mo ser //
translated: To his left is the earth goddess, yellow,

original: padma la gnas padma 'dzin //
analyzed: padma la gnas padma 'dzin //
translated: standing on a lotus, holding a lotus.

original: rin chen cod pan can lag pa //
analyzed: rin chen cod pan can lag pa //
translated: She has a jeweled crown and a hand.

original: sgeg ldan khyad par med gang kun //
analyzed: sgeg ldan khyad par med gang kun //
translated: All are charming and undifferentiated.

original: de nas mchod yon dang zhabs bsil la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bar rkang pa g-yon pas g-yas pa mnan te /
analyzed: de nas mchod yon dang zhabs bsil la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bar rkang pa g-yon pas g-yas pa mnan te /
translated: Then, after first offering the water for drinking and for the feet, and so on, press down the right knee with the left foot,

original: g-yon skor gyis gyen du blta bas /
analyzed: g-yon skor gyis gyen du blta bas /
translated: and with an upward gaze, turn to the left.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis phan tshun rgyab sbyar zhing /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis phan tshun rgyab sbyar zhing /
translated: With the two vajra fists crossed behind each other,

original: mthe chung gnyis sbrel la /
analyzed: mthe chung gnyis sbrel la /
translated: the two little fingers are joined.

original: sdigs mdzub gnyis bsgrengs nas /
analyzed: sdigs mdzub gnyis bsgrengs nas /
translated: The two threatening forefingers are extended,🔽and the right threatening forefinger is slightly bent, and the left threatening forefinger is placed behind it.🔽Having bound the summoning mudra to the crown,

original: sdigs mdzub g-yas pa cung zad bkug ste de'i rgyab tu sdigs mdzub g-yon pa gzhag go zhes pa spyan 'dren pa'i phyag rgya spyi bor bcings nas /
analyzed: sdigs mdzub g-yas pa cung zad bkug ste de'i rgyab tu sdigs mdzub g-yon pa gzhag go zhes pa spyan 'dren pa'i phyag rgya spyi bor bcings nas /
translated: recite:

original: phat ces pa brjid bag dang bcas pa lan gsum brjod do //🔽aom ku ru ku ru sa ma ya aa dhi pa ti h'um dza: sv'a h'a /
analyzed: phat ces pa brjid bag dang bcas pa lan gsum brjod do // aom ku ru ku ru sa ma ya aa dhi pa ti h'um dza: sv'a h'a /
translated: One should say phaṭ three times with dignity.

original: zhes pa'i sngags kyis ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i dkyil 'khor dang / aom ka kka zhes pa la sogs pas kyang 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa rnams bkug la /
analyzed: zhes pa'i sngags kyis ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i dkyil 'khor dang / aom ka kka zhes pa la sogs pas kyang 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa rnams bkug la /
translated: One should summon the maṇḍala of the wisdom ḍākinīs with the mantra oṃ kuru kuru samaya adhipati hūṃ jaḥ svaḥ, and also the world protectors and so forth with oṃ kakaca kakaca, and so forth.

original: rang rang gi dam tshig sems dpa' rnams la ro gcig tu gyur pas gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: rang rang gi dam tshig sems dpa' rnams la ro gcig tu gyur pas gzhug par bya'o //
translated: One should cause them to enter into the pledge beings, becoming of one taste with them.

original: de la re mig dbus mar bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi ye shes mkha' 'gro ma ji skad bshad pa'i gdan dang kha dog la sogs pa can no //
analyzed: de la re mig dbus mar bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi ye shes mkha' 'gro ma ji skad bshad pa'i gdan dang kha dog la sogs pa can no //
translated: In the center square, the wisdom ḍākinī, who is of the nature of thirteen [deities], has the previously explained seat, color, and so forth.

original: shar gyi re mig gi dbus su nag po /
analyzed: shar gyi re mig gi dbus su nag po /
translated: In the center of the eastern square, [there is] black.

original: drag po sdun  dang g-yon dang rgyab dang g-yas rnams su rim pa ji lta bar gtum mo dang 'jigs ma dang gzugs ma dang au ma'i lha mo dkar ba dang ser ba dang dmar ba dang nag po'i mdog can ma rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: drag po sdun  dang g-yon dang rgyab dang g-yas rnams su rim pa ji lta bar gtum mo dang 'jigs ma dang gzugs ma dang au ma'i lha mo dkar ba dang ser ba dang dmar ba dang nag po'i mdog can ma rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: In the north, east, south, west, northeast, southeast, southwest, and northwest, in order, are the goddesses Caṇḍī, Bhairavī, Rūpiṇī, and Umā, white, yellow, red, and black.

original: au ma'i g-yas su cung zad ring bar khyab 'jug go //
analyzed: au ma'i g-yas su cung zad ring bar khyab 'jug go //
translated: To the right of Umā, a little to the north, is Viṣṇu.

original: byang gi re mig tu drag po chen po ste de bzhin kho nar 'di'i 'khor rgyal ma dang rnam par rgyal ma dang mi thub ma dang gzhan gyis mi thub ma ser ba dang dmar ba dang nag pa dang dkar mo rnams so //
analyzed: byang gi re mig tu drag po chen po ste de bzhin kho nar 'di'i 'khor rgyal ma dang rnam par rgyal ma dang mi thub ma dang gzhan gyis mi thub ma ser ba dang dmar ba dang nag pa dang dkar mo rnams so //
translated: In the north, Mahācaṇḍa, and in the same way, his retinue of Jayā, Vijayā, Ajitā, and Aparājitā, yellow, red, black, and white.

original: gzhan gyis mi thub ma las g-yas su cung zad ring bar tshogs bdag go //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi thub ma las g-yas su cung zad ring bar tshogs bdag go //
translated: To the right of Aparājitā, a little to the north, is Gaṇeśa.

original: nub kyi re mig tu lhas byin te /
analyzed: nub kyi re mig tu lhas byin te /
translated: In the west, Devadatta,🔽and in the same way, his retinue of Śvetā, Raktatārā, and Tārā, white, red, and green.🔽To the right of Tārā, a little to the west, is Brahmā.

original: de bzhin du 'di'i nag mo bzang mo dang nag mo chen mo dang dus ma sbom mo dang dbang mo dmar ba dang nag pa dang dkar ba dang ser mo rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di'i nag mo bzang mo dang nag mo chen mo dang dus ma sbom mo dang dbang mo dmar ba dang nag pa dang dkar ba dang ser mo rnams so //
translated: Likewise, here, the black Bhadra, the great black, the fat time, the red power, the black, the white, and the yellow.

original: lho'i re mig tu nag po ste /
analyzed: lho'i re mig tu nag po ste /
translated: In the square of the south, black.

original: 'di'i zla @298b ba mo dang 'jigs ma dang gdug can ma dang 'phyad pa rnams nag mo dang dkar ba dang ser ba dang dmar ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'di'i zla @298b ba mo dang 'jigs ma dang gdug can ma dang 'phyad pa rnams nag mo dang dkar ba dang ser ba dang dmar ba rnams so //
translated: Here, the black, the white, the yellow, and the red of the moon, the fear, the poison, and the flirt.

original: dbang ldan gyi re mig tu thod pa can dkar ser te /
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi re mig tu thod pa can dkar ser te /
translated: In the square of Indra, the white skull.

original: 'di'i skabs gsum dbang phyug ma dang kam po dz'i dang mar me ma dang 'jib byed ma dkar ba dang ser ba dang dmar ba dang nag po rnams so //
analyzed: 'di'i skabs gsum dbang phyug ma dang kam po dz'i dang mar me ma dang 'jib byed ma dkar ba dang ser ba dang dmar ba dang nag po rnams so //
translated: Here, the white, the yellow, the red, and the black of the three times, the Kamajaya, the lamp, and the sucking.

original: me'i re mig tu mi gdug pa dmar po rjes su 'brel ba'i ser nag ste /
analyzed: me'i re mig tu mi gdug pa dmar po rjes su 'brel ba'i ser nag ste /
translated: In the square of Agni, the red non-poison, the yellow related.

original: 'di'i 'jigs gzugs ma dang gzugs chen ma dang mche ba gtsigs ma dang thod pa can ma rnams nag pa dang dkar ba dang ser ba dang dmar ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'di'i 'jigs gzugs ma dang gzugs chen ma dang mche ba gtsigs ma dang thod pa can ma rnams nag pa dang dkar ba dang ser ba dang dmar ba rnams so //
translated: Here, the black, the white, the yellow, and the red of the fearful form, the great form, the bared fangs, and the skull.

original: bden bral mtshams kyi re mig tu dga' ba las 'das pa nag cing dmar ba ste /
analyzed: bden bral mtshams kyi re mig tu dga' ba las 'das pa nag cing dmar ba ste /
translated: In the square of the southeast, the color of the one who is beyond joy is black and red.

original: 'di'i thod pa'i phreng ba ma dang 'phyang ba can ma dang lag pa kha tv'am ga can ma dang rdzu 'phrul chen mo rnams dmar ba dang nag pa dang dkar ba dang ser mo rnams so //
analyzed: 'di'i thod pa'i phreng ba ma dang 'phyang ba can ma dang lag pa kha tv'am ga can ma dang rdzu 'phrul chen mo rnams dmar ba dang nag pa dang dkar ba dang ser mo rnams so //
translated: Here, the garland of skulls, the pendant-legged one, the one with the skull-cup in her hand, and the one with great magical power are red, black, white, and yellow, respectively.

original: rlung gi phyogs kyi re mig tu log 'dren ljang gu'i kha dog rjes su 'brel ba'i dmar ser te /
analyzed: rlung gi phyogs kyi re mig tu log 'dren ljang gu'i kha dog rjes su 'brel ba'i dmar ser te /
translated: In the square of the northwest, the color of the one who is a false guide is green, and the color of the one who is related to him is orange.

original: 'di'i lag na ral gri ma dang lag na dgra stva ma dang lag na rdo rje ma dang / lag na gzhu can ma ser ba dang dmar ba dang nag pa dang dkar mo rnams so //
analyzed: 'di'i lag na ral gri ma dang lag na dgra stva ma dang lag na rdo rje ma dang / lag na gzhu can ma ser ba dang dmar ba dang nag pa dang dkar mo rnams so //
translated: Here, the one with the sword in her hand, the one with the khaṭvāṅga in her hand, the one with the vajra in her hand, and the one with the bow in her hand are yellow, red, black, and white, respectively.

original: 'di rnams dang steng du nyi ma dang zla ba dang mes po dang gza' dang rgyu skar la sogs pa rnams dang / 'og tu thags bzangs ris dang sa'i lha mo dang gdengs can dbang po la sogs pa rnams dang / phyi rol du kun nas bskor te sems can rnams thams cad do //
analyzed: 'di rnams dang steng du nyi ma dang zla ba dang mes po dang gza' dang rgyu skar la sogs pa rnams dang / 'og tu thags bzangs ris dang sa'i lha mo dang gdengs can dbang po la sogs pa rnams dang / phyi rol du kun nas bskor te sems can rnams thams cad do //
translated: and outside, all around, sentient beings.

original: 'dir gtum mo la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul chen mo'i bar rnams rnam par sgeg pa can lag na me tog la sogs pa nye bar spyod pa lnga can te /
analyzed: 'dir gtum mo la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul chen mo'i bar rnams rnam par sgeg pa can lag na me tog la sogs pa nye bar spyod pa lnga can te /
translated: Here, Caṇḍālī and so on up to Mahāpaṇḍarā have five offerings in their hands, such as flowers and so on.

original: lag na ral gri ma la sogs pa bzhi ni sgra ji lta ba'i phyag mtshan can rnams so //
analyzed: lag na ral gri ma la sogs pa bzhi ni sgra ji lta ba'i phyag mtshan can rnams so //
translated: The four with swords in their hands and so on have the implements as in the name.

original: thams cad kyang phyag gnyis 'khyud pa'i phyag rgya dang ldan ma /
analyzed: thams cad kyang phyag gnyis 'khyud pa'i phyag rgya dang ldan ma /
translated: All have two hands in the gesture of embracing.

original: phyag lhag mas gtso bo'i mtshan ma 'dzin ma rnams so //
analyzed: phyag lhag mas gtso bo'i mtshan ma 'dzin ma rnams so //
translated: The remaining hands hold the emblems of the principal.

original: drag mo nag po la sogs pa rnams ni /
analyzed: drag mo nag po la sogs pa rnams ni /
translated: Caṇḍālī and so on are black and so on.

original: phyag mtshan bzhi can de bzhin kho nar 'gyur //
analyzed: phyag mtshan bzhi can de bzhin kho nar 'gyur //
translated: They have four implements, just as before.

original: 'di rnams gcig tu ral gri yang na'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams gcig tu ral gri yang na'o //
translated: These are all in one place, and also the sword.

original: mtshan ma gnyis can rnams kyis padma 'dir //
analyzed: mtshan ma gnyis can rnams kyis padma 'dir //
translated: Those with two signs are in this lotus.

original: nor bu yang ni mtshan ma gcig can la'o //
analyzed: nor bu yang ni mtshan ma gcig can la'o //
translated: The jewel is also in one sign.🔽Indra, Naga, Vayu, Kubera,

original: dbang po klu rlung tshogs bdag dang // gnod sbyin zla ba mes po dang // sa yang zla bar @299a * //
analyzed: dbang po klu rlung tshogs bdag dang // gnod sbyin zla ba mes po dang // sa yang zla bar @299a * //
translated: Yaksha, Chandra, Prajapati, and also the earth,

original: shes bya ste //
analyzed: shes bya ste //
translated: are to be known as the moon.

original: lhag ma nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la'o //
analyzed: lhag ma nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la'o //
translated: The rest are in the mandala of the sun.

original: tshangs dang sa ni sku dbang rigs //
analyzed: tshangs dang sa ni sku dbang rigs //
translated: Brahma and the earth are in the family of Akshobhya.

original: rin chen rigs la nyi ma'o //
analyzed: rin chen rigs la nyi ma'o //
translated: The jewel is in the family of Ratnasambhava.

original: lus ngan dbang ldan klu rnams ni //🔽gsung rigs don yod rigs la rlung //
analyzed: lus ngan dbang ldan klu rnams ni // gsung rigs don yod rigs la rlung //
translated: Virupaksha, Ishana, and the Nagas🔽are in the family of Amitabha.

original: lhag ma mi bskyod rigs can rnams //
analyzed: lhag ma mi bskyod rigs can rnams //
translated: The rest are in the family of Amoghasiddhi.

original: dbang po la sogs pa 'di rnams kyang rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa 'di rnams kyang rang dang 'dra ba'i shes rab ma dang bcas pa ste /
translated: These Indra and so forth are also together with the wisdom lady of their own type.

original: sa ni rang 'dra'i thabs dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: sa ni rang 'dra'i thabs dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The earth is together with the method of its own type.

original: de nas mchod yon dang zhabs bsil la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bar yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: de nas mchod yon dang zhabs bsil la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bar yang dag par mchod de /
translated: Then, having first offered the water for drinking and for the feet, and so forth, make perfect offerings.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis rgyab sprad pa'i ming med gnyis lcags sgrog tu byas pa zhes pa'i phyag rgya bstan te /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis rgyab sprad pa'i ming med gnyis lcags sgrog tu byas pa zhes pa'i phyag rgya bstan te /
translated: The two vajra fists are joined back to back, and the two name fingers are made into an iron chain.🔽This is the mudra called “the two vajra fists joined back to back.”

original: lag pa g-yon pa'i mthil du zla ba la gnas shing h'um las skyes pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte bar bdud rtsi'i snod bzhag nas sam bsgoms nas /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa'i mthil du zla ba la gnas shing h'um las skyes pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i lte bar bdud rtsi'i snod bzhag nas sam bsgoms nas /
translated: The vessel of elixir is placed on the moon in the palm of the left hand, generated from hūṃ.

original: rdo rje khu tshur du byas pa'i lag pa g-yas pa'i khro bo brkyang bas de ston cing /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur du byas pa'i lag pa g-yas pa'i khro bo brkyang bas de ston cing /
translated: The right hand is in the threatening mudra of a vajra fist, and one displays that mudra.🔽The mantra for offering is oṃ kha kha khāhi khāhi sarva yakṣa rākṣasa bhūta preta piśāca unmāda apasmāra ḍāka ḍākinī apapāda upapāda gahvara gahvare svāhā.

original: aom bha ksha bha ksha sarba yo ge shva ri h'um h'um h'um dza: sv'a h'a zhes pa 'bul ba'i sngags kyis ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i dkyil 'khor h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rje dkar po rtse gcig pa'i ljags can de'i 'od zer gyi sbu gu rnams kyis sam
analyzed: aom bha ksha bha ksha sarba yo ge shva ri h'um h'um h'um dza: sv'a h'a zhes pa 'bul ba'i sngags kyis ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i dkyil 'khor h'um las skyes pa'i rdo rje dkar po rtse gcig pa'i ljags can de'i 'od zer gyi sbu gu rnams kyis sam
translated: The maṇḍala of the awareness dakini is generated from hūṃ as a white one-tined vajra with a tongue.

original: yid kyis bdud rtsi 'dren pa la brtson pa la /
analyzed: yid kyis bdud rtsi 'dren pa la brtson pa la /
translated: One is diligent in drawing up the elixir with the light rays of that vajra or with the mind.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub sems su lhag par mos pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas tshim par byas shing /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub sems su lhag par mos pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas tshim par byas shing /
translated: One should imagine that the deities are satisfied by the complete purity of the three spheres.

original: bdud rtsi lhag ma rnams kyis /
analyzed: bdud rtsi lhag ma rnams kyis /
translated: With the remaining nectar,

original: aom ti shtha bha ksha bha ksha dza: sv'a h'a zhes pa 'dis 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa rnams de ltar tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: aom ti shtha bha ksha bha ksha dza: sv'a h'a zhes pa 'dis 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa rnams de ltar tshim par bya'o //
translated: one should satisfy the world protectors and so forth with this mantra: oṃ tiṣṭha bhakṣa bhakṣa jaḥ svāhā.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po la sogs pa rnams bdud rtsi gsol ba las bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang ro gcig par ji srid 'dod par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po la sogs pa rnams bdud rtsi gsol ba las bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang ro gcig par ji srid 'dod par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, one should imagine that the lord of the maṇḍala and so forth partake of the nectar, becoming of the nature of great bliss, of one taste with emptiness, for as long as one wishes.

original: zhal bsil dang phyag phye ba dang so rtsi la sogs pa phul te mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhal bsil dang phyag phye ba dang so rtsi la sogs pa phul te mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should offer mouth washing, hand washing, tooth cleaners, and so forth, and make offerings.

original: de nas rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin ye shes mkha' 'gro ma mnyes pa'i don du dang / chad pa dang lhag pa'i skyon zhi ba'i ched du dang bya ba thams cad 'grub pa'i don du /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin ye shes mkha' 'gro ma mnyes pa'i don du dang / chad pa dang lhag pa'i skyon zhi ba'i ched du dang bya ba thams cad 'grub pa'i don du /
translated: Then, for the purpose of pleasing the wisdom ḍākinī, who is of the nature of Vajradhara, and for the purpose of pacifying the faults of omissions and additions, and for the purpose of accomplishing all activities, one should recite the one-hundred-syllable mantra.

original: aom badzra sa tva sa ma ya /🔽ma nu p'a la ya /🔽badzra sa tva tve no pa ti shtha dri dho me bha ba /🔽su to shyo me bha ba /
analyzed: aom badzra sa tva sa ma ya / ma nu p'a la ya / badzra sa tva tve no pa ti shtha dri dho me bha ba / su to shyo me bha ba /
translated: Oṃ, vajra sattva samayam anupālaya,

original: su po shyo me bha ba /
analyzed: su po shyo me bha ba /
translated: vajra sattva tvenopatiṣṭha, dṛḍho me bhava, sutoṣyo me bhava,

original: aa nu ra kto me bha ba /🔽sarba siddhi mme pra ya tstsha /
analyzed: aa nu ra kto me bha ba / sarba siddhi mme pra ya tstsha /
translated: supoṣyo me bhava, anurakto me bhava,

original: @299b sarba karma su tsa me tsi ttam shre ya: ku ru h'um /
analyzed: @299b sarba karma su tsa me tsi ttam shre ya: ku ru h'um /
translated: sarva siddhiṃ me prayaccha, sarva karma suca me cittaṃ śreyaḥ kuru hūṃ,🔽ha ha ha ha hoḥ, bhagavan, vajra sattva māṃ,

original: ha ha ha ha ho: bha ga w'a na badzra sa tva ma me mu nytsa badzri sa tva bha wa ma h'a sa ma ya sa tva a'a: h'um phat ces pa yi ge brgya pa dril bu dkrol ba sngon ma bklag par bya'o //
analyzed: ha ha ha ha ho: bha ga w'a na badzra sa tva ma me mu nytsa badzri sa tva bha wa ma h'a sa ma ya sa tva a'a: h'um phat ces pa yi ge brgya pa dril bu dkrol ba sngon ma bklag par bya'o //
translated: evaṃ muṃca vajrī bhava, mahā samayasattva āḥ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: de'i rjes su padma bskor ba'i phyag rgya mnyes par byas nas phyag rgya nye bar sdud pa na 'khyud pa'i tshul byas te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su padma bskor ba'i phyag rgya mnyes par byas nas phyag rgya nye bar sdud pa na 'khyud pa'i tshul byas te /
translated: Then, having pleased him with the lotus-turning gesture, when gathering in the consort, one should make the gesture of embracing.

original: snying gar g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gzhag cing /🔽lag pa g-yas brkyang nas re mig gi sa la gzhag ste /
analyzed: snying gar g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gzhag cing / lag pa g-yas brkyang nas re mig gi sa la gzhag ste /
translated: Placing the left vajra fist at the heart,

original: zhabs la 'jug par mos pas /
analyzed: zhabs la 'jug par mos pas /
translated: and extending the right hand, one should place it on the square and imagine entering the feet.

original: bya ba bsgrub pa lhur len pa'i ye shes mkha' 'gro ma 'khor dang bcas pa /
analyzed: bya ba bsgrub pa lhur len pa'i ye shes mkha' 'gro ma 'khor dang bcas pa /
translated: The wisdom dakini and her retinue are intent on accomplishing activities.

original: aom a'atma ti shtha h'um sv'a h'a zhes brjod cing re mig nas bzhengs su gsol lo //
analyzed: aom a'atma ti shtha h'um sv'a h'a zhes brjod cing re mig nas bzhengs su gsol lo //
translated: Reciting Om atma tistha hum svaha, one should invite them from the mandala.

original: de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i dbugs kyis bcug ste rang gi lus dang lhan cig ro gcig tu byas nas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i dbugs kyis bcug ste rang gi lus dang lhan cig ro gcig tu byas nas mchod par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should make offerings, having caused them to enter by the breath of engagement, and having made them one taste with one's own body.

original: de'i rjes su 'khyud pa'i phyag rgyas se gol gsum bya zhing aom sarba du shta gri hna gri hna ga tstsha h'um phat ces brjod cing 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa bsgrub pa la gzhol ba rnams gnas ji lta bar gshegs su gsol
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'khyud pa'i phyag rgyas se gol gsum bya zhing aom sarba du shta gri hna gri hna ga tstsha h'um phat ces brjod cing 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa bsgrub pa la gzhol ba rnams gnas ji lta bar gshegs su gsol
translated: After that, with the mudra of embrace, one should snap one's fingers three times, and recite Om sarva dushtan graham graham ghataya hum phat, and request the guardians of the world and so forth, who are intent on accomplishing what is desired, to depart to their own places.

original: lo zhes pa ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i rnal 'byor gyis gtor ma'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: lo zhes pa ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i rnal 'byor gyis gtor ma'i cho ga'o //
translated: Thus, this is the ritual of the bali offering by the yoga of the wisdom dakini.

original: 'dir yang thog mar rdo rje sems dpa'i ting 'dzin can //
analyzed: 'dir yang thog mar rdo rje sems dpa'i ting 'dzin can //
translated: Here, too, it is said, First, one should be absorbed in the samadhi of Vajrasattva,

original: yang na he ru ka la brtson //
analyzed: yang na he ru ka la brtson //
translated: or else, one should be intent on Heruka.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de na gang gi tshe rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor gyis gtor ma sbyin par brtson pa de'i tshe ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i gnas su rdo rje sems dpa' bsgom par bya zhing /
analyzed: de na gang gi tshe rdo rje sems dpa'i rnal 'byor gyis gtor ma sbyin par brtson pa de'i tshe ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i gnas su rdo rje sems dpa' bsgom par bya zhing /
translated: When one is eager to give the sacrificial cake by means of the yoga of Vajrasattva, then one should meditate on Vajrasattva in the place of the Knowledge dakini.

original: dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi ru rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor ba'i lha rnams so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi ru rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor ba'i lha rnams so //
translated: The mandala of the deities of the mandala of Vajrasattva is the mandala of the deities of the mandala of Vajrasattva.

original: 'di'i spyan 'dren pa'i phyag rgya ni 'bar ba'i phyag rgya ste de kho na spyan drang ba'i don du bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i spyan 'dren pa'i phyag rgya ni 'bar ba'i phyag rgya ste de kho na spyan drang ba'i don du bcing bar bya'o //
translated: The mudra of invocation for this is the blazing mudra, which should be bound for the purpose of invocation.

original: aom bha ksha bha ksha zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags ni 'di'i ma yin gyi /
analyzed: aom bha ksha bha ksha zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags ni 'di'i ma yin gyi /
translated: The mantra of “Oṃ bha kṣha bha kṣha” and so forth is not for this,

original: 'di'i dbul ba'i sngags ni /
analyzed: 'di'i dbul ba'i sngags ni /
translated: but the mantra for the offering is🔽“Oṃ vajra ḍāka, accept my bali, gṛhaṇa gṛhaṇa, hūṃ phaṭ. Oṃ jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ, be present, be present, samaya stvaṃ, be seen, hoḥ.”

original: aom badzra d'a ka ai mam ba lim gri hna gri hna h'um phat aom dza: h'um bam ho: sa ma ya stvam dri shya ho: zhes pa 'di lan gcig brjod pas bcom ldan 'das la'o //
analyzed: aom badzra d'a ka ai mam ba lim gri hna gri hna h'um phat aom dza: h'um bam ho: sa ma ya stvam dri shya ho: zhes pa 'di lan gcig brjod pas bcom ldan 'das la'o //
translated: One should recite this once for the Blessed One.

original: lan gcig gis de'i shes rab ma la'o //
analyzed: lan gcig gis de'i shes rab ma la'o //
translated: One should recite it once for his wisdom consort.

original: lan gcig gis rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams la 'bul lo //🔽lan gcig gis ni rdo rje drag mo la sogs @300a * //
analyzed: lan gcig gis rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams la 'bul lo // lan gcig gis ni rdo rje drag mo la sogs @300a * //
translated: Once, to Vairocana and so forth.🔽Once, to Vajraraudri and so forth.

original: pa rnams la dang / lan gcig gis ni me tog ma la sogs pa rnams la dbul lo //
analyzed: pa rnams la dang / lan gcig gis ni me tog ma la sogs pa rnams la dbul lo //
translated: And once, to Pushpa and so forth.

original: de las gzhan rnams la /
analyzed: de las gzhan rnams la /
translated: For the others,

original: aom kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi sarba ya ksha r'a ksha sa bh'u ta pi sh'a tsa au nm'a da aa pa sma ra d'a ki n+y'a da ya /
analyzed: aom kha kha kh'a hi kh'a hi sarba ya ksha r'a ksha sa bh'u ta pi sh'a tsa au nm'a da aa pa sma ra d'a ki n+y'a da ya /
translated: Oṃ kha kha khāhi khāhi, all yakshas, rākshasas, bhūtas, piśācas, unmadas, apasmāras, and ḍākinīs,

original: ai mam ba lim gri hna ntu sa ma yam ra ksha ntu sarba siddhi mme pra ya tstsha ntu h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ai mam ba lim gri hna ntu sa ma yam ra ksha ntu sarba siddhi mme pra ya tstsha ntu h'um h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: accept this bali offering, protect the samaya, accomplish all for me, hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes pa khyad par te /
analyzed: zhes pa khyad par te /
translated: This is the special [mantra].

original: gzhan thams cad sngar bzhin no zhes pa rdo rje sems dpa'i gtor ma'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: gzhan thams cad sngar bzhin no zhes pa rdo rje sems dpa'i gtor ma'i cho ga'o //
translated: All else is as before. This is the bali offering ritual of Vajrasattva.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das 'di rig pa'i rgyal po'i gzugs yin pa de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das dang de'i shes rab dang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams dang ; khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams la ji ltar rigs par phyogs rnams su g-yon skor dang phyogs bral rnams su me'i zur nas brtsams te g-yas skor gyis gtor ma bskor bar bya zhing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das 'di rig pa'i rgyal po'i gzugs yin pa de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das dang de'i shes rab dang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams dang ; khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams la ji ltar rigs par phyogs rnams su g-yon skor dang phyogs bral rnams su me'i zur nas brtsams te g-yas skor gyis gtor ma bskor bar bya zhing /
translated: When this Blessed One is in the form of the king of knowledge, then the Blessed One, his wisdom, the dakinis, etc., and the Khakhasarha, etc., should be offered the sacrificial cake in the directions as appropriate, in a counterclockwise direction, and in the intermediate directions, beginning from the southeast, in a clockwise direction.

original: aom badzra d'a ka zhes pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: aom badzra d'a ka zhes pa la sogs pa /
translated: With Om Vajradaka, etc.,

original: gcig dang gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi dang lnga'i lan brjod pas phul nas 'khor lo gsum gyi lha la /
analyzed: gcig dang gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi dang lnga'i lan brjod pas phul nas 'khor lo gsum gyi lha la /
translated: having offered with the repetition of one, two, three, four, and five times, to the gods of the three wheels,

original: aom ka ra zhes pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: aom ka ra zhes pa la sogs pa /
translated: with Om Kara, etc.,

original: h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa'i mtha' lan gcig brjod pa dbul bar bya'o zhes pa khyad par te /
analyzed: h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a zhes pa'i mtha' lan gcig brjod pa dbul bar bya'o zhes pa khyad par te /
translated: one should make the offering with the end of Hum Hum Phat Svaha, this is the difference.🔽 The rest is like the Vajrasattva sacrificial cake rite.

original: gzhan rdo rje sems dpa'i gtor ma'i cho ga bzhin no zhes pa rig pa'i rgyal po'i gtor ma'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: gzhan rdo rje sems dpa'i gtor ma'i cho ga bzhin no zhes pa rig pa'i rgyal po'i gtor ma'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the sacrificial cake rite of the king of knowledge.

original: gang gi tshe dpal he ru ka'i gzugs kyis gtor ma sbyin par brtson pa de'i tshe yang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dpal he ru ka'i gzugs kyis gtor ma sbyin par brtson pa de'i tshe yang /
translated: When one is eager to give the sacrificial cake in the form of glorious Heruka, then also,

original: ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i gnas su he ru ka bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i gnas su he ru ka bsam par bya ste /
translated: one should think of Heruka in the place of the Knowledge dakinis.

original: dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi sa ru de'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi sa ru de'i dkyil 'khor pa rnams so //
translated: In the place of the mandala deities, there are the deities of his mandala.

original: aom bha ksha zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags ni 'di ma yin gyi /
analyzed: aom bha ksha zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags ni 'di ma yin gyi /
translated: The mantra beginning with “Oṃ bhaṃ” is not this one.

original: 'di'i gtor ma 'bul ba'i sngags ni /
analyzed: 'di'i gtor ma 'bul ba'i sngags ni /
translated: The mantra for offering the sacrificial cake of this one is

original: phyag bcu drug pa nyid dam phyag drug pa nyid dam phyag bzhi pa nyid dam phyag gnyis pa nyid las so sor rang gi snying po'i sngags so //
analyzed: phyag bcu drug pa nyid dam phyag drug pa nyid dam phyag bzhi pa nyid dam phyag gnyis pa nyid las so sor rang gi snying po'i sngags so //
translated: either the essence mantra of the sixteen-armed one, the six-armed one, the four-armed one, or the two-armed one.

original: 'dis bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab dang bcas pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dis bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab dang bcas pa la'o //
translated: This is for the Blessed Lady with Wisdom.

original: aom badzra gu hye zhes pa la sogs pa rang rang gi sngags sngar gsungs pa rnams kyis goo r'i la sogs pa lha mo bcu drug po rnams la dbul bar bya'o zhes pa khyad par te /
analyzed: aom badzra gu hye zhes pa la sogs pa rang rang gi sngags sngar gsungs pa rnams kyis goo r'i la sogs pa lha mo bcu drug po rnams la dbul bar bya'o zhes pa khyad par te /
translated: The mantra beginning with “Oṃ vajra guhye” and so on, the previously mentioned individual mantras, should be offered to the sixteen goddesses beginning with Gaurī. This is the distinction.

original: gzhan thams cad ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i gtor ma'i cho ga bzhin no zhes pa kye rdo rje bzhi'i gtor ma'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: gzhan thams cad ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i gtor ma'i cho ga bzhin no zhes pa kye rdo rje bzhi'i gtor ma'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the bali rite of the four Hevajras.

original: 'di thams cad kyang rgyas pa dang @300b bcas pa'i gtor ma'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyang rgyas pa dang @300b bcas pa'i gtor ma'i cho ga'o //
translated: All of this is the rite of the bali of the extensive and concise [versions of the tantra].

original: re mig rnams su yongs su bskor ba dang bcas pa'i dam tshig sems dpa' sgom pa med pa kho nar ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pas gzhan thams cad rjes su bsgrub pa la cho ga 'bring po'o //
analyzed: re mig rnams su yongs su bskor ba dang bcas pa'i dam tshig sems dpa' sgom pa med pa kho nar ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pas gzhan thams cad rjes su bsgrub pa la cho ga 'bring po'o //
translated: The medium rite is the performance of all else by the mere entry of the Knowledge Beings, without the meditation on the pledge beings, in the squares, together with the complete circumambulation.

original: brgya byin la sogs pa thams cad rang gi lha'i gzugs su lhag par mos nas gnas ji lta bar gnas pa 'di rnams la rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i gtor ma sngon ma can gtor ma sbyin par bya'o zhes pa mdor bsdus pa'i cho ga ste /
analyzed: brgya byin la sogs pa thams cad rang gi lha'i gzugs su lhag par mos nas gnas ji lta bar gnas pa 'di rnams la rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i gtor ma sngon ma can gtor ma sbyin par bya'o zhes pa mdor bsdus pa'i cho ga ste /
translated: The concise rite is the giving of the bali to all, Indra and so forth, who are imagined in the form of one's deity, abiding in their respective places, with the bali preceded by the offering to one's chosen deity.

original: de'i tshe ni gru gsum pa la sogs pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni gru gsum pa la sogs pa ma yin zhing /
translated: At that time, it is not the triangular [bali], and so forth.

original: dam tshig sems dpa' dang ye shes sems dpa'i dgug pa la sogs pa bsgom pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa' dang ye shes sems dpa'i dgug pa la sogs pa bsgom pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not the meditation on the invocation of the pledge-being and the wisdom-being, etc.

original: gshegs su gsol ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gshegs su gsol ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the dismissal.

original: de ltar bskyed pa'i rim pa'i gtor ma'i cho ga rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar bskyed pa'i rim pa'i gtor ma'i cho ga rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Thus, there are three kinds of bali rites in the creation stage.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la ni shes rab dang thabs las ma g-yos pa'i sems kyis /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la ni shes rab dang thabs las ma g-yos pa'i sems kyis /
translated: In the completion stage, with a mind that does not stray from wisdom and means,

original: bsams pa tsam gyis spyan drangs pa'i shes rab dang thabs kyi ngo bo kho na'i rang gi 'dod pa'i lha dang bcas pa'i dbang po la sogs pa rnams la ye shes kyi ro las tha mi dad pa'i gtor ma 'bul ba ni gtor ma'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: bsams pa tsam gyis spyan drangs pa'i shes rab dang thabs kyi ngo bo kho na'i rang gi 'dod pa'i lha dang bcas pa'i dbang po la sogs pa rnams la ye shes kyi ro las tha mi dad pa'i gtor ma 'bul ba ni gtor ma'i cho ga'o //
translated: one offers the bali that is not different from the taste of gnosis to one's chosen deity and the sense-spheres, etc., which are the essence of wisdom and means, invoked merely by the imagination. This is the bali rite.

original: cho ga 'di rnams la yang zhi ba la sogs pa gtso bo'i bya ba'i dbye ba las dus dang phyogs dang kha dog gi dbye ba rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga 'di rnams la yang zhi ba la sogs pa gtso bo'i bya ba'i dbye ba las dus dang phyogs dang kha dog gi dbye ba rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In these rites, one should understand the distinctions of time, direction, and color from the primary actions of pacifying, etc.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa la sogs pa'i shar la sogs pa phyogs dang phyogs bral rnams su kham phor la sogs par brgyad rnams sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa la sogs pa'i shar la sogs pa phyogs dang phyogs bral rnams su kham phor la sogs par brgyad rnams sbyin par bya'o //
translated: In the east and other directions and intermediate directions of the mandala house, etc., one should offer eight in bowls, etc.

original: dbang ldan dang dbang po dag gi bar du nyi ma la sogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan dang dbang po dag gi bar du nyi ma la sogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: In the northeast, etc., one should offer to the sun, etc.

original: chu lha dang bden bral dag gi bar du thags bzangs ris dang sa'i lha mo dag la'o //
analyzed: chu lha dang bden bral dag gi bar du thags bzangs ris dang sa'i lha mo dag la'o //
translated: In the southeast and southwest, one should offer to Vemacitrin and the earth goddess.

original: ji ltar rigs par 'dod pa'i lha rnams la ba dan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par 'dod pa'i lha rnams la ba dan la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the northwest, one should offer to the gods of the desire realm, such as Dhṛtarāṣṭra, etc., banners, etc., as is appropriate.

original: dbang po la sogs pa rnams la ni rang rang gi phyogs su rang rang gi mdog can gyi ba dan bco lnga rnams te /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa rnams la ni rang rang gi phyogs su rang rang gi mdog can gyi ba dan bco lnga rnams te /
translated: In the directions of Indra, etc., one should offer fifteen banners of their respective colors.

original: gzhan yang phyi rol du kun nas phyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol du kun nas phyar bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, they should be waved around outside.

original: gzhan gyi don du gtor ma sbyin pa na yang sngags pa ji ltar yod pa'i /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du gtor ma sbyin pa na yang sngags pa ji ltar yod pa'i /
translated: Also, when giving sacrificial offerings for the sake of others, the mantra practitioner should do it as he is.

original: me'am ma ma zhes pa ni ji ltar gnas pa kho na ltar bklag par bya ste /
analyzed: me'am ma ma zhes pa ni ji ltar gnas pa kho na ltar bklag par bya ste /
translated: The words fire and mother should be read just as they are.

original: de yang bdag nyid du mos par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bdag nyid du mos par bya'o //
translated: And one should imagine oneself as that.

original: 'di la phan btags pa na bdag la phan btags @301a * //
analyzed: 'di la phan btags pa na bdag la phan btags @301a * //
translated: When this is helped, it is helpful to me.

original: par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bsams pa las de'i bya ba 'grub bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i bsams pa las de'i bya ba 'grub bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From this thought, his action is accomplished.

original: mthar yang de'i don zhu bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mthar yang de'i don zhu bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: In the end, one should request his purpose.

original: gtor ma ni nye bar bsgrub pa ste 'dis gsal bar bya'o zhes pa gtor ma nye bar bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gtor ma ni nye bar bsgrub pa ste 'dis gsal bar bya'o zhes pa gtor ma nye bar bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The bali is the near accomplishment. By this, it is clarified. This is the near accomplishment of the bali.

original: dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The glorious Heruka Tantra's commentary

original: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma sum bcu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma sum bcu bzhi pa'o /
translated: is the thirty-fourth flower in the garland of instructions.

original: // / dngos grub kyi thabs kyi yan lag brjod pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / dngos grub kyi thabs kyi yan lag brjod pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: In order to state the branches of the means of attainment, it is said:

original: gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Secret and so forth.

original: gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pas rdo rje dang padma sbyor ba la sogs pa yang bris sku dang pu sti 'bri ba'i tshogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pas rdo rje dang padma sbyor ba la sogs pa yang bris sku dang pu sti 'bri ba'i tshogs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Secret and so forth teach that the union of the vajra and lotus and so forth are also included in the assembly of painted images and books.

original: sbas pa dam pa'i dgongs pa ste mngon par dgongs pa dam pa'i spyod yul gang du yin pa de gsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: sbas pa dam pa'i dgongs pa ste mngon par dgongs pa dam pa'i spyod yul gang du yin pa de gsal bar mdzad do //
translated: The hidden, ultimate intention is that which illuminates the domain of the ultimate, sublime intention.

original: lha rnams su ni lha rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: lha rnams su ni lha rnams kyi'o //
translated: The gods are the gods.

original: rnam rtog med pa ni dam tshig brtan pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa ni dam tshig brtan pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The non-conceptual is for those of firm commitment, etc.

original: yang na zhes pa gsungs pa'i yon tan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na zhes pa gsungs pa'i yon tan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it is said because of the absence of the qualities of speech.

original: dpa' bo zhes pa skyes bu dpa' bo shi ba'i'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo zhes pa skyes bu dpa' bo shi ba'i'o //
translated: The hero is the dead hero.

original: khrag chen po ni mi'i khrag go //
analyzed: khrag chen po ni mi'i khrag go //
translated: The great blood is human blood.

original: mi can ni mi'i thod pa'o //
analyzed: mi can ni mi'i thod pa'o //
translated: The human is the human skull.

original: ji skad bshad pa rnams kyis ni gnas dang gnas rnams su de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid du gsungs pa rnams kyis te rdul dang khu ba la sogs pa bdud rtsi lngas bgos pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa rnams kyis ni gnas dang gnas rnams su de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid du gsungs pa rnams kyis te rdul dang khu ba la sogs pa bdud rtsi lngas bgos pa rnams kyis so //
translated: By those explained, in the places and locations, as the nature of the five transcendent ones, the five nectars of semen, ovum, etc., are distributed.

original: dang por ni mchod yon sbyin pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: dang por ni mchod yon sbyin pa'i dus su'o //
translated: First, at the time of offering the libation.

original: dpal yang dag par sbyor ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: dpal yang dag par sbyor ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The glorious perfect union is Vajrasattva.

original: gyur pa rnams ni kha dog lnga rnams so //
analyzed: gyur pa rnams ni kha dog lnga rnams so //
translated: The transformations are the five colors.

original: pho nya mo ni rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'o //
analyzed: pho nya mo ni rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'o //
translated: The messenger is Vajrayoginī.

original: zla ba ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: zla ba ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The moon is the bodhicitta.

original: gcig tu ste gnas su rnal 'byor ma rnams dang lhan cig go //
analyzed: gcig tu ste gnas su rnal 'byor ma rnams dang lhan cig go //
translated: Together, in the place, with the yoginīs.

original: de la pho nya mo'i gtsang sbra ni bcom ldan 'das ma'i gzugs su bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: de la pho nya mo'i gtsang sbra ni bcom ldan 'das ma'i gzugs su bsgoms pas so //
translated: There, the messenger’s purity is by meditating on the form of the Blessed Lady.

original: zla pa ni gtum mo la sogs pa bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: zla pa ni gtum mo la sogs pa bsgoms pas so //
translated: The moon is by meditating on caṇḍālī and so forth.

original: mdzes pa'i ston mo ni bdud rtsi myong ba'i cho ga bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: mdzes pa'i ston mo ni bdud rtsi myong ba'i cho ga bsgoms pas so //
translated: The beautiful feast is by meditating on the rite of tasting the elixir.

original: 'di kho na'i gtsang sbra ni phyi rol gyi shes rab ma'i khu ba ts'a ru yang dag par spyod pa las kyang kun nas spyad do //
analyzed: 'di kho na'i gtsang sbra ni phyi rol gyi shes rab ma'i khu ba ts'a ru yang dag par spyod pa las kyang kun nas spyad do //
translated: This purity is also practiced by the conduct of the true hero, the fluid of the external wisdom consort.

original: des ni yid dag pas rnam pa 'di lta bu kho na'i dag byed rjes su 'brel bar bya'i /
analyzed: des ni yid dag pas rnam pa 'di lta bu kho na'i dag byed rjes su 'brel bar bya'i /
translated: By that, with a pure mind, one should only follow the purification of this kind.

original: khrus dang @301b kha shol ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khrus dang @301b kha shol ba la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not by bathing, by washing the body, and so forth.

original: de'i rang gi sems 'dod chags la sogs pas dri ma can du gyur pas 'bras bu med pa ni dag byed ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rang gi sems 'dod chags la sogs pas dri ma can du gyur pas 'bras bu med pa ni dag byed ma yin no //
translated: One’s own mind, which has become stained by desire and so forth, is not purified by that, which is fruitless.

original: slar zhing mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar zhing mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa /
translated: And again, the result will be undesirable.

original: mi mthun chos kyi zhes pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rnal 'byor las phyin ci log nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mi mthun chos kyi zhes pa rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rnal 'byor las phyin ci log nyid kyis so //
translated: The unfavorable factor is the opposite of the yoga of the vajra-holder.

original: 'dod pa mi 'grub pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: 'dod pa mi 'grub pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is the desired result not accomplished,

original: phyin ci log las nyes pa byas pas ngan 'gror 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyin ci log las nyes pa byas pas ngan 'gror 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa /
translated: but also, from the error, there is a bad rebirth,

original: khyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: as is said with dog, etc.

original: 'bras bu med pa nyid rgyas par ston pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa nyid rgyas par ston pa /
translated: The absence of result is taught in detail:

original: dper na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, etc.

original: dpe can brjod pa gsungs pa gzhan gyi zhes pa blta ba gzhan brjod pa seng ge dang 'phrog byed la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: dpe can brjod pa gsungs pa gzhan gyi zhes pa blta ba gzhan brjod pa seng ge dang 'phrog byed la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: The example is stated: Another, etc. The expression another refers to the lion, Rāhu, etc.

original: don med ni de kho na nyid ma mthong bas dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i cha shas kyang ma nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med ni de kho na nyid ma mthong bas dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i cha shas kyang ma nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is that there is no result, because reality is not seen and because the part of passion, etc. is not destroyed.

original: 'dzin pa nges par 'dzin pa ste bsgom pa'o ;
analyzed: 'dzin pa nges par 'dzin pa ste bsgom pa'o ;
translated: The grasping is the definite grasping, the meditation.

original: / khrus zhes pa nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: / khrus zhes pa nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The bath is an illustration.

original: kha cig tu rnal 'byor zhes 'don to //
analyzed: kha cig tu rnal 'byor zhes 'don to //
translated: In some [texts] it is recited as “yoga.”

original: 'dis ni rang dang gzhan la phan pa spyod la mkhas pa rnams kyis dpal yang dag par sbyor ba mgon po kho na yang dag par bsten par bya'o zhes gsung par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang dang gzhan la phan pa spyod la mkhas pa rnams kyis dpal yang dag par sbyor ba mgon po kho na yang dag par bsten par bya'o zhes gsung par 'gyur ro //
translated: This [verse] says that those who are skilled in benefiting themselves and others should rely on the Lord of the Yoga of the Perfect Union alone.

original: des ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dzin pa'i thod pa la sogs pa shin tu dag byed do zhes ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: des ni bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dzin pa'i thod pa la sogs pa shin tu dag byed do zhes ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that by that [yoga], the Blessed One's skull-cup and so forth are extremely pure.

original: dung zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dung zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [The verse] beginning with conch [says this].

original: dung la sogs pa rnams rang gi rgyu dag byed ma yin pa nyid du 'dod pa rnams las yang dag par byung ba rnams kyang gtsang byed nyid du 'jig rten yang dag par 'dod na /
analyzed: dung la sogs pa rnams rang gi rgyu dag byed ma yin pa nyid du 'dod pa rnams las yang dag par byung ba rnams kyang gtsang byed nyid du 'jig rten yang dag par 'dod na /
translated: Even though conches and so forth are accepted by the world as pure, they are not pure by nature, arising from impure causes.

original: gang gtsang byed kyi rgyu las byung ba de ches shin tu dag byed do zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gtsang byed kyi rgyu las byung ba de ches shin tu dag byed do zhes gsungs pa /
translated: [The verse] beginning with what [says that] what arises from a pure cause is extremely pure.

original: chos zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: [The verse] beginning with dharma [says this].

original: don dam par chos kyi sku ni de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: don dam par chos kyi sku ni de bzhin nyid rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa nyid kyis na /
translated: Ultimately, the dharmakāya is suchness, which is pure by nature.

original: dag byed kyi lus mi gang rnams kyi yin pa'o //
analyzed: dag byed kyi lus mi gang rnams kyi yin pa'o //
translated: The bodies of those who are purified.

original: thod pa zhes pa nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: thod pa zhes pa nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The skull is a mere illustration.

original: ci'i rgyus na gtsang byed ma yin pa nyid kyis smod /
analyzed: ci'i rgyus na gtsang byed ma yin pa nyid kyis smod /
translated: Why is it that he disparages it because it is not a purifier?

original: mchod phyir thogs ni mi'i snal ma bkod pa ste /
analyzed: mchod phyir thogs ni mi'i snal ma bkod pa ste /
translated: The sacred thread is a human hair braid.

original: de kho na dag byed de /
analyzed: de kho na dag byed de /
translated: That alone is a purifier.

original: thos pa dang dran pas byas pa ni ma yin no //🔽gang gi phyir bden pa ste tshad mas 'thad pa'i chos de bzhin nyid rang bzhin med @302a * //
analyzed: thos pa dang dran pas byas pa ni ma yin no // gang gi phyir bden pa ste tshad mas 'thad pa'i chos de bzhin nyid rang bzhin med @302a * //
translated: It is not made by hearing and remembering.

original: pa nyid de /
analyzed: pa nyid de /
translated: Because of the truth, that is, the valid means of knowledge, that suchness, the absence of intrinsic nature,

original: dri ma med pa nyid yongs su dag pa nyid 'dren no zhes pa tshul gang du yin pa de ni de skad do //
